  • src
  • quadpack
quadpack_double.f90
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 subroutine dgtsl ( n, c, d, e, b, info )
2 
3 !*****************************************************************************80
4 !
5 !! DGTSL solves a general tridiagonal linear system.
6 !
7 ! Licensing:
8 !
9 ! This code is distributed under the GNU LGPL license.
10 !
11 ! Modified:
12 !
13 ! 17 May 2005
14 !
15 ! Author:
16 !
17 ! FORTRAN90 version by John Burkardt.
18 !
19 ! Reference:
20 !
21 ! Jack Dongarra, Jim Bunch, Cleve Moler, Pete Stewart,
22 ! LINPACK User's Guide,
23 ! SIAM, 1979,
24 ! ISBN13: 978-0-898711-72-1,
25 ! LC: QA214.L56.
26 !
27 ! Parameters:
28 !
29 ! Input, integer ( kind = 4 ) N, the order of the tridiagonal matrix.
30 !
31 ! Input/output, real ( kind = 8 ) C(N), contains the subdiagonal of the
32 ! tridiagonal matrix in entries C(2:N). On output, C is destroyed.
33 !
34 ! Input/output, real ( kind = 8 ) D(N). On input, the diagonal of the
35 ! matrix. On output, D is destroyed.
36 !
37 ! Input/output, real ( kind = 8 ) E(N), contains the superdiagonal of the
38 ! tridiagonal matrix in entries E(1:N-1). On output E is destroyed.
39 !
40 ! Input/output, real ( kind = 8 ) B(N). On input, the right hand side.
41 ! On output, the solution.
42 !
43 ! Output, integer ( kind = 4 ) INFO, error flag.
44 ! 0, normal value.
45 ! K, the K-th element of the diagonal becomes exactly zero. The
46 ! routine returns if this error condition is detected.
47 !
48  implicit none
49 
50  integer ( kind = 4 ) n
51 
52  real ( kind = 8 ) b(n)
53  real ( kind = 8 ) c(n)
54  real ( kind = 8 ) d(n)
55  real ( kind = 8 ) e(n)
56  integer ( kind = 4 ) info
57  integer ( kind = 4 ) k
58  real ( kind = 8 ) t
59 
60  info = 0
61  c(1) = d(1)
62 
63  if ( 2 <= n ) then
64 
65  d(1) = e(1)
66  e(1) = 0.0d+00
67  e(n) = 0.0d+00
68 
69  do k = 1, n - 1
70 !
71 ! Find the larger of the two rows.
72 !
73  if ( abs( c(k) ) <= abs( c(k+1) ) ) then
74 !
75 ! Interchange rows.
76 !
77  t = c(k+1)
78  c(k+1) = c(k)
79  c(k) = t
80 
81  t = d(k+1)
82  d(k+1) = d(k)
83  d(k) = t
84 
85  t = e(k+1)
86  e(k+1) = e(k)
87  e(k) = t
88 
89  t = b(k+1)
90  b(k+1) = b(k)
91  b(k) = t
92 
93  end if
94 !
95 ! Zero elements.
96 !
97  if ( c(k) == 0.0d+00 ) then
98  info = k
99  return
100  end if
101 
102  t = -c(k+1) / c(k)
103  c(k+1) = d(k+1) + t * d(k)
104  d(k+1) = e(k+1) + t * e(k)
105  e(k+1) = 0.0d+00
106  b(k+1) = b(k+1) + t * b(k)
107 
108  end do
109 
110  end if
111 
112  if ( c(n) == 0.0d+00 ) then
113  info = n
114  return
115  end if
116 !
117 ! Back solve.
118 !
119  b(n) = b(n) / c(n)
120 
121  if ( 1 < n ) then
122 
123  b(n-1) = ( b(n-1) - d(n-1) * b(n) ) / c(n-1)
124 
125  do k = n-2, 1, -1
126  b(k) = ( b(k) - d(k) * b(k+1) - e(k) * b(k+2) ) / c(k)
127  end do
128 
129  end if
130 
131  return
132 end
133 subroutine dqage ( f, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, key, limit, result, abserr, &
134  neval, ier, alist, blist, rlist, elist, iord, last )
135 
136 !*****************************************************************************80
137 !
138 !! DQAGE estimates a definite integral.
139 !
140 ! Modified:
141 !
142 ! 11 September 2015
143 !
144 ! Author:
145 !
146 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
147 !
148 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
149 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
150 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
151 ! abs(i-reslt).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
152 !
153 ! Parameters:
154 !
155 ! on entry
156 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
157 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
158 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
159 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
160 !
161 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
162 ! lower limit of integration
163 !
164 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
165 ! upper limit of integration
166 !
167 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
168 ! absolute accuracy requested
169 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
170 ! relative accuracy requested
171 ! if epsabs.le.0
172 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
173 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
174 !
175 ! key - integer ( kind = 4 )
176 ! key for choice of local integration rule
177 ! a gauss-kronrod pair is used with
178 ! 7 - 15 points if key.lt.2,
179 ! 10 - 21 points if key = 2,
180 ! 15 - 31 points if key = 3,
181 ! 20 - 41 points if key = 4,
182 ! 25 - 51 points if key = 5,
183 ! 30 - 61 points if key.gt.5.
184 !
185 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
186 ! gives an upperbound on the number of subintervals
187 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.1.
188 !
189 ! on return
190 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
191 ! approximation to the integral
192 !
193 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
194 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
195 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
196 !
197 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
198 ! number of integrand evaluations
199 !
200 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
201 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
202 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
203 ! accuracy has been achieved.
204 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
205 ! the estimates for result and error are
206 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
207 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
208 ! error messages
209 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
210 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
211 ! subdivisions by increasing the value
212 ! of limit.
213 ! however, if this yields no improvement it
214 ! is rather advised to analyze the integrand
215 ! in order to determine the integration
216 ! difficulties. if the position of a local
217 ! difficulty can be determined(e.g.
218 ! singularity, discontinuity within the
219 ! interval) one will probably gain from
220 ! splitting up the interval at this point
221 ! and calling the integrator on the
222 ! subranges. if possible, an appropriate
223 ! special-purpose integrator should be used
224 ! which is designed for handling the type of
225 ! difficulty involved.
226 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
227 ! detected, which prevents the requested
228 ! tolerance from being achieved.
229 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
230 ! at some points of the integration
231 ! interval.
232 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
233 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
234 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
235 ! result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1) ,
236 ! elist(1) and iord(1) are set to zero.
237 ! alist(1) and blist(1) are set to a and b
238 ! respectively.
239 !
240 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
241 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
242 ! last elements of which are the left
243 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
244 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
245 !
246 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
247 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
248 ! last elements of which are the right
249 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
250 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
251 !
252 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
253 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
254 ! last elements of which are the
255 ! integral approximations on the subintervals
256 !
257 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
258 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
259 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
260 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
261 !
262 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
263 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
264 ! elements of which are pointers to the
265 ! error estimates over the subintervals,
266 ! such that elist(iord(1)), ...,
267 ! elist(iord(k)) form a decreasing sequence,
268 ! with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2), and
269 ! k = limit+1-last otherwise
270 !
271 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
272 ! number of subintervals actually produced in the
273 ! subdivision process
274 !
275 ! Local Parameters:
276 !
277 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
278 ! considered up to now
279 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
280 ! considered up to now
281 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
282 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
283 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
284 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest
285 ! error estimate
286 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
287 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
288 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
289 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
290 ! abs(result))
291 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
292 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
293 ! last - index for subdivision
294 !
295 !
296 ! machine dependent constants
297 !
298 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
299 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
300 !
301  implicit none
302 
303  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1,a2,b, &
304  blist,b1,b2,defabs,defab1,defab2,elist,epmach, &
305  epsabs,epsrel,errbnd,errmax,error1,error2,erro12,errsum,f, &
306  resabs,result,rlist,uflow
307  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,iord,iroff1,iroff2,k,key,keyf,last,limit, &
308  maxerr, nrmax, neval
309 
310  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),elist(limit),iord(limit), &
311  rlist(limit)
312 
313  external f
314 
315  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
316  uflow = tiny( uflow )
317 !
318 ! test on validity of parameters
319 !
320  ier = 0
321  neval = 0
322  last = 0
323  result = 0.0d+00
324  abserr = 0.0d+00
325  alist(1) = a
326  blist(1) = b
327  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
328  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
329  iord(1) = 0
330 
331  if(epsabs.le.0.0d+00.and. &
332  epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28)) then
333  ier = 6
334  return
335  end if
336 !
337 ! first approximation to the integral
338 !
339  keyf = key
340  if(key.le.0) keyf = 1
341  if(key.ge.7) keyf = 6
342  neval = 0
343  if(keyf.eq.1) call dqk15(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
344  if(keyf.eq.2) call dqk21(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
345  if(keyf.eq.3) call dqk31(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
346  if(keyf.eq.4) call dqk41(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
347  if(keyf.eq.5) call dqk51(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
348  if(keyf.eq.6) call dqk61(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
349  last = 1
350  rlist(1) = result
351  elist(1) = abserr
352  iord(1) = 1
353 !
354 ! test on accuracy.
355 !
356  errbnd = max( epsabs, epsrel* abs( result ) )
357 
358  if(abserr.le.0.5d+02* epmach * defabs .and. &
359  abserr.gt.errbnd) then
360  ier = 2
361  end if
362 
363  if(limit.eq.1) then
364  ier = 1
365  end if
366 
367  if ( ier .ne. 0 .or. &
368  (abserr .le. errbnd .and. abserr .ne. resabs ) .or. &
369  abserr .eq. 0.0d+00 ) then
370 
371  if(keyf.ne.1) then
372  neval = (10*keyf+1)*(2*neval+1)
373  else
374  neval = 30*neval+15
375  end if
376 
377  return
378 
379  end if
380 !
381 ! initialization
382 !
383  errmax = abserr
384  maxerr = 1
385  area = result
386  errsum = abserr
387  nrmax = 1
388  iroff1 = 0
389  iroff2 = 0
390 !
391 ! main do-loop
392 !
393  do last = 2, limit
394 !
395 ! bisect the subinterval with the largest error estimate.
396 !
397  a1 = alist(maxerr)
398  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
399  a2 = b1
400  b2 = blist(maxerr)
401 
402  if(keyf.eq.1) call dqk15(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
403  if(keyf.eq.2) call dqk21(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
404  if(keyf.eq.3) call dqk31(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
405  if(keyf.eq.4) call dqk41(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
406  if(keyf.eq.5) call dqk51(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
407  if(keyf.eq.6) call dqk61(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
408 
409  if(keyf.eq.1) call dqk15(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
410  if(keyf.eq.2) call dqk21(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
411  if(keyf.eq.3) call dqk31(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
412  if(keyf.eq.4) call dqk41(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
413  if(keyf.eq.5) call dqk51(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
414  if(keyf.eq.6) call dqk61(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
415 !
416 ! improve previous approximations to integral
417 ! and error and test for accuracy.
418 !
419  neval = neval+1
420  area12 = area1+area2
421  erro12 = error1+error2
422  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
423  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
424 
425  if ( defab1 .ne. error1 .and. defab2 .ne. error2 ) then
426 
427  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).le.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
428  .and. erro12.ge.0.99d+00*errmax) then
429  iroff1 = iroff1+1
430  end if
431 
432  if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) then
433  iroff2 = iroff2+1
434  end if
435 
436  end if
437 
438  rlist(maxerr) = area1
439  rlist(last) = area2
440  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
441 
442  if ( errbnd .lt. errsum ) then
443 !
444 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
445 !
446  if(iroff1.ge.6.or.iroff2.ge.20) then
447  ier = 2
448  end if
449 !
450 ! set error flag in the case that the number of subintervals
451 ! equals limit.
452 !
453  if(last.eq.limit) then
454  ier = 1
455  end if
456 !
457 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
458 ! at a point of the integration range.
459 !
460  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03* &
461  epmach)*( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) then
462  ier = 3
463  end if
464 
465  end if
466 !
467 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
468 !
469  if(error2.le.error1) then
470  alist(last) = a2
471  blist(maxerr) = b1
472  blist(last) = b2
473  elist(maxerr) = error1
474  elist(last) = error2
475  else
476  alist(maxerr) = a2
477  alist(last) = a1
478  blist(last) = b1
479  rlist(maxerr) = area2
480  rlist(last) = area1
481  elist(maxerr) = error2
482  elist(last) = error1
483  end if
484 !
485 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
486 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
487 ! with the largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
488 !
489  call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
490 
491  if(ier.ne.0.or.errsum.le.errbnd) then
492  exit
493  end if
494 
495  end do
496 !
497 ! compute final result.
498 !
499  result = 0.0d+00
500  do k=1,last
501  result = result+rlist(k)
502  end do
503  abserr = errsum
504 
505  if(keyf.ne.1) then
506  neval = (10*keyf+1)*(2*neval+1)
507  else
508  neval = 30*neval+15
509  end if
510 
511  return
512 end
513 subroutine dqag ( f, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, key, result, abserr, neval, ier, &
514  limit, lenw, last, iwork, work )
515 
516 !*****************************************************************************80
517 !
518 !! DQAG approximates an integral over a finite interval.
519 !
520 ! Modified:
521 !
522 ! 11 September 2015
523 !
524 ! Author:
525 !
526 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
527 !
528 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
529 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
530 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
531 ! abs(i-result)le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
532 !
533 ! Parameters:
534 !
535 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
536 ! function subprogam defining the integrand
537 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
538 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
539 !
540 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
541 ! lower limit of integration
542 !
543 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
544 ! upper limit of integration
545 !
546 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
547 ! absolute accoracy requested
548 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
549 ! relative accuracy requested
550 ! if epsabs.le.0
551 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
552 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
553 !
554 ! key - integer ( kind = 4 )
555 ! key for choice of local integration rule
556 ! a gauss-kronrod pair is used with
557 ! 7 - 15 points if key.lt.2,
558 ! 10 - 21 points if key = 2,
559 ! 15 - 31 points if key = 3,
560 ! 20 - 41 points if key = 4,
561 ! 25 - 51 points if key = 5,
562 ! 30 - 61 points if key.gt.5.
563 !
564 ! on return
565 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
566 ! approximation to the integral
567 !
568 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
569 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
570 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
571 !
572 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
573 ! number of integrand evaluations
574 !
575 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
576 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
577 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
578 ! accuracy has been achieved.
579 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
580 ! the estimates for result and error are
581 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
582 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
583 ! error messages
584 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
585 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
586 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
587 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
588 ! adjustments into account). however, if
589 ! this yield no improvement it is advised
590 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
591 ! determine the integration difficulaties.
592 ! if the position of a local difficulty can
593 ! be determined (i.e.singularity,
594 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
595 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
596 ! interval at this point and calling the
597 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
598 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
599 ! should be used which is designed for
600 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
601 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
602 ! detected, which prevents the requested
603 ! tolerance from being achieved.
604 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
605 ! at some points of the integration
606 ! interval.
607 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
608 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
609 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
610 ! or limit.lt.1 or lenw.lt.limit*4.
611 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set
612 ! to zero.
613 ! except when lenw is invalid, iwork(1),
614 ! work(limit*2+1) and work(limit*3+1) are
615 ! set to zero, work(1) is set to a and
616 ! work(limit+1) to b.
617 !
618 ! dimensioning parameters
619 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
620 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
621 ! limit determines the maximum number of subintervals
622 ! in the partition of the given integration interval
623 ! (a,b), limit.ge.1.
624 ! if limit.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
625 !
626 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
627 ! dimensioning parameter for work
628 ! lenw must be at least limit*4.
629 ! if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end with
630 ! ier = 6.
631 !
632 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
633 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
634 ! produced in the subdivision process, which
635 ! determines the number of significant elements
636 ! actually in the work arrays.
637 !
638 ! work arrays
639 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
640 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
641 ! elements of which contain pointers to the error
642 ! estimates over the subintervals, such that
643 ! work(limit*3+iwork(1)),... , work(limit*3+iwork(k))
644 ! form a decreasing sequence with k = last if
645 ! last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last otherwise
646 !
647 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
648 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
649 ! on return
650 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left end
651 ! points of the subintervals in the partition of
652 ! (a,b),
653 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain the
654 ! right end points,
655 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
656 ! the integral approximations over the subintervals,
657 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last) contain
658 ! the error estimates.
659 !
660  implicit none
661 
662  integer ( kind = 4 ) lenw
663  integer ( kind = 4 ) limit
664 
665  real ( kind = 8 ) a
666  real ( kind = 8 ) abserr
667  real ( kind = 8 ) b
668  real ( kind = 8 ) epsabs
669  real ( kind = 8 ) epsrel
670  real ( kind = 8 ), external :: f
671  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier
672  integer ( kind = 4 ) iwork(limit)
673  integer ( kind = 4 ) key
674  integer ( kind = 4 ) last
675  integer ( kind = 4 ) lvl
676  integer ( kind = 4 ) l1
677  integer ( kind = 4 ) l2
678  integer ( kind = 4 ) l3
679  integer ( kind = 4 ) neval
680  real ( kind = 8 ) result
681  real ( kind = 8 ) work(lenw)
682 !
683 ! check validity of lenw.
684 !
685  ier = 6
686  neval = 0
687  last = 0
688  result = 0.0d+00
689  abserr = 0.0d+00
690  if(limit.lt.1.or.lenw.lt.limit*4) go to 10
691 !
692 ! prepare call for dqage.
693 !
694  l1 = limit+1
695  l2 = limit+l1
696  l3 = limit+l2
697 
698  call dqage(f,a,b,epsabs,epsrel,key,limit,result,abserr,neval, &
699  ier,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),iwork,last)
700 !
701 ! call error handler if necessary.
702 !
703  lvl = 0
704 10 continue
705 
706  if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
707  if(ier.ne.0) call xerror('abnormal return from dqag ',26,ier,lvl)
708 
709  return
710 end
711 subroutine dqagie ( f, bound, inf, epsabs, epsrel, limit, result, abserr, &
712  neval, ier, alist, blist, rlist, elist, iord, last )
713 
714 !*****************************************************************************80
715 !
716 !! DQAGIE estimates an integral over a semi-infinite or infinite interval.
717 !
718 ! Modified:
719 !
720 ! 11 September 2015
721 !
722 ! Author:
723 !
724 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
725 !
726 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
727 ! integral i = integral of f over (bound,+infinity)
728 ! or i = integral of f over (-infinity,bound)
729 ! or i = integral of f over (-infinity,+infinity),
730 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
731 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i))
732 !
733 ! Parameters:
734 !
735 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
736 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
737 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
738 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
739 !
740 ! bound - real ( kind = 8 )
741 ! finite bound of integration range
742 ! (has no meaning if interval is doubly-infinite)
743 !
744 ! inf - real ( kind = 8 )
745 ! indicating the kind of integration range involved
746 ! inf = 1 corresponds to (bound,+infinity),
747 ! inf = -1 to (-infinity,bound),
748 ! inf = 2 to (-infinity,+infinity).
749 !
750 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
751 ! absolute accuracy requested
752 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
753 ! relative accuracy requested
754 ! if epsabs.le.0
755 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
756 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
757 !
758 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
759 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
760 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.1
761 !
762 ! on return
763 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
764 ! approximation to the integral
765 !
766 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
767 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
768 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
769 !
770 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
771 ! number of integrand evaluations
772 !
773 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
774 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
775 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
776 ! accuracy has been achieved.
777 ! - ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine. the
778 ! estimates for result and error are less
779 ! reliable. it is assumed that the requested
780 ! accuracy has not been achieved.
781 ! error messages
782 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
783 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
784 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
785 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
786 ! adjustments into account). however,if
787 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
788 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
789 ! determine the integration difficulties.
790 ! if the position of a local difficulty can
791 ! be determined (e.g. singularity,
792 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
793 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
794 ! interval at this point and calling the
795 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
796 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
797 ! should be used, which is designed for
798 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
799 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
800 ! detected, which prevents the requested
801 ! tolerance from being achieved.
802 ! the error may be under-estimated.
803 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
804 ! at some points of the integration
805 ! interval.
806 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
807 ! roundoff error is detected in the
808 ! extrapolation table.
809 ! it is assumed that the requested tolerance
810 ! cannot be achieved, and that the returned
811 ! result is the best which can be obtained.
812 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
813 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
814 ! divergence can occur with any other value
815 ! of ier.
816 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
817 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
818 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
819 ! result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1),
820 ! elist(1) and iord(1) are set to zero.
821 ! alist(1) and blist(1) are set to 0
822 ! and 1 respectively.
823 !
824 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
825 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
826 ! last elements of which are the left
827 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
828 ! of the transformed integration range (0,1).
829 !
830 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
831 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
832 ! last elements of which are the right
833 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
834 ! of the transformed integration range (0,1).
835 !
836 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
837 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
838 ! last elements of which are the integral
839 ! approximations on the subintervals
840 !
841 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
842 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
843 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
844 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
845 !
846 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
847 ! vector of dimension limit, the first k
848 ! elements of which are pointers to the
849 ! error estimates over the subintervals,
850 ! such that elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k))
851 ! form a decreasing sequence, with k = last
852 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
853 ! otherwise
854 !
855 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
856 ! number of subintervals actually produced
857 ! in the subdivision process
858 !
859 ! Local Parameters:
860 !
861 ! the dimension of rlist2 is determined by the value of
862 ! limexp in routine dqelg.
863 !
864 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
865 ! considered up to now
866 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
867 ! considered up to now
868 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
869 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
870 ! rlist2 - array of dimension at least (limexp+2),
871 ! containing the part of the epsilon table
872 ! wich is still needed for further computations
873 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
874 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest error
875 ! estimate
876 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
877 ! erlast - error on the interval currently subdivided
878 ! (before that subdivision has taken place)
879 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
880 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
881 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
882 ! abs(result))
883 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
884 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
885 ! last - index for subdivision
886 ! nres - number of calls to the extrapolation routine
887 ! numrl2 - number of elements currently in rlist2. if an
888 ! appropriate approximation to the compounded
889 ! integral has been obtained, it is put in
890 ! rlist2(numrl2) after numrl2 has been increased
891 ! by one.
892 ! small - length of the smallest interval considered up
893 ! to now, multiplied by 1.5
894 ! erlarg - sum of the errors over the intervals larger
895 ! than the smallest interval considered up to now
896 ! extrap - logical variable denoting that the routine
897 ! is attempting to perform extrapolation. i.e.
898 ! before subdividing the smallest interval we
899 ! try to decrease the value of erlarg.
900 ! noext - logical variable denoting that extrapolation
901 ! is no longer allowed (true-value)
902 !
903 ! machine dependent constants
904 !
905 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
906 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
907 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
908 !
909  implicit none
910 
911  real ( kind = 8 ) abseps,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1, &
912  a2,blist,boun,bound,b1,b2,correc,defabs,defab1,defab2, &
913  dres,elist,epmach,epsabs,epsrel,erlarg,erlast, &
914  errbnd,errmax,error1,error2,erro12,errsum,ertest,f,oflow,resabs, &
915  reseps,result,res3la,rlist,rlist2,small,uflow
916  integer ( kind = 4 ) id,ier,ierro,inf,iord,iroff1,iroff2, &
917  iroff3,jupbnd,k,ksgn, &
918  ktmin,last,limit,maxerr,neval,nres,nrmax,numrl2
919  logical extrap,noext
920  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),elist(limit),iord(limit), &
921  res3la(3),rlist(limit),rlist2(52)
922 
923  external f
924 
925  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
926 !
927 ! test on validity of parameters
928 !
929  ier = 0
930  neval = 0
931  last = 0
932  result = 0.0d+00
933  abserr = 0.0d+00
934  alist(1) = 0.0d+00
935  blist(1) = 0.1d+01
936  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
937  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
938  iord(1) = 0
939 
940  if(epsabs.le.0.0d+00.and.epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28)) then
941  ier = 6
942  end if
943 
944  if(ier.eq.6) then
945  return
946  end if
947 !
948 ! first approximation to the integral
949 !
950 ! determine the interval to be mapped onto (0,1).
951 ! if inf = 2 the integral is computed as i = i1+i2, where
952 ! i1 = integral of f over (-infinity,0),
953 ! i2 = integral of f over (0,+infinity).
954 !
955  boun = bound
956  if(inf.eq.2) boun = 0.0d+00
957  call dqk15i(f,boun,inf,0.0d+00,0.1d+01,result,abserr, &
958  defabs,resabs)
959 !
960 ! test on accuracy
961 !
962  last = 1
963  rlist(1) = result
964  elist(1) = abserr
965  iord(1) = 1
966  dres = abs( result)
967  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel*dres)
968  if(abserr.le.1.0d+02*epmach*defabs.and.abserr.gt.errbnd) ier = 2
969  if(limit.eq.1) ier = 1
970  if(ier.ne.0.or.(abserr.le.errbnd.and.abserr.ne.resabs).or. &
971  abserr.eq.0.0d+00) go to 130
972 !
973 ! initialization
974 !
975  uflow = tiny( uflow )
976  oflow = huge( oflow )
977  rlist2(1) = result
978  errmax = abserr
979  maxerr = 1
980  area = result
981  errsum = abserr
982  abserr = oflow
983  nrmax = 1
984  nres = 0
985  ktmin = 0
986  numrl2 = 2
987  extrap = .false.
988  noext = .false.
989  ierro = 0
990  iroff1 = 0
991  iroff2 = 0
992  iroff3 = 0
993  ksgn = -1
994  if(dres.ge.(0.1d+01-0.5d+02*epmach)*defabs) ksgn = 1
995 !
996 ! main do-loop
997 !
998  do 90 last = 2,limit
999 !
1000 ! bisect the subinterval with nrmax-th largest error estimate.
1001 !
1002  a1 = alist(maxerr)
1003  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
1004  a2 = b1
1005  b2 = blist(maxerr)
1006  erlast = errmax
1007  call dqk15i(f,boun,inf,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
1008  call dqk15i(f,boun,inf,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
1009 !
1010 ! improve previous approximations to integral
1011 ! and error and test for accuracy.
1012 !
1013  area12 = area1+area2
1014  erro12 = error1+error2
1015  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
1016  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
1017  if(defab1.eq.error1.or.defab2.eq.error2)go to 15
1018  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).gt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
1019  .or.erro12.lt.0.99d+00*errmax) go to 10
1020  if(extrap) iroff2 = iroff2+1
1021  if(.not.extrap) iroff1 = iroff1+1
1022  10 if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) iroff3 = iroff3+1
1023  15 rlist(maxerr) = area1
1024  rlist(last) = area2
1025  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
1026 !
1027 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
1028 !
1029  if(iroff1+iroff2.ge.10.or.iroff3.ge.20) ier = 2
1030  if(iroff2.ge.5) ierro = 3
1031 !
1032 ! set error flag in the case that the number of
1033 ! subintervals equals limit.
1034 !
1035  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
1036 !
1037 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
1038 ! at some points of the integration range.
1039 !
1040  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach)* &
1041  ( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) then
1042  ier = 4
1043  end if
1044 !
1045 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
1046 !
1047  if(error2.gt.error1) go to 20
1048  alist(last) = a2
1049  blist(maxerr) = b1
1050  blist(last) = b2
1051  elist(maxerr) = error1
1052  elist(last) = error2
1053  go to 30
1054  20 continue
1055 
1056  alist(maxerr) = a2
1057  alist(last) = a1
1058  blist(last) = b1
1059  rlist(maxerr) = area2
1060  rlist(last) = area1
1061  elist(maxerr) = error2
1062  elist(last) = error1
1063 !
1064 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
1065 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
1066 ! with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
1067 !
1068  30 call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
1069  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 115
1070  if(ier.ne.0) go to 100
1071  if(last.eq.2) go to 80
1072  if(noext) go to 90
1073  erlarg = erlarg-erlast
1074  if( abs( b1-a1).gt.small) erlarg = erlarg+erro12
1075  if(extrap) go to 40
1076 !
1077 ! test whether the interval to be bisected next is the
1078 ! smallest interval.
1079 !
1080  if( abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr)).gt.small) go to 90
1081  extrap = .true.
1082  nrmax = 2
1083  40 if(ierro.eq.3.or.erlarg.le.ertest) go to 60
1084 !
1085 ! the smallest interval has the largest error.
1086 ! before bisecting decrease the sum of the errors over the
1087 ! larger intervals (erlarg) and perform extrapolation.
1088 !
1089  id = nrmax
1090  jupbnd = last
1091  if(last.gt.(2+limit/2)) jupbnd = limit+3-last
1092 
1093  do k = id,jupbnd
1094  maxerr = iord(nrmax)
1095  errmax = elist(maxerr)
1096  if( abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr)).gt.small) go to 90
1097  nrmax = nrmax+1
1098  end do
1099 !
1100 ! perform extrapolation.
1101 !
1102  60 numrl2 = numrl2+1
1103  rlist2(numrl2) = area
1104  call dqelg(numrl2,rlist2,reseps,abseps,res3la,nres)
1105  ktmin = ktmin+1
1106  if(ktmin.gt.5.and.abserr.lt.0.1d-02*errsum) ier = 5
1107  if(abseps.ge.abserr) go to 70
1108  ktmin = 0
1109  abserr = abseps
1110  result = reseps
1111  correc = erlarg
1112  ertest = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( reseps))
1113  if(abserr.le.ertest) go to 100
1114 !
1115 ! prepare bisection of the smallest interval.
1116 !
1117  70 if(numrl2.eq.1) noext = .true.
1118  if(ier.eq.5) go to 100
1119  maxerr = iord(1)
1120  errmax = elist(maxerr)
1121  nrmax = 1
1122  extrap = .false.
1123  small = small*0.5d+00
1124  erlarg = errsum
1125  go to 90
1126  80 small = 0.375d+00
1127  erlarg = errsum
1128  ertest = errbnd
1129  rlist2(2) = area
1130  90 continue
1131 !
1132 ! set final result and error estimate.
1133 !
1134  100 if(abserr.eq.oflow) go to 115
1135  if((ier+ierro).eq.0) go to 110
1136  if(ierro.eq.3) abserr = abserr+correc
1137  if(ier.eq.0) ier = 3
1138  if(result.ne.0.0d+00.and.area.ne.0.0d+00)go to 105
1139  if(abserr.gt.errsum)go to 115
1140  if(area.eq.0.0d+00) go to 130
1141  go to 110
1142  105 if(abserr/ abs( result).gt.errsum/ abs( area))go to 115
1143 !
1144 ! test on divergence
1145 !
1146  110 continue
1147 
1148  if ( ksgn .eq. (-1) .and. &
1149  max( abs( result), abs( area)) .le. defabs*0.1d-01 ) then
1150  go to 130
1151  end if
1152 
1153  if ( 0.1d-01 .gt. (result/area) .or. &
1154  (result/area) .gt. 0.1d+03 .or. &
1155  errsum .gt. abs( area) ) then
1156  ier = 6
1157  end if
1158 
1159  go to 130
1160 !
1161 ! compute global integral sum.
1162 !
1163  115 result = 0.0d+00
1164  do k = 1,last
1165  result = result+rlist(k)
1166  end do
1167  abserr = errsum
1168  130 continue
1169 
1170  neval = 30*last-15
1171  if(inf.eq.2) neval = 2*neval
1172  if(ier.gt.2) ier=ier-1
1173 
1174  return
1175 end
1176 subroutine dqagi ( f, bound, inf, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, neval, &
1177  ier,limit,lenw,last,iwork,work)
1178 
1179 !*****************************************************************************80
1180 !
1181 !! DQAGI estimates an integral over a semi-infinite or infinite interval.
1182 !
1183 ! Modified:
1184 !
1185 ! 11 September 2015
1186 !
1187 ! Author:
1188 !
1189 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
1190 !
1191 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
1192 ! integral i = integral of f over (bound,+infinity)
1193 ! or i = integral of f over (-infinity,bound)
1194 ! or i = integral of f over (-infinity,+infinity)
1195 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
1196 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
1197 !
1198 ! Parameters:
1199 !
1200 ! on entry
1201 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
1202 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
1203 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
1204 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
1205 !
1206 ! bound - real ( kind = 8 )
1207 ! finite bound of integration range
1208 ! (has no meaning if interval is doubly-infinite)
1209 !
1210 ! inf - integer ( kind = 4 )
1211 ! indicating the kind of integration range involved
1212 ! inf = 1 corresponds to (bound,+infinity),
1213 ! inf = -1 to (-infinity,bound),
1214 ! inf = 2 to (-infinity,+infinity).
1215 !
1216 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
1217 ! absolute accuracy requested
1218 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
1219 ! relative accuracy requested
1220 ! if epsabs.le.0
1221 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
1222 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
1223 !
1224 !
1225 ! on return
1226 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
1227 ! approximation to the integral
1228 !
1229 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
1230 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
1231 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
1232 !
1233 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
1234 ! number of integrand evaluations
1235 !
1236 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
1237 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
1238 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
1239 ! accuracy has been achieved.
1240 ! - ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine. the
1241 ! estimates for result and error are less
1242 ! reliable. it is assumed that the requested
1243 ! accuracy has not been achieved.
1244 ! error messages
1245 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
1246 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
1247 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
1248 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
1249 ! adjustments into account). however, if
1250 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
1251 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
1252 ! determine the integration difficulties. if
1253 ! the position of a local difficulty can be
1254 ! determined (e.g. singularity,
1255 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
1256 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
1257 ! interval at this point and calling the
1258 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
1259 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
1260 ! should be used, which is designed for
1261 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
1262 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
1263 ! detected, which prevents the requested
1264 ! tolerance from being achieved.
1265 ! the error may be under-estimated.
1266 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
1267 ! at some points of the integration
1268 ! interval.
1269 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
1270 ! roundoff error is detected in the
1271 ! extrapolation table.
1272 ! it is assumed that the requested tolerance
1273 ! cannot be achieved, and that the returned
1274 ! result is the best which can be obtained.
1275 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
1276 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
1277 ! divergence can occur with any other value
1278 ! of ier.
1279 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
1280 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
1281 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
1282 ! or limit.lt.1 or leniw.lt.limit*4.
1283 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
1284 ! zero. exept when limit or leniw is
1285 ! invalid, iwork(1), work(limit*2+1) and
1286 ! work(limit*3+1) are set to zero, work(1)
1287 ! is set to a and work(limit+1) to b.
1288 !
1289 ! dimensioning parameters
1290 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
1291 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
1292 ! limit determines the maximum number of subintervals
1293 ! in the partition of the given integration interval
1294 ! (a,b), limit.ge.1.
1295 ! if limit.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
1296 !
1297 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
1298 ! dimensioning parameter for work
1299 ! lenw must be at least limit*4.
1300 ! if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end
1301 ! with ier = 6.
1302 !
1303 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
1304 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
1305 ! produced in the subdivision process, which
1306 ! determines the number of significant elements
1307 ! actually in the work arrays.
1308 !
1309 ! work arrays
1310 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
1311 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
1312 ! k elements of which contain pointers
1313 ! to the error estimates over the subintervals,
1314 ! such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)),... ,
1315 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
1316 ! sequence, with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2), and
1317 ! k = limit+1-last otherwise
1318 !
1319 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
1320 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
1321 ! on return
1322 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
1323 ! end points of the subintervals in the
1324 ! partition of (a,b),
1325 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
1326 ! the right end points,
1327 ! work(limit*2+1), ...,work(limit*2+last) contain the
1328 ! integral approximations over the subintervals,
1329 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3)
1330 ! contain the error estimates.
1331 !
1332  implicit none
1333 
1334  real ( kind = 8 ) abserr,bound,epsabs,epsrel,f,result,work
1335  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,inf,iwork,last,lenw,limit,lvl,l1,l2,l3,neval
1336 
1337  dimension iwork(limit),work(lenw)
1338 
1339  external f
1340 !
1341 ! check validity of limit and lenw.
1342 !
1343  ier = 6
1344  neval = 0
1345  last = 0
1346  result = 0.0d+00
1347  abserr = 0.0d+00
1348  if(limit.lt.1.or.lenw.lt.limit*4) go to 10
1349 !
1350 ! prepare call for dqagie.
1351 !
1352  l1 = limit+1
1353  l2 = limit+l1
1354  l3 = limit+l2
1355 
1356  call dqagie(f,bound,inf,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr, &
1357  neval,ier,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),iwork,last)
1358 !
1359 ! call error handler if necessary.
1360 !
1361  lvl = 0
1362 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
1363 
1364  if(ier.ne.0) then
1365  call xerror('abnormal return from dqagi',26,ier,lvl)
1366  end if
1367 
1368  return
1369 end
1370 subroutine dqagpe(f,a,b,npts2,points,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result, &
1371  abserr,neval,ier,alist,blist,rlist,elist,pts,iord,level,ndin, &
1372  last)
1373 
1374 !*****************************************************************************80
1375 !
1376 !! DQAGPE computes a definite integral.
1377 !
1378 ! Modified:
1379 !
1380 ! 11 September 2015
1381 !
1382 ! Author:
1383 !
1384 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
1385 !
1386 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
1387 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b), hopefully
1388 ! satisfying following claim for accuracy abs(i-result).le.
1389 ! max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)). break points of the integration
1390 ! interval, where local difficulties of the integrand may
1391 ! occur(e.g. singularities,discontinuities),provided by user.
1392 !
1393 ! Parameters:
1394 !
1395 ! on entry
1396 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
1397 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
1398 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
1399 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
1400 !
1401 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
1402 ! lower limit of integration
1403 !
1404 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
1405 ! upper limit of integration
1406 !
1407 ! npts2 - integer ( kind = 4 )
1408 ! number equal to two more than the number of
1409 ! user-supplied break points within the integration
1410 ! range, npts2.ge.2.
1411 ! if npts2.lt.2, the routine will end with ier = 6.
1412 !
1413 ! points - real ( kind = 8 )
1414 ! vector of dimension npts2, the first (npts2-2)
1415 ! elements of which are the user provided break
1416 ! points. if these points do not constitute an
1417 ! ascending sequence there will be an automatic
1418 ! sorting.
1419 !
1420 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
1421 ! absolute accuracy requested
1422 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
1423 ! relative accuracy requested
1424 ! if epsabs.le.0
1425 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
1426 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
1427 !
1428 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
1429 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
1430 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.npts2
1431 ! if limit.lt.npts2, the routine will end with
1432 ! ier = 6.
1433 !
1434 ! on return
1435 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
1436 ! approximation to the integral
1437 !
1438 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
1439 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
1440 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
1441 !
1442 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
1443 ! number of integrand evaluations
1444 !
1445 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
1446 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
1447 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
1448 ! accuracy has been achieved.
1449 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine.
1450 ! the estimates for integral and error are
1451 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
1452 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
1453 ! error messages
1454 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
1455 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
1456 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
1457 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
1458 ! adjustments into account). however, if
1459 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
1460 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
1461 ! determine the integration difficulties. if
1462 ! the position of a local difficulty can be
1463 ! determined (i.e. singularity,
1464 ! discontinuity within the interval), it
1465 ! should be supplied to the routine as an
1466 ! element of the vector points. if necessary
1467 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
1468 ! must be used, which is designed for
1469 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
1470 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
1471 ! detected, which prevents the requested
1472 ! tolerance from being achieved.
1473 ! the error may be under-estimated.
1474 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
1475 ! at some points of the integration
1476 ! interval.
1477 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
1478 ! roundoff error is detected in the
1479 ! extrapolation table. it is presumed that
1480 ! the requested tolerance cannot be
1481 ! achieved, and that the returned result is
1482 ! the best which can be obtained.
1483 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
1484 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
1485 ! divergence can occur with any other value
1486 ! of ier.gt.0.
1487 ! = 6 the input is invalid because
1488 ! npts2.lt.2 or
1489 ! break points are specified outside
1490 ! the integration range or
1491 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
1492 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
1493 ! or limit.lt.npts2.
1494 ! result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1),
1495 ! and elist(1) are set to zero. alist(1) and
1496 ! blist(1) are set to a and b respectively.
1497 !
1498 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
1499 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
1500 ! last elements of which are the left end points
1501 ! of the subintervals in the partition of the given
1502 ! integration range (a,b)
1503 !
1504 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
1505 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
1506 ! last elements of which are the right end points
1507 ! of the subintervals in the partition of the given
1508 ! integration range (a,b)
1509 !
1510 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
1511 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
1512 ! last elements of which are the integral
1513 ! approximations on the subintervals
1514 !
1515 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
1516 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
1517 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
1518 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
1519 !
1520 ! pts - real ( kind = 8 )
1521 ! vector of dimension at least npts2, containing the
1522 ! integration limits and the break points of the
1523 ! interval in ascending sequence.
1524 !
1525 ! level - integer ( kind = 4 )
1526 ! vector of dimension at least limit, containing the
1527 ! subdivision levels of the subinterval, i.e. if
1528 ! (aa,bb) is a subinterval of (p1,p2) where p1 as
1529 ! well as p2 is a user-provided break point or
1530 ! integration limit, then (aa,bb) has level l if
1531 ! abs(bb-aa) = abs(p2-p1)*2**(-l).
1532 !
1533 ! ndin - integer ( kind = 4 )
1534 ! vector of dimension at least npts2, after first
1535 ! integration over the intervals (pts(i)),pts(i+1),
1536 ! i = 0,1, ..., npts2-2, the error estimates over
1537 ! some of the intervals may have been increased
1538 ! artificially, in order to put their subdivision
1539 ! forward. if this happens for the subinterval
1540 ! numbered k, ndin(k) is put to 1, otherwise
1541 ! ndin(k) = 0.
1542 !
1543 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
1544 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
1545 ! elements of which are pointers to the
1546 ! error estimates over the subintervals,
1547 ! such that elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k))
1548 ! form a decreasing sequence, with k = last
1549 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
1550 ! otherwise
1551 !
1552 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
1553 ! number of subintervals actually produced in the
1554 ! subdivisions process
1555 !
1556 ! Local Parameters:
1557 !
1558 ! the dimension of rlist2 is determined by the value of
1559 ! limexp in routine epsalg (rlist2 should be of dimension
1560 ! (limexp+2) at least).
1561 !
1562 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
1563 ! considered up to now
1564 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
1565 ! considered up to now
1566 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
1567 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
1568 ! rlist2 - array of dimension at least limexp+2
1569 ! containing the part of the epsilon table which
1570 ! is still needed for further computations
1571 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
1572 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest error
1573 ! estimate
1574 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
1575 ! erlast - error on the interval currently subdivided
1576 ! (before that subdivision has taken place)
1577 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
1578 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
1579 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
1580 ! abs(result))
1581 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
1582 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
1583 ! last - index for subdivision
1584 ! nres - number of calls to the extrapolation routine
1585 ! numrl2 - number of elements in rlist2. if an appropriate
1586 ! approximation to the compounded integral has
1587 ! been obtained, it is put in rlist2(numrl2) after
1588 ! numrl2 has been increased by one.
1589 ! erlarg - sum of the errors over the intervals larger
1590 ! than the smallest interval considered up to now
1591 ! extrap - logical variable denoting that the routine
1592 ! is attempting to perform extrapolation. i.e.
1593 ! before subdividing the smallest interval we
1594 ! try to decrease the value of erlarg.
1595 ! noext - logical variable denoting that extrapolation is
1596 ! no longer allowed (true-value)
1597 !
1598 ! machine dependent constants
1599 !
1600 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
1601 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
1602 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
1603 !
1604  implicit none
1605 
1606  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abseps,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1, &
1607  a2,b,blist,b1,b2,correc,defabs,defab1,defab2, &
1608  dres,elist,epmach,epsabs,epsrel,erlarg,erlast,errbnd, &
1609  errmax,error1,erro12,error2,errsum,ertest,f,oflow,points,pts, &
1610  resa,resabs,reseps,result,res3la,rlist,rlist2,sgn,temp,uflow
1611  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,id,ier,ierro,ind1,ind2,iord,ip1, &
1612  iroff1,iroff2,iroff3,j, &
1613  jlow,jupbnd,k,ksgn,ktmin,last,levcur,level,levmax,limit,maxerr, &
1614  ndin,neval,nint,nintp1,npts,npts2,nres,nrmax,numrl2
1615  logical extrap,noext
1616 
1617  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),elist(limit),iord(limit), &
1618  level(limit),ndin(npts2),points(npts2),pts(npts2),res3la(3), &
1619  rlist(limit),rlist2(52)
1620 
1621  external f
1622 
1623  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
1624 !
1625 ! test on validity of parameters
1626 !
1627  ier = 0
1628  neval = 0
1629  last = 0
1630  result = 0.0d+00
1631  abserr = 0.0d+00
1632  alist(1) = a
1633  blist(1) = b
1634  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
1635  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
1636  iord(1) = 0
1637  level(1) = 0
1638  npts = npts2-2
1639  if(npts2.lt.2.or.limit.le.npts.or.(epsabs.le.0.0d+00.and. &
1640  epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28))) ier = 6
1641 
1642  if(ier.eq.6) then
1643  return
1644  end if
1645 !
1646 ! if any break points are provided, sort them into an
1647 ! ascending sequence.
1648 !
1649  sgn = 1.0d+00
1650  if(a.gt.b) sgn = -1.0d+00
1651  pts(1) = min(a,b)
1652  if(npts.eq.0) go to 15
1653  do i = 1,npts
1654  pts(i+1) = points(i)
1655  end do
1656  15 pts(npts+2) = max( a,b)
1657  nint = npts+1
1658  a1 = pts(1)
1659  if(npts.eq.0) go to 40
1660  nintp1 = nint+1
1661  do i = 1,nint
1662  ip1 = i+1
1663  do j = ip1,nintp1
1664  if(pts(i).gt.pts(j)) then
1665  temp = pts(i)
1666  pts(i) = pts(j)
1667  pts(j) = temp
1668  end if
1669  end do
1670  end do
1671  if(pts(1).ne. min(a,b).or.pts(nintp1).ne. max( a,b)) ier = 6
1672 
1673  if(ier.eq.6) then
1674  return
1675  end if
1676 !
1677 ! compute first integral and error approximations.
1678 !
1679  40 resabs = 0.0d+00
1680 
1681  do i = 1,nint
1682  b1 = pts(i+1)
1683  call dqk21(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,defabs,resa)
1684  abserr = abserr+error1
1685  result = result+area1
1686  ndin(i) = 0
1687  if(error1.eq.resa.and.error1.ne.0.0d+00) ndin(i) = 1
1688  resabs = resabs+defabs
1689  level(i) = 0
1690  elist(i) = error1
1691  alist(i) = a1
1692  blist(i) = b1
1693  rlist(i) = area1
1694  iord(i) = i
1695  a1 = b1
1696  end do
1697 
1698  errsum = 0.0d+00
1699  do i = 1,nint
1700  if(ndin(i).eq.1) elist(i) = abserr
1701  errsum = errsum+elist(i)
1702  end do
1703 !
1704 ! test on accuracy.
1705 !
1706  last = nint
1707  neval = 21*nint
1708  dres = abs( result)
1709  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel*dres)
1710  if(abserr.le.0.1d+03*epmach*resabs.and.abserr.gt.errbnd) ier = 2
1711  if(nint.eq.1) go to 80
1712 
1713  do i = 1,npts
1714  jlow = i+1
1715  ind1 = iord(i)
1716  do j = jlow,nint
1717  ind2 = iord(j)
1718  if(elist(ind1).le.elist(ind2)) then
1719  ind1 = ind2
1720  k = j
1721  end if
1722  end do
1723  if(ind1.ne.iord(i)) then
1724  iord(k) = iord(i)
1725  iord(i) = ind1
1726  end if
1727  end do
1728 
1729  if(limit.lt.npts2) ier = 1
1730  80 if(ier.ne.0.or.abserr.le.errbnd) go to 210
1731 !
1732 ! initialization
1733 !
1734  rlist2(1) = result
1735  maxerr = iord(1)
1736  errmax = elist(maxerr)
1737  area = result
1738  nrmax = 1
1739  nres = 0
1740  numrl2 = 1
1741  ktmin = 0
1742  extrap = .false.
1743  noext = .false.
1744  erlarg = errsum
1745  ertest = errbnd
1746  levmax = 1
1747  iroff1 = 0
1748  iroff2 = 0
1749  iroff3 = 0
1750  ierro = 0
1751  uflow = tiny( uflow )
1752  oflow = huge( oflow )
1753  abserr = oflow
1754  ksgn = -1
1755  if(dres.ge.(0.1d+01-0.5d+02*epmach)*resabs) ksgn = 1
1756 !
1757 ! main do-loop
1758 !
1759  do 160 last = npts2,limit
1760 !
1761 ! bisect the subinterval with the nrmax-th largest error estimate.
1762 !
1763  levcur = level(maxerr)+1
1764  a1 = alist(maxerr)
1765  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
1766  a2 = b1
1767  b2 = blist(maxerr)
1768  erlast = errmax
1769  call dqk21(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resa,defab1)
1770  call dqk21(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resa,defab2)
1771 !
1772 ! improve previous approximations to integral
1773 ! and error and test for accuracy.
1774 !
1775  neval = neval+42
1776  area12 = area1+area2
1777  erro12 = error1+error2
1778  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
1779  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
1780  if(defab1.eq.error1.or.defab2.eq.error2) go to 95
1781  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).gt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
1782  .or.erro12.lt.0.99d+00*errmax) go to 90
1783  if(extrap) iroff2 = iroff2+1
1784  if(.not.extrap) iroff1 = iroff1+1
1785  90 if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) iroff3 = iroff3+1
1786  95 level(maxerr) = levcur
1787  level(last) = levcur
1788  rlist(maxerr) = area1
1789  rlist(last) = area2
1790  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
1791 !
1792 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
1793 !
1794  if(iroff1+iroff2.ge.10.or.iroff3.ge.20) ier = 2
1795  if(iroff2.ge.5) ierro = 3
1796 !
1797 ! set error flag in the case that the number of
1798 ! subintervals equals limit.
1799 !
1800  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
1801 !
1802 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
1803 ! at a point of the integration range
1804 !
1805  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach)* &
1806  ( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) ier = 4
1807 !
1808 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
1809 !
1810  if(error2.gt.error1) go to 100
1811  alist(last) = a2
1812  blist(maxerr) = b1
1813  blist(last) = b2
1814  elist(maxerr) = error1
1815  elist(last) = error2
1816  go to 110
1817  100 alist(maxerr) = a2
1818  alist(last) = a1
1819  blist(last) = b1
1820  rlist(maxerr) = area2
1821  rlist(last) = area1
1822  elist(maxerr) = error2
1823  elist(last) = error1
1824 !
1825 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
1826 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
1827 ! with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
1828 !
1829  110 call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
1830  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 190
1831  if(ier.ne.0) go to 170
1832  if(noext) go to 160
1833  erlarg = erlarg-erlast
1834  if(levcur+1.le.levmax) erlarg = erlarg+erro12
1835  if(extrap) go to 120
1836 !
1837 ! test whether the interval to be bisected next is the
1838 ! smallest interval.
1839 !
1840  if(level(maxerr)+1.le.levmax) go to 160
1841  extrap = .true.
1842  nrmax = 2
1843  120 if(ierro.eq.3.or.erlarg.le.ertest) go to 140
1844 !
1845 ! the smallest interval has the largest error.
1846 ! before bisecting decrease the sum of the errors over
1847 ! the larger intervals (erlarg) and perform extrapolation.
1848 !
1849  id = nrmax
1850  jupbnd = last
1851  if(last.gt.(2+limit/2)) jupbnd = limit+3-last
1852 
1853  do k = id,jupbnd
1854  maxerr = iord(nrmax)
1855  errmax = elist(maxerr)
1856  if(level(maxerr)+1.le.levmax) go to 160
1857  nrmax = nrmax+1
1858  end do
1859 !
1860 ! perform extrapolation.
1861 !
1862  140 numrl2 = numrl2+1
1863  rlist2(numrl2) = area
1864  if(numrl2.le.2) go to 155
1865  call dqelg(numrl2,rlist2,reseps,abseps,res3la,nres)
1866  ktmin = ktmin+1
1867  if(ktmin.gt.5.and.abserr.lt.0.1d-02*errsum) ier = 5
1868  if(abseps.ge.abserr) go to 150
1869  ktmin = 0
1870  abserr = abseps
1871  result = reseps
1872  correc = erlarg
1873  ertest = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( reseps))
1874  if(abserr.lt.ertest) go to 170
1875 !
1876 ! prepare bisection of the smallest interval.
1877 !
1878  150 if(numrl2.eq.1) noext = .true.
1879  if(ier.ge.5) go to 170
1880  155 maxerr = iord(1)
1881  errmax = elist(maxerr)
1882  nrmax = 1
1883  extrap = .false.
1884  levmax = levmax+1
1885  erlarg = errsum
1886  160 continue
1887 !
1888 ! set the final result.
1889 !
1890  170 continue
1891 
1892  if(abserr.eq.oflow) go to 190
1893  if((ier+ierro).eq.0) go to 180
1894  if(ierro.eq.3) abserr = abserr+correc
1895  if(ier.eq.0) ier = 3
1896  if(result.ne.0.0d+00.and.area.ne.0.0d+00)go to 175
1897  if(abserr.gt.errsum)go to 190
1898  if(area.eq.0.0d+00) go to 210
1899  go to 180
1900  175 if(abserr/ abs( result).gt.errsum/ abs( area))go to 190
1901 !
1902 ! test on divergence.
1903 !
1904  180 if(ksgn.eq.(-1).and. max( abs( result), abs( area)).le. &
1905  resabs*0.1d-01) go to 210
1906  if(0.1d-01.gt.(result/area).or.(result/area).gt.0.1d+03.or. &
1907  errsum.gt. abs( area)) ier = 6
1908  go to 210
1909 !
1910 ! compute global integral sum.
1911 !
1912  190 result = 0.0d+00
1913  do k = 1,last
1914  result = result+rlist(k)
1915  end do
1916 
1917  abserr = errsum
1918  210 if(ier.gt.2) ier = ier-1
1919  result = result*sgn
1920 
1921  return
1922 end
1923 subroutine dqagp ( f, a, b, npts2, points, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, &
1924  neval, ier, leniw, lenw, last, iwork, work )
1925 
1926 !*****************************************************************************80
1927 !
1928 !! DQAGP computes a definite integral.
1929 !
1930 ! Modified:
1931 !
1932 ! 11 September 2015
1933 !
1934 ! Author:
1935 !
1936 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
1937 !
1938 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
1939 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
1940 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
1941 ! break points of the integration interval, where local
1942 ! difficulties of the integrand may occur (e.g.
1943 ! singularities, discontinuities), are provided by the user.
1944 !
1945 ! Parameters:
1946 !
1947 ! on entry
1948 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
1949 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
1950 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
1951 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
1952 !
1953 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
1954 ! lower limit of integration
1955 !
1956 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
1957 ! upper limit of integration
1958 !
1959 ! npts2 - integer ( kind = 4 )
1960 ! number equal to two more than the number of
1961 ! user-supplied break points within the integration
1962 ! range, npts.ge.2.
1963 ! if npts2.lt.2, the routine will end with ier = 6.
1964 !
1965 ! points - real ( kind = 8 )
1966 ! vector of dimension npts2, the first (npts2-2)
1967 ! elements of which are the user provided break
1968 ! points. if these points do not constitute an
1969 ! ascending sequence there will be an automatic
1970 ! sorting.
1971 !
1972 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
1973 ! absolute accuracy requested
1974 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
1975 ! relative accuracy requested
1976 ! if epsabs.le.0
1977 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
1978 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
1979 !
1980 ! on return
1981 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
1982 ! approximation to the integral
1983 !
1984 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
1985 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
1986 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
1987 !
1988 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
1989 ! number of integrand evaluations
1990 !
1991 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
1992 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
1993 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
1994 ! accuracy has been achieved.
1995 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine.
1996 ! the estimates for integral and error are
1997 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
1998 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
1999 ! error messages
2000 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
2001 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
2002 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
2003 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
2004 ! adjustments into account). however, if
2005 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
2006 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
2007 ! determine the integration difficulties. if
2008 ! the position of a local difficulty can be
2009 ! determined (i.e. singularity,
2010 ! discontinuity within the interval), it
2011 ! should be supplied to the routine as an
2012 ! element of the vector points. if necessary
2013 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
2014 ! must be used, which is designed for
2015 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
2016 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
2017 ! detected, which prevents the requested
2018 ! tolerance from being achieved.
2019 ! the error may be under-estimated.
2020 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
2021 ! at some points of the integration
2022 ! interval.
2023 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
2024 ! roundoff error is detected in the
2025 ! extrapolation table.
2026 ! it is presumed that the requested
2027 ! tolerance cannot be achieved, and that
2028 ! the returned result is the best which
2029 ! can be obtained.
2030 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
2031 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
2032 ! divergence can occur with any other value
2033 ! of ier.gt.0.
2034 ! = 6 the input is invalid because
2035 ! npts2.lt.2 or
2036 ! break points are specified outside
2037 ! the integration range or
2038 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
2039 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
2040 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
2041 ! zero. exept when leniw or lenw or npts2 is
2042 ! invalid, iwork(1), iwork(limit+1),
2043 ! work(limit*2+1) and work(limit*3+1)
2044 ! are set to zero.
2045 ! work(1) is set to a and work(limit+1)
2046 ! to b (where limit = (leniw-npts2)/2).
2047 !
2048 ! dimensioning parameters
2049 ! leniw - integer ( kind = 4 )
2050 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
2051 ! leniw determines limit = (leniw-npts2)/2,
2052 ! which is the maximum number of subintervals in the
2053 ! partition of the given integration interval (a,b),
2054 ! leniw.ge.(3*npts2-2).
2055 ! if leniw.lt.(3*npts2-2), the routine will end with
2056 ! ier = 6.
2057 !
2058 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
2059 ! dimensioning parameter for work
2060 ! lenw must be at least leniw*2-npts2.
2061 ! if lenw.lt.leniw*2-npts2, the routine will end
2062 ! with ier = 6.
2063 !
2064 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
2065 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
2066 ! produced in the subdivision process, which
2067 ! determines the number of significant elements
2068 ! actually in the work arrays.
2069 !
2070 ! work arrays
2071 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
2072 ! vector of dimension at least leniw. on return,
2073 ! the first k elements of which contain
2074 ! pointers to the error estimates over the
2075 ! subintervals, such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)),...,
2076 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
2077 ! sequence, with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2), and
2078 ! k = limit+1-last otherwise
2079 ! iwork(limit+1), ...,iwork(limit+last) contain the
2080 ! subdivision levels of the subintervals, i.e.
2081 ! if (aa,bb) is a subinterval of (p1,p2)
2082 ! where p1 as well as p2 is a user-provided
2083 ! break point or integration limit, then (aa,bb) has
2084 ! level l if abs(bb-aa) = abs(p2-p1)*2**(-l),
2085 ! iwork(limit*2+1), ..., iwork(limit*2+npts2) have
2086 ! no significance for the user,
2087 ! note that limit = (leniw-npts2)/2.
2088 !
2089 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
2090 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
2091 ! on return
2092 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
2093 ! end points of the subintervals in the
2094 ! partition of (a,b),
2095 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
2096 ! the right end points,
2097 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
2098 ! the integral approximations over the subintervals,
2099 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
2100 ! contain the corresponding error estimates,
2101 ! work(limit*4+1), ..., work(limit*4+npts2)
2102 ! contain the integration limits and the
2103 ! break points sorted in an ascending sequence.
2104 ! note that limit = (leniw-npts2)/2.
2105 !
2106  implicit none
2107 
2108  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,b,epsabs,epsrel,f,points,result,work
2109  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,iwork,last,leniw,lenw,limit,lvl,l1,l2,l3, &
2110  l4,neval,npts2
2111 
2112  dimension iwork(leniw),points(npts2),work(lenw)
2113 
2114  external f
2115 !
2116 ! check validity of limit and lenw.
2117 !
2118  ier = 6
2119  neval = 0
2120  last = 0
2121  result = 0.0d+00
2122  abserr = 0.0d+00
2123  if(leniw.lt.(3*npts2-2).or.lenw.lt.(leniw*2-npts2).or.npts2.lt.2) &
2124  go to 10
2125 !
2126 ! prepare call for dqagpe.
2127 !
2128  limit = (leniw-npts2)/2
2129  l1 = limit+1
2130  l2 = limit+l1
2131  l3 = limit+l2
2132  l4 = limit+l3
2133 
2134  call dqagpe(f,a,b,npts2,points,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr, &
2135  neval,ier,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),work(l4), &
2136  iwork(1),iwork(l1),iwork(l2),last)
2137 !
2138 ! call error handler if necessary.
2139 !
2140  lvl = 0
2141 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
2142 
2143  if(ier.ne.0) then
2144  call xerror('abnormal return from dqagp',26,ier,lvl)
2145  end if
2146 
2147  return
2148 end
2149 subroutine dqagse(f,a,b,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr,neval, &
2150  ier,alist,blist,rlist,elist,iord,last)
2151 
2152 !*****************************************************************************80
2153 !
2154 !! DQAGSE estimates the integral of a function.
2155 !
2156 ! Modified:
2157 !
2158 ! 11 September 2015
2159 !
2160 ! Author:
2161 !
2162 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
2163 !
2164 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
2165 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
2166 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
2167 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
2168 !
2169 ! Parameters:
2170 !
2171 ! on entry
2172 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
2173 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
2174 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
2175 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
2176 !
2177 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
2178 ! lower limit of integration
2179 !
2180 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
2181 ! upper limit of integration
2182 !
2183 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
2184 ! absolute accuracy requested
2185 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
2186 ! relative accuracy requested
2187 ! if epsabs.le.0
2188 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
2189 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
2190 !
2191 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
2192 ! gives an upperbound on the number of subintervals
2193 ! in the partition of (a,b)
2194 !
2195 ! on return
2196 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
2197 ! approximation to the integral
2198 !
2199 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
2200 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
2201 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
2202 !
2203 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
2204 ! number of integrand evaluations
2205 !
2206 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
2207 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
2208 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
2209 ! accuracy has been achieved.
2210 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
2211 ! the estimates for integral and error are
2212 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
2213 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
2214 ! error messages
2215 ! = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
2216 ! has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
2217 ! divisions by increasing the value of limit
2218 ! (and taking the according dimension
2219 ! adjustments into account). however, if
2220 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
2221 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
2222 ! determine the integration difficulties. if
2223 ! the position of a local difficulty can be
2224 ! determined (e.g. singularity,
2225 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
2226 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
2227 ! interval at this point and calling the
2228 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
2229 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
2230 ! should be used, which is designed for
2231 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
2232 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
2233 ! ted, which prevents the requested
2234 ! tolerance from being achieved.
2235 ! the error may be under-estimated.
2236 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour
2237 ! occurs at some points of the integration
2238 ! interval.
2239 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
2240 ! roundoff error is detected in the
2241 ! extrapolation table.
2242 ! it is presumed that the requested
2243 ! tolerance cannot be achieved, and that the
2244 ! returned result is the best which can be
2245 ! obtained.
2246 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
2247 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
2248 ! divergence can occur with any other value
2249 ! of ier.
2250 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
2251 ! epsabs.le.0 and
2252 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28).
2253 ! result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1),
2254 ! iord(1) and elist(1) are set to zero.
2255 ! alist(1) and blist(1) are set to a and b
2256 ! respectively.
2257 !
2258 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
2259 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2260 ! last elements of which are the left end points
2261 ! of the subintervals in the partition of the
2262 ! given integration range (a,b)
2263 !
2264 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
2265 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2266 ! last elements of which are the right end points
2267 ! of the subintervals in the partition of the given
2268 ! integration range (a,b)
2269 !
2270 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
2271 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2272 ! last elements of which are the integral
2273 ! approximations on the subintervals
2274 !
2275 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
2276 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2277 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
2278 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
2279 !
2280 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
2281 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
2282 ! elements of which are pointers to the
2283 ! error estimates over the subintervals,
2284 ! such that elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k))
2285 ! form a decreasing sequence, with k = last
2286 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
2287 ! otherwise
2288 !
2289 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
2290 ! number of subintervals actually produced in the
2291 ! subdivision process
2292 !
2293 ! Local parameters:
2294 !
2295 ! the dimension of rlist2 is determined by the value of
2296 ! limexp in routine dqelg (rlist2 should be of dimension
2297 ! (limexp+2) at least).
2298 !
2299 ! list of major variables
2300 !
2301 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
2302 ! considered up to now
2303 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
2304 ! considered up to now
2305 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
2306 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
2307 ! rlist2 - array of dimension at least limexp+2 containing
2308 ! the part of the epsilon table which is still
2309 ! needed for further computations
2310 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
2311 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest error
2312 ! estimate
2313 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
2314 ! erlast - error on the interval currently subdivided
2315 ! (before that subdivision has taken place)
2316 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
2317 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
2318 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
2319 ! abs(result))
2320 ! *****1 - variable for the left interval
2321 ! *****2 - variable for the right interval
2322 ! last - index for subdivision
2323 ! nres - number of calls to the extrapolation routine
2324 ! numrl2 - number of elements currently in rlist2. if an
2325 ! appropriate approximation to the compounded
2326 ! integral has been obtained it is put in
2327 ! rlist2(numrl2) after numrl2 has been increased
2328 ! by one.
2329 ! small - length of the smallest interval considered up
2330 ! to now, multiplied by 1.5
2331 ! erlarg - sum of the errors over the intervals larger
2332 ! than the smallest interval considered up to now
2333 ! extrap - logical variable denoting that the routine is
2334 ! attempting to perform extrapolation i.e. before
2335 ! subdividing the smallest interval we try to
2336 ! decrease the value of erlarg.
2337 ! noext - logical variable denoting that extrapolation
2338 ! is no longer allowed (true value)
2339 !
2340 ! machine dependent constants
2341 !
2342 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
2343 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
2344 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
2345 !
2346  implicit none
2347 
2348  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abseps,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1, &
2349  a2,b,blist,b1,b2,correc,defabs,defab1,defab2, &
2350  dres,elist,epmach,epsabs,epsrel,erlarg,erlast,errbnd,errmax, &
2351  error1,error2,erro12,errsum,ertest,f,oflow,resabs,reseps,result, &
2352  res3la,rlist,rlist2,small,uflow
2353  integer ( kind = 4 ) id,ier,ierro,iord,iroff1,iroff2,iroff3,jupbnd, &
2354  k,ksgn,ktmin,last,limit,maxerr,neval,nres,nrmax,numrl2
2355  logical extrap,noext
2356  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),elist(limit),iord(limit), &
2357  res3la(3),rlist(limit),rlist2(52)
2358 
2359  external f
2360 
2361  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
2362 !
2363 ! test on validity of parameters
2364 !
2365  ier = 0
2366  neval = 0
2367  last = 0
2368  result = 0.0d+00
2369  abserr = 0.0d+00
2370  alist(1) = a
2371  blist(1) = b
2372  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
2373  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
2374 
2375  if(epsabs.le.0.0d+00.and.epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28)) then
2376  ier = 6
2377  return
2378  end if
2379 !
2380 ! first approximation to the integral
2381 !
2382  uflow = tiny( uflow )
2383  oflow = huge( oflow )
2384  ierro = 0
2385  call dqk21(f,a,b,result,abserr,defabs,resabs)
2386 !
2387 ! test on accuracy.
2388 !
2389  dres = abs( result)
2390  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel*dres)
2391  last = 1
2392  rlist(1) = result
2393  elist(1) = abserr
2394  iord(1) = 1
2395  if(abserr.le.1.0d+02*epmach*defabs.and.abserr.gt.errbnd) ier = 2
2396  if(limit.eq.1) ier = 1
2397  if(ier.ne.0.or.(abserr.le.errbnd.and.abserr.ne.resabs).or. &
2398  abserr.eq.0.0d+00) go to 140
2399 !
2400 ! initialization
2401 !
2402  rlist2(1) = result
2403  errmax = abserr
2404  maxerr = 1
2405  area = result
2406  errsum = abserr
2407  abserr = oflow
2408  nrmax = 1
2409  nres = 0
2410  numrl2 = 2
2411  ktmin = 0
2412  extrap = .false.
2413  noext = .false.
2414  iroff1 = 0
2415  iroff2 = 0
2416  iroff3 = 0
2417  ksgn = -1
2418  if(dres.ge.(0.1d+01-0.5d+02*epmach)*defabs) ksgn = 1
2419 !
2420 ! main do-loop
2421 !
2422  do 90 last = 2,limit
2423 !
2424 ! bisect the subinterval with the nrmax-th largest error estimate.
2425 !
2426  a1 = alist(maxerr)
2427  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
2428  a2 = b1
2429  b2 = blist(maxerr)
2430  erlast = errmax
2431  call dqk21(f,a1,b1,area1,error1,resabs,defab1)
2432  call dqk21(f,a2,b2,area2,error2,resabs,defab2)
2433 !
2434 ! improve previous approximations to integral
2435 ! and error and test for accuracy.
2436 !
2437  area12 = area1+area2
2438  erro12 = error1+error2
2439  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
2440  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
2441  if(defab1.eq.error1.or.defab2.eq.error2) go to 15
2442  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).gt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
2443  .or.erro12.lt.0.99d+00*errmax) go to 10
2444  if(extrap) iroff2 = iroff2+1
2445  if(.not.extrap) iroff1 = iroff1+1
2446  10 if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) iroff3 = iroff3+1
2447  15 rlist(maxerr) = area1
2448  rlist(last) = area2
2449  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
2450 !
2451 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
2452 !
2453  if(iroff1+iroff2.ge.10.or.iroff3.ge.20) ier = 2
2454  if(iroff2.ge.5) ierro = 3
2455 !
2456 ! set error flag in the case that the number of subintervals
2457 ! equals limit.
2458 !
2459  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
2460 !
2461 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
2462 ! at a point of the integration range.
2463 !
2464  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach)* &
2465  ( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) ier = 4
2466 !
2467 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
2468 !
2469  if(error2.gt.error1) go to 20
2470  alist(last) = a2
2471  blist(maxerr) = b1
2472  blist(last) = b2
2473  elist(maxerr) = error1
2474  elist(last) = error2
2475  go to 30
2476  20 alist(maxerr) = a2
2477  alist(last) = a1
2478  blist(last) = b1
2479  rlist(maxerr) = area2
2480  rlist(last) = area1
2481  elist(maxerr) = error2
2482  elist(last) = error1
2483 !
