2484 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
2485 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
2486 ! with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
2487 !
2488  30 call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
2489  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 115
2490  if(ier.ne.0) go to 100
2491  if(last.eq.2) go to 80
2492  if(noext) go to 90
2493  erlarg = erlarg-erlast
2494  if( abs( b1-a1).gt.small) erlarg = erlarg+erro12
2495  if(extrap) go to 40
2496 !
2497 ! test whether the interval to be bisected next is the
2498 ! smallest interval.
2499 !
2500  if( abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr)).gt.small) go to 90
2501  extrap = .true.
2502  nrmax = 2
2503  40 if(ierro.eq.3.or.erlarg.le.ertest) go to 60
2504 !
2505 ! the smallest interval has the largest error.
2506 ! before bisecting decrease the sum of the errors over the
2507 ! larger intervals (erlarg) and perform extrapolation.
2508 !
2509  id = nrmax
2510  jupbnd = last
2511  if(last.gt.(2+limit/2)) jupbnd = limit+3-last
2512  do k = id,jupbnd
2513  maxerr = iord(nrmax)
2514  errmax = elist(maxerr)
2515  if( abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr)).gt.small) go to 90
2516  nrmax = nrmax+1
2517  end do
2518 !
2519 ! perform extrapolation.
2520 !
2521  60 numrl2 = numrl2+1
2522  rlist2(numrl2) = area
2523  call dqelg(numrl2,rlist2,reseps,abseps,res3la,nres)
2524  ktmin = ktmin+1
2525  if(ktmin.gt.5.and.abserr.lt.0.1d-02*errsum) ier = 5
2526  if(abseps.ge.abserr) go to 70
2527  ktmin = 0
2528  abserr = abseps
2529  result = reseps
2530  correc = erlarg
2531  ertest = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( reseps))
2532  if(abserr.le.ertest) go to 100
2533 !
2534 ! prepare bisection of the smallest interval.
2535 !
2536  70 if(numrl2.eq.1) noext = .true.
2537  if(ier.eq.5) go to 100
2538  maxerr = iord(1)
2539  errmax = elist(maxerr)
2540  nrmax = 1
2541  extrap = .false.
2542  small = small*0.5d+00
2543  erlarg = errsum
2544  go to 90
2545  80 small = abs( b-a)*0.375d+00
2546  erlarg = errsum
2547  ertest = errbnd
2548  rlist2(2) = area
2549  90 continue
2550 !
2551 ! set final result and error estimate.
2552 !
2553  100 if(abserr.eq.oflow) go to 115
2554  if(ier+ierro.eq.0) go to 110
2555  if(ierro.eq.3) abserr = abserr+correc
2556  if(ier.eq.0) ier = 3
2557  if(result.ne.0.0d+00.and.area.ne.0.0d+00) go to 105
2558  if(abserr.gt.errsum) go to 115
2559  if(area.eq.0.0d+00) go to 130
2560  go to 110
2561  105 if(abserr/ abs( result).gt.errsum/ abs( area)) go to 115
2562 !
2563 ! test on divergence.
2564 !
2565  110 if(ksgn.eq.(-1).and. max( abs( result), abs( area)).le. &
2566  defabs*0.1d-01) go to 130
2567  if(0.1d-01.gt.(result/area).or.(result/area).gt.0.1d+03 &
2568  .or.errsum.gt. abs( area)) ier = 6
2569  go to 130
2570 !
2571 ! compute global integral sum.
2572 !
2573  115 result = 0.0d+00
2574  do k = 1,last
2575  result = result+rlist(k)
2576  end do
2577  abserr = errsum
2578  130 if(ier.gt.2) ier = ier-1
2579  140 neval = 42*last-21
2580 
2581  return
2582 end
2583 subroutine dqags ( f, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, neval, ier, &
2584  limit, lenw, last, iwork, work )
2585 
2586 !*****************************************************************************80
2587 !
2588 !! DQAGS estimates the integral of a function.
2589 !
2590 ! Modified:
2591 !
2592 ! 11 September 2015
2593 !
2594 ! Author:
2595 !
2596 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
2597 !
2598 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
2599 ! definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
2600 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
2601 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
2602 !
2603 ! Parameters:
2604 !
2605 ! on entry
2606 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
2607 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
2608 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
2609 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
2610 !
2611 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
2612 ! lower limit of integration
2613 !
2614 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
2615 ! upper limit of integration
2616 !
2617 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
2618 ! absolute accuracy requested
2619 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
2620 ! relative accuracy requested
2621 ! if epsabs.le.0
2622 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
2623 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
2624 !
2625 ! on return
2626 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
2627 ! approximation to the integral
2628 !
2629 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
2630 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
2631 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
2632 !
2633 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
2634 ! number of integrand evaluations
2635 !
2636 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
2637 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
2638 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
2639 ! accuracy has been achieved.
2640 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
2641 ! the estimates for integral and error are
2642 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
2643 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
2644 ! error messages
2645 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
2646 ! has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
2647 ! divisions by increasing the value of limit
2648 ! (and taking the according dimension
2649 ! adjustments into account. however, if
2650 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
2651 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
2652 ! determine the integration difficulties. if
2653 ! the position of a local difficulty can be
2654 ! determined (e.g. singularity,
2655 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
2656 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
2657 ! interval at this point and calling the
2658 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
2659 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
2660 ! should be used, which is designed for
2661 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
2662 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
2663 ! ted, which prevents the requested
2664 ! tolerance from being achieved.
2665 ! the error may be under-estimated.
2666 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour
2667 ! occurs at some points of the integration
2668 ! interval.
2669 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
2670 ! roundoff error is detected in the
2671 ! extrapolation table. it is presumed that
2672 ! the requested tolerance cannot be
2673 ! achieved, and that the returned result is
2674 ! the best which can be obtained.
2675 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
2676 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
2677 ! divergence can occur with any other value
2678 ! of ier.
2679 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
2680 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
2681 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28)
2682 ! or limit.lt.1 or lenw.lt.limit*4.
2683 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
2684 ! zero.except when limit or lenw is invalid,
2685 ! iwork(1), work(limit*2+1) and
2686 ! work(limit*3+1) are set to zero, work(1)
2687 ! is set to a and work(limit+1) to b.
2688 !
2689 ! dimensioning parameters
2690 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
2691 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
2692 ! limit determines the maximum number of subintervals
2693 ! in the partition of the given integration interval
2694 ! (a,b), limit.ge.1.
2695 ! if limit.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
2696 !
2697 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
2698 ! dimensioning parameter for work
2699 ! lenw must be at least limit*4.
2700 ! if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end
2701 ! with ier = 6.
2702 !
2703 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
2704 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
2705 ! produced in the subdivision process, detemines the
2706 ! number of significant elements actually in the work
2707 ! arrays.
2708 !
2709 ! work arrays
2710 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
2711 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
2712 ! elements of which contain pointers
2713 ! to the error estimates over the subintervals
2714 ! such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)),... ,
2715 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
2716 ! sequence, with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2),
2717 ! and k = limit+1-last otherwise
2718 !
2719 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
2720 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
2721 ! on return
2722 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
2723 ! end-points of the subintervals in the
2724 ! partition of (a,b),
2725 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
2726 ! the right end-points,
2727 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
2728 ! the integral approximations over the subintervals,
2729 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
2730 ! contain the error estimates.
2731 !
2732  implicit none
2733 
2734  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,b,epsabs,epsrel,f,result,work
2735  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,iwork,last,lenw,limit,lvl,l1,l2,l3,neval
2736  dimension iwork(limit),work(lenw)
2737 
2738  external f
2739 !
2740 ! check validity of limit and lenw.
2741 !
2742  ier = 6
2743  neval = 0
2744  last = 0
2745  result = 0.0d+00
2746  abserr = 0.0d+00
2747  if(limit.lt.1.or.lenw.lt.limit*4) go to 10
2748 !
2749 ! prepare call for dqagse.
2750 !
2751  l1 = limit+1
2752  l2 = limit+l1
2753  l3 = limit+l2
2754 
2755  call dqagse(f,a,b,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr,neval, &
2756  ier,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),iwork,last)
2757 !
2758 ! call error handler if necessary.
2759 !
2760  lvl = 0
2761 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
2762  if(ier.ne.0) call xerror('abnormal return from dqags',26,ier,lvl)
2763 
2764  return
2765 end
2766 subroutine dqawce(f,a,b,c,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr,neval, &
2767  ier,alist,blist,rlist,elist,iord,last)
2768 
2769 !*****************************************************************************80
2770 !
2771 !! DQAWCE computes a Cauchy principal value.
2772 !
2773 ! Modified:
2774 !
2775 ! 11 September 2015
2776 !
2777 ! Author:
2778 !
2779 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
2780 !
2781 !*** purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a
2782 ! cauchy principal value i = integral of f*w over (a,b)
2783 ! (w(x) = 1/(x-c), (c.ne.a, c.ne.b), hopefully satisfying
2784 ! following claim for accuracy
2785 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i))
2786 !
2787 ! Parameters:
2788 !
2789 ! on entry
2790 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
2791 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
2792 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
2793 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
2794 !
2795 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
2796 ! lower limit of integration
2797 !
2798 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
2799 ! upper limit of integration
2800 !
2801 ! c - real ( kind = 8 )
2802 ! parameter in the weight function, c.ne.a, c.ne.b
2803 ! if c = a or c = b, the routine will end with
2804 ! ier = 6.
2805 !
2806 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
2807 ! absolute accuracy requested
2808 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
2809 ! relative accuracy requested
2810 ! if epsabs.le.0
2811 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
2812 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
2813 !
2814 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
2815 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
2816 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.1
2817 !
2818 ! on return
2819 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
2820 ! approximation to the integral
2821 !
2822 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
2823 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
2824 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
2825 !
2826 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
2827 ! number of integrand evaluations
2828 !
2829 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
2830 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
2831 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
2832 ! accuracy has been achieved.
2833 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
2834 ! the estimates for integral and error are
2835 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
2836 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
2837 ! error messages
2838 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
2839 ! has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
2840 ! divisions by increasing the value of
2841 ! limit. however, if this yields no
2842 ! improvement it is advised to analyze the
2843 ! the integrand, in order to determine the
2844 ! the integration difficulties. if the
2845 ! position of a local difficulty can be
2846 ! determined (e.g. singularity,
2847 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
2848 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
2849 ! interval at this point and calling
2850 ! appropriate integrators on the subranges.
2851 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
2852 ! ted, which prevents the requested
2853 ! tolerance from being achieved.
2854 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour
2855 ! occurs at some interior points of
2856 ! the integration interval.
2857 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
2858 ! c = a or c = b or
2859 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
2860 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
2861 ! or limit.lt.1.
2862 ! result, abserr, neval, rlist(1), elist(1),
2863 ! iord(1) and last are set to zero. alist(1)
2864 ! and blist(1) are set to a and b
2865 ! respectively.
2866 !
2867 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
2868 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2869 ! last elements of which are the left
2870 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
2871 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
2872 !
2873 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
2874 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2875 ! last elements of which are the right
2876 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
2877 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
2878 !
2879 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
2880 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
2881 ! last elements of which are the integral
2882 ! approximations on the subintervals
2883 !
2884 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
2885 ! vector of dimension limit, the first last
2886 ! elements of which are the moduli of the absolute
2887 ! error estimates on the subintervals
2888 !
2889 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
2890 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
2891 ! elements of which are pointers to the error
2892 ! estimates over the subintervals, so that
2893 ! elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k)) with k = last
2894 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
2895 ! otherwise, form a decreasing sequence
2896 !
2897 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
2898 ! number of subintervals actually produced in
2899 ! the subdivision process
2900 !
2901 ! Local Parameters:
2902 !
2903 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
2904 ! considered up to now
2905 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
2906 ! considered up to now
2907 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
2908 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
2909 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
2910 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest
2911 ! error estimate
2912 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
2913 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
2914 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
2915 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
2916 ! abs(result))
2917 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
2918 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
2919 ! last - index for subdivision
2920 !
2921 !
2922 ! machine dependent constants
2923 !
2924 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
2925 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
2926 !
2927  implicit none
2928 
2929  real ( kind = 8 ) a,aa,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1,a2, &
2930  b,bb,blist,b1,b2,c,elist,epmach,epsabs,epsrel, &
2931  errbnd,errmax,error1,erro12,error2,errsum,f,result,rlist,uflow
2932  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,iord,iroff1,iroff2,k,krule,last,limit,&
2933  maxerr, nev, &
2934  neval,nrmax
2935  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),rlist(limit),elist(limit), &
2936  iord(limit)
2937 
2938  external f
2939 
2940  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
2941  uflow = tiny( uflow )
2942 !
2943 ! test on validity of parameters
2944 !
2945  ier = 6
2946  neval = 0
2947  last = 0
2948  alist(1) = a
2949  blist(1) = b
2950  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
2951  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
2952  iord(1) = 0
2953  result = 0.0d+00
2954  abserr = 0.0d+00
2955 
2956  if ( c.eq.a .or. &
2957  c.eq.b .or. &
2958  (epsabs.le.0.0d+00 .and. epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28)) ) then
2959  ier = 6
2960  return
2961  end if
2962 !
2963 ! first approximation to the integral
2964 !
2965  if ( a <= b ) then
2966  aa=a
2967  bb=b
2968  else
2969  aa=b
2970  bb=a
2971  end if
2972 
2973  ier=0
2974  krule = 1
2975  call dqc25c(f,aa,bb,c,result,abserr,krule,neval)
2976  last = 1
2977  rlist(1) = result
2978  elist(1) = abserr
2979  iord(1) = 1
2980  alist(1) = a
2981  blist(1) = b
2982 !
2983 ! test on accuracy
2984 !
2985  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( result))
2986  if(limit.eq.1) ier = 1
2987 
2988  if(abserr.lt. min(0.1d-01* abs( result),errbnd) &
2989  .or.ier.eq.1) go to 70
2990 !
2991 ! initialization
2992 !
2993  alist(1) = aa
2994  blist(1) = bb
2995  rlist(1) = result
2996  errmax = abserr
2997  maxerr = 1
2998  area = result
2999  errsum = abserr
3000  nrmax = 1
3001  iroff1 = 0
3002  iroff2 = 0
3003 !
3004 ! main do-loop
3005 !
3006  do 40 last = 2,limit
3007 !
3008 ! bisect the subinterval with nrmax-th largest error estimate.
3009 !
3010  a1 = alist(maxerr)
3011  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
3012  b2 = blist(maxerr)
3013  if(c.le.b1.and.c.gt.a1) b1 = 0.5d+00*(c+b2)
3014  if(c.gt.b1.and.c.lt.b2) b1 = 0.5d+00*(a1+c)
3015  a2 = b1
3016  krule = 2
3017  call dqc25c(f,a1,b1,c,area1,error1,krule,nev)
3018  neval = neval+nev
3019  call dqc25c(f,a2,b2,c,area2,error2,krule,nev)
3020  neval = neval+nev
3021 !
3022 ! improve previous approximations to integral
3023 ! and error and test for accuracy.
3024 !
3025  area12 = area1+area2
3026  erro12 = error1+error2
3027  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
3028  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
3029  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).lt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
3030  .and.erro12.ge.0.99d+00*errmax.and.krule.eq.0) &
3031  iroff1 = iroff1+1
3032  if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax.and.krule.eq.0) &
3033  iroff2 = iroff2+1
3034  rlist(maxerr) = area1
3035  rlist(last) = area2
3036  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
3037  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 15
3038 !
3039 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
3040 !
3041  if(iroff1.ge.6.and.iroff2.gt.20) ier = 2
3042 !
3043 ! set error flag in the case that number of interval bisections exceeds limit.
3044 !
3045  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
3046 !
3047 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
3048 ! at a point of the integration range.
3049 !
3050  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach) &
3051  *( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) ier = 3
3052 !
3053 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
3054 !
3055  15 continue
3056 
3057  if ( error2 .le. error1 ) then
3058  alist(last) = a2
3059  blist(maxerr) = b1
3060  blist(last) = b2
3061  elist(maxerr) = error1
3062  elist(last) = error2
3063  else
3064  alist(maxerr) = a2
3065  alist(last) = a1
3066  blist(last) = b1
3067  rlist(maxerr) = area2
3068  rlist(last) = area1
3069  elist(maxerr) = error2
3070  elist(last) = error1
3071  end if
3072 !
3073 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
3074 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
3075 ! with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
3076 !
3077  call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
3078 
3079  if(ier.ne.0.or.errsum.le.errbnd) go to 50
3080 
3081  40 continue
3082 !
3083 ! compute final result.
3084 !
3085  50 continue
3086 
3087  result = 0.0d+00
3088  do k=1,last
3089  result = result+rlist(k)
3090  end do
3091 
3092  abserr = errsum
3093  70 if (aa.eq.b) result=-result
3094 
3095  return
3096 end
3097 subroutine dqawc ( f, a, b, c, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, neval, ier, &
3098  limit, lenw, last, iwork, work )
3099 
3100 !*****************************************************************************80
3101 !
3102 !! DQAWC computes a Cauchy principal value.
3103 !
3104 ! Modified:
3105 !
3106 ! 11 September 2015
3107 !
3108 ! Author:
3109 !
3110 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
3111 !
3112 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a
3113 ! cauchy principal value i = integral of f*w over (a,b)
3114 ! (w(x) = 1/((x-c), c.ne.a, c.ne.b), hopefully satisfying
3115 ! following claim for accuracy
3116 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabe,epsrel*abs(i)).
3117 !
3118 ! Parameters:
3119 !
3120 ! on entry
3121 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
3122 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
3123 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
3124 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
3125 !
3126 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
3127 ! under limit of integration
3128 !
3129 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
3130 ! upper limit of integration
3131 !
3132 ! c - parameter in the weight function, c.ne.a, c.ne.b.
3133 ! if c = a or c = b, the routine will end with
3134 ! ier = 6 .
3135 !
3136 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
3137 ! absolute accuracy requested
3138 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
3139 ! relative accuracy requested
3140 ! if epsabs.le.0
3141 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
3142 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
3143 !
3144 ! on return
3145 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
3146 ! approximation to the integral
3147 !
3148 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
3149 ! estimate or the modulus of the absolute error,
3150 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
3151 !
3152 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
3153 ! number of integrand evaluations
3154 !
3155 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
3156 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
3157 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
3158 ! accuracy has been achieved.
3159 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
3160 ! the estimates for integral and error are
3161 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
3162 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
3163 ! error messages
3164 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
3165 ! has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
3166 ! divisions by increasing the value of limit
3167 ! (and taking the according dimension
3168 ! adjustments into account). however, if
3169 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
3170 ! to analyze the integrand in order to
3171 ! determine the integration difficulties.
3172 ! if the position of a local difficulty
3173 ! can be determined (e.g. singularity,
3174 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
3175 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
3176 ! interval at this point and calling
3177 ! appropriate integrators on the subranges.
3178 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
3179 ! ted, which prevents the requested
3180 ! tolerance from being achieved.
3181 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
3182 ! at some points of the integration
3183 ! interval.
3184 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
3185 ! c = a or c = b or
3186 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
3187 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
3188 ! or limit.lt.1 or lenw.lt.limit*4.
3189 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
3190 ! zero. exept when lenw or limit is invalid,
3191 ! iwork(1), work(limit*2+1) and
3192 ! work(limit*3+1) are set to zero, work(1)
3193 ! is set to a and work(limit+1) to b.
3194 !
3195 ! dimensioning parameters
3196 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
3197 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
3198 ! limit determines the maximum number of subintervals
3199 ! in the partition of the given integration interval
3200 ! (a,b), limit.ge.1.
3201 ! if limit.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3202 !
3203 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
3204 ! dimensioning parameter for work
3205 ! lenw must be at least limit*4.
3206 ! if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end with
3207 ! ier = 6.
3208 !
3209 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
3210 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
3211 ! produced in the subdivision process, which
3212 ! determines the number of significant elements
3213 ! actually in the work arrays.
3214 !
3215 ! work arrays
3216 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
3217 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
3218 ! elements of which contain pointers
3219 ! to the error estimates over the subintervals,
3220 ! such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)), ... ,
3221 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
3222 ! sequence, with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2),
3223 ! and k = limit+1-last otherwise
3224 !
3225 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
3226 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
3227 ! on return
3228 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
3229 ! end points of the subintervals in the
3230 ! partition of (a,b),
3231 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
3232 ! the right end points,
3233 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
3234 ! the integral approximations over the subintervals,
3235 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
3236 ! contain the error estimates.
3237 !
3238  implicit none
3239 
3240  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,b,c,epsabs,epsrel,f,result,work
3241  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,iwork,last,lenw,limit,lvl,l1,l2,l3,neval
3242  dimension iwork(limit),work(lenw)
3243 
3244  external f
3245 !
3246 ! check validity of limit and lenw.
3247 !
3248  ier = 6
3249  neval = 0
3250  last = 0
3251  result = 0.0d+00
3252  abserr = 0.0d+00
3253  if(limit.lt.1.or.lenw.lt.limit*4) go to 10
3254 !
3255 ! prepare call for dqawce.
3256 !
3257  l1 = limit+1
3258  l2 = limit+l1
3259  l3 = limit+l2
3260  call dqawce(f,a,b,c,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result,abserr,neval,ier, &
3261  work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),iwork,last)
3262 !
3263 ! call error handler if necessary.
3264 !
3265  lvl = 0
3266 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
3267 
3268  if(ier.ne.0) then
3269  call xerror('abnormal return from dqawc',26,ier,lvl)
3270  end if
3271 
3272  return
3273 end
3274 subroutine dqawfe(f,a,omega,integr,epsabs,limlst,limit,maxp1, &
3275  result,abserr,neval,ier,rslst,erlst,ierlst,lst,alist,blist, &
3276  rlist,elist,iord,nnlog,chebmo)
3277 
3278 !*****************************************************************************80
3279 !
3280 !! DQAWFE computes Fourier integrals.
3281 !
3282 ! Modified:
3283 !
3284 ! 11 September 2015
3285 !
3286 ! Author:
3287 !
3288 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
3289 !
3290 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a
3291 ! given fourier integal
3292 ! i = integral of f(x)*w(x) over (a,infinity)
3293 ! where w(x)=cos(omega*x) or w(x)=sin(omega*x),
3294 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
3295 ! abs(i-result).le.epsabs.
3296 !
3297 ! Parameters:
3298 !
3299 ! on entry
3300 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
3301 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
3302 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to
3303 ! be declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
3304 !
3305 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
3306 ! lower limit of integration
3307 !
3308 ! omega - real ( kind = 8 )
3309 ! parameter in the weight function
3310 !
3311 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
3312 ! indicates which weight function is used
3313 ! integr = 1 w(x) = cos(omega*x)
3314 ! integr = 2 w(x) = sin(omega*x)
3315 ! if integr.ne.1.and.integr.ne.2, the routine will
3316 ! end with ier = 6.
3317 !
3318 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
3319 ! absolute accuracy requested, epsabs.gt.0
3320 ! if epsabs.le.0, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3321 !
3322 ! limlst - integer ( kind = 4 )
3323 ! limlst gives an upper bound on the number of
3324 ! cycles, limlst.ge.1.
3325 ! if limlst.lt.3, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3326 !
3327 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
3328 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
3329 ! allowed in the partition of each cycle, limit.ge.1
3330 ! each cycle, limit.ge.1.
3331 !
3332 ! maxp1 - integer ( kind = 4 )
3333 ! gives an upper bound on the number of
3334 ! chebyshev moments which can be stored, i.e.
3335 ! for the intervals of lengths abs(b-a)*2**(-l),
3336 ! l=0,1, ..., maxp1-2, maxp1.ge.1
3337 !
3338 ! on return
3339 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
3340 ! approximation to the integral x
3341 !
3342 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
3343 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
3344 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
3345 !
3346 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
3347 ! number of integrand evaluations
3348 !
3349 ! ier - ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of
3350 ! the routine. it is assumed that the
3351 ! requested accuracy has been achieved.
3352 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine. the
3353 ! estimates for integral and error are less
3354 ! reliable. it is assumed that the requested
3355 ! accuracy has not been achieved.
3356 ! error messages
3357 ! if omega.ne.0
3358 ! ier = 1 maximum number of cycles allowed
3359 ! has been achieved., i.e. of subintervals
3360 ! (a+(k-1)c,a+kc) where
3361 ! c = (2*int(abs(omega))+1)*pi/abs(omega),
3362 ! for k = 1, 2, ..., lst.
3363 ! one can allow more cycles by increasing
3364 ! the value of limlst (and taking the
3365 ! according dimension adjustments into
3366 ! account).
3367 ! examine the array iwork which contains
3368 ! the error flags on the cycles, in order to
3369 ! look for eventual local integration
3370 ! difficulties. if the position of a local
3371 ! difficulty can be determined (e.g.
3372 ! singularity, discontinuity within the
3373 ! interval) one will probably gain from
3374 ! splitting up the interval at this point
3375 ! and calling appropriate integrators on
3376 ! the subranges.
3377 ! = 4 the extrapolation table constructed for
3378 ! convergence acceleration of the series
3379 ! formed by the integral contributions over
3380 ! the cycles, does not converge to within
3381 ! the requested accuracy. as in the case of
3382 ! ier = 1, it is advised to examine the
3383 ! array iwork which contains the error
3384 ! flags on the cycles.
3385 ! = 6 the input is invalid because
3386 ! (integr.ne.1 and integr.ne.2) or
3387 ! epsabs.le.0 or limlst.lt.3.
3388 ! result, abserr, neval, lst are set
3389 ! to zero.
3390 ! = 7 bad integrand behaviour occurs within one
3391 ! or more of the cycles. location and type
3392 ! of the difficulty involved can be
3393 ! determined from the vector ierlst. here
3394 ! lst is the number of cycles actually
3395 ! needed (see below).
3396 ! ierlst(k) = 1 the maximum number of
3397 ! subdivisions (= limit) has
3398 ! been achieved on the k th
3399 ! cycle.
3400 ! = 2 occurrence of roundoff error
3401 ! is detected and prevents the
3402 ! tolerance imposed on the
3403 ! k th cycle, from being
3404 ! achieved.
3405 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand
3406 ! behaviour occurs at some
3407 ! points of the k th cycle.
3408 ! = 4 the integration procedure
3409 ! over the k th cycle does
3410 ! not converge (to within the
3411 ! required accuracy) due to
3412 ! roundoff in the
3413 ! extrapolation procedure
3414 ! invoked on this cycle. it
3415 ! is assumed that the result
3416 ! on this interval is the
3417 ! best which can be obtained.
3418 ! = 5 the integral over the k th
3419 ! cycle is probably divergent
3420 ! or slowly convergent. it
3421 ! must be noted that
3422 ! divergence can occur with
3423 ! any other value of
3424 ! ierlst(k).
3425 ! if omega = 0 and integr = 1,
3426 ! the integral is calculated by means of dqagie
3427 ! and ier = ierlst(1) (with meaning as described
3428 ! for ierlst(k), k = 1).
3429 !
3430 ! rslst - real ( kind = 8 )
3431 ! vector of dimension at least limlst
3432 ! rslst(k) contains the integral contribution
3433 ! over the interval (a+(k-1)c,a+kc) where
3434 ! c = (2*int(abs(omega))+1)*pi/abs(omega),
3435 ! k = 1, 2, ..., lst.
3436 ! note that, if omega = 0, rslst(1) contains
3437 ! the value of the integral over (a,infinity).
3438 !
3439 ! erlst - real ( kind = 8 )
3440 ! vector of dimension at least limlst
3441 ! erlst(k) contains the error estimate corresponding
3442 ! with rslst(k).
3443 !
3444 ! ierlst - integer ( kind = 4 )
3445 ! vector of dimension at least limlst
3446 ! ierlst(k) contains the error flag corresponding
3447 ! with rslst(k). for the meaning of the local error
3448 ! flags see description of output parameter ier.
3449 !
3450 ! lst - integer ( kind = 4 )
3451 ! number of subintervals needed for the integration
3452 ! if omega = 0 then lst is set to 1.
3453 !
3454 ! alist, blist, rlist, elist - real ( kind = 8 )
3455 ! vector of dimension at least limit,
3456 !
3457 ! iord, nnlog - integer ( kind = 4 )
3458 ! vector of dimension at least limit, providing
3459 ! space for the quantities needed in the subdivision
3460 ! process of each cycle
3461 !
3462 ! chebmo - real ( kind = 8 )
3463 ! array of dimension at least (maxp1,25), providing
3464 ! space for the chebyshev moments needed within the
3465 ! cycles
3466 !
3467 ! Local Parameters:
3468 !
3469 ! the dimension of psum is determined by the value of
3470 ! limexp in routine dqelg (psum must be of dimension
3471 ! (limexp+2) at least).
3472 !
3473 ! c1, c2 - end points of subinterval (of length cycle)
3474 ! cycle - (2*int(abs(omega))+1)*pi/abs(omega)
3475 ! psum - vector of dimension at least (limexp+2)
3476 ! (see routine dqelg)
3477 ! psum contains the part of the epsilon table
3478 ! which is still needed for further computations.
3479 ! each element of psum is a partial sum of the
3480 ! series which should sum to the value of the
3481 ! integral.
3482 ! errsum - sum of error estimates over the subintervals,
3483 ! calculated cumulatively
3484 ! epsa - absolute tolerance requested over current
3485 ! subinterval
3486 ! chebmo - array containing the modified chebyshev
3487 ! moments (see also routine dqc25f)
3488 !
3489  implicit none
3490 
3491  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abseps,abserr,alist,blist,chebmo,correc,cycle, &
3492  c1,c2,dl,dla,drl,elist,erlst,ep,eps,epsa, &
3493  epsabs,errsum,f,fact,omega,p,pi,p1,psum,reseps,result,res3la, &
3494  rlist,rslst,uflow
3495  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,ierlst,integr,iord,ktmin,l,last,lst,limit
3496  integer ( kind = 4 ) limlst
3497  integer ( kind = 4 ) ll
3498  integer ( kind = 4 ) maxp1,momcom,nev,neval,nnlog,nres,numrl2
3499 
3500  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),chebmo(maxp1,25),elist(limit), &
3501  erlst(limlst),ierlst(limlst),iord(limit),nnlog(limit),psum(52), &
3502  res3la(3),rlist(limit),rslst(limlst)
3503 
3504  external f
3505 
3506  data p / 0.9d+00 /
3507  data pi / 3.14159265358979323846264338327950d+00 /
3508 !
3509 ! test on validity of parameters
3510 !
3511  result = 0.0d+00
3512  abserr = 0.0d+00
3513  neval = 0
3514  lst = 0
3515  ier = 0
3516 
3517  if((integr.ne.1.and.integr.ne.2).or.epsabs.le.0.0d+00.or. &
3518  limlst.lt.3) then
3519  ier = 6
3520  return
3521  end if
3522 
3523  if(omega.ne.0.0d+00) go to 10
3524 !
3525 ! integration by dqagie if omega is zero
3526 !
3527  if(integr.eq.1) then
3528  call dqagie(f,0.0d+00,1,epsabs,0.0d+00,limit, &
3529  result,abserr,neval,ier,alist,blist,rlist,elist,iord,last)
3530  end if
3531 
3532  rslst(1) = result
3533  erlst(1) = abserr
3534  ierlst(1) = ier
3535  lst = 1
3536  go to 999
3537 !
3538 ! initializations
3539 !
3540  10 l = abs( omega)
3541  dl = 2*l+1
3542  cycle = dl*pi/ abs( omega)
3543  ier = 0
3544  ktmin = 0
3545  neval = 0
3546  numrl2 = 0
3547  nres = 0
3548  c1 = a
3549  c2 = cycle+a
3550  p1 = 0.1d+01-p
3551  uflow = tiny( uflow )
3552  eps = epsabs
3553  if(epsabs.gt.uflow/p1) eps = epsabs*p1
3554  ep = eps
3555  fact = 0.1d+01
3556  correc = 0.0d+00
3557  abserr = 0.0d+00
3558  errsum = 0.0d+00
3559 !
3560 ! main do-loop
3561 !
3562  do lst = 1,limlst
3563 !
3564 ! integrate over current subinterval.
3565 !
3566  dla = lst
3567  epsa = eps*fact
3568  call dqawoe(f,c1,c2,omega,integr,epsa,0.0d+00,limit,lst,maxp1, &
3569  rslst(lst),erlst(lst),nev,ierlst(lst),last,alist,blist,rlist, &
3570  elist,iord,nnlog,momcom,chebmo)
3571  neval = neval+nev
3572  fact = fact*p
3573  errsum = errsum+erlst(lst)
3574  drl = 0.5d+02* abs( rslst(lst))
3575 !
3576 ! test on accuracy with partial sum
3577 !
3578  if((errsum+drl).le.epsabs.and.lst.ge.6) go to 80
3579  correc = max( correc,erlst(lst))
3580  if(ierlst(lst).ne.0) eps = max( ep,correc*p1)
3581  if(ierlst(lst).ne.0) ier = 7
3582  if(ier.eq.7.and.(errsum+drl).le.correc*0.1d+02.and. &
3583  lst.gt.5) go to 80
3584  numrl2 = numrl2+1
3585  if(lst.gt.1) go to 20
3586  psum(1) = rslst(1)
3587  go to 40
3588  20 psum(numrl2) = psum(ll)+rslst(lst)
3589  if(lst.eq.2) go to 40
3590 !
3591 ! test on maximum number of subintervals
3592 !
3593  if(lst.eq.limlst) ier = 1
3594 !
3595 ! perform new extrapolation
3596 !
3597  call dqelg(numrl2,psum,reseps,abseps,res3la,nres)
3598 !
3599 ! test whether extrapolated result is influenced by roundoff
3600 !
3601  ktmin = ktmin+1
3602  if(ktmin.ge.15.and.abserr.le.0.1d-02*(errsum+drl)) ier = 4
3603  if(abseps.gt.abserr.and.lst.ne.3) go to 30
3604  abserr = abseps
3605  result = reseps
3606  ktmin = 0
3607 !
3608 ! if ier is not 0, check whether direct result (partial sum)
3609 ! or extrapolated result yields the best integral
3610 ! approximation
3611 !
3612  if((abserr+0.1d+02*correc).le.epsabs.or. &
3613  (abserr.le.epsabs.and.0.1d+02*correc.ge.epsabs)) go to 60
3614  30 if(ier.ne.0.and.ier.ne.7) go to 60
3615  40 ll = numrl2
3616  c1 = c2
3617  c2 = c2+cycle
3618  end do
3619 !
3620 ! set final result and error estimate
3621 !
3622  60 abserr = abserr+0.1d+02*correc
3623  if(ier.eq.0) go to 999
3624  if(result.ne.0.0d+00.and.psum(numrl2).ne.0.0d+00) go to 70
3625  if(abserr.gt.errsum) go to 80
3626  if(psum(numrl2).eq.0.0d+00) go to 999
3627  70 if(abserr/ abs( result).gt.(errsum+drl)/ abs( psum(numrl2))) &
3628  go to 80
3629  if(ier.ge.1.and.ier.ne.7) abserr = abserr+drl
3630  go to 999
3631  80 result = psum(numrl2)
3632  abserr = errsum+drl
3633  999 continue
3634 
3635  return
3636 end
3637 subroutine dqawf ( f, a, omega, integr, epsabs, result, abserr, neval, ier, &
3638  limlst, lst, leniw, maxp1, lenw, iwork, work )
3639 
3640 !*****************************************************************************80
3641 !
3642 !! DQAWF computes Fourier integrals over the interval [ A, +Infinity ).
3643 !
3644 ! Modified:
3645 !
3646 ! 11 September 2015
3647 !
3648 ! Author:
3649 !
3650 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
3651 !
3652 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
3653 ! fourier integral i=integral of f(x)*w(x) over (a,infinity)
3654 ! where w(x) = cos(omega*x) or w(x) = sin(omega*x).
3655 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
3656 ! abs(i-result).le.epsabs.
3657 !
3658 ! Parameters:
3659 !
3660 ! on entry
3661 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
3662 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
3663 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
3664 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
3665 !
3666 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
3667 ! lower limit of integration
3668 !
3669 ! omega - real ( kind = 8 )
3670 ! parameter in the integrand weight function
3671 !
3672 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
3673 ! indicates which of the weight functions is used
3674 ! integr = 1 w(x) = cos(omega*x)
3675 ! integr = 2 w(x) = sin(omega*x)
3676 ! if integr.ne.1.and.integr.ne.2, the routine
3677 ! will end with ier = 6.
3678 !
3679 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
3680 ! absolute accuracy requested, epsabs.gt.0.
3681 ! if epsabs.le.0, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3682 !
3683 ! on return
3684 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
3685 ! approximation to the integral
3686 !
3687 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
3688 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
3689 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
3690 !
3691 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
3692 ! number of integrand evaluations
3693 !
3694 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
3695 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
3696 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
3697 ! accuracy has been achieved.
3698 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine.
3699 ! the estimates for integral and error are
3700 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
3701 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
3702 ! error messages
3703 ! if omega.ne.0
3704 ! ier = 1 maximum number of cycles allowed
3705 ! has been achieved, i.e. of subintervals
3706 ! (a+(k-1)c,a+kc) where
3707 ! c = (2*int(abs(omega))+1)*pi/abs(omega),
3708 ! for k = 1, 2, ..., lst.
3709 ! one can allow more cycles by increasing
3710 ! the value of limlst (and taking the
3711 ! according dimension adjustments into
3712 ! account). examine the array iwork which
3713 ! contains the error flags on the cycles, in
3714 ! order to look for eventual local
3715 ! integration difficulties.
3716 ! if the position of a local difficulty
3717 ! can be determined (e.g. singularity,
3718 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
3719 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
3720 ! interval at this point and calling
3721 ! appropriate integrators on the subranges.
3722 ! = 4 the extrapolation table constructed for
3723 ! convergence accelaration of the series
3724 ! formed by the integral contributions over
3725 ! the cycles, does not converge to within
3726 ! the requested accuracy.
3727 ! as in the case of ier = 1, it is advised
3728 ! to examine the array iwork which contains
3729 ! the error flags on the cycles.
3730 ! = 6 the input is invalid because
3731 ! (integr.ne.1 and integr.ne.2) or
3732 ! epsabs.le.0 or limlst.lt.1 or
3733 ! leniw.lt.(limlst+2) or maxp1.lt.1 or
3734 ! lenw.lt.(leniw*2+maxp1*25).
3735 ! result, abserr, neval, lst are set to
3736 ! zero.
3737 ! = 7 bad integrand behaviour occurs within
3738 ! one or more of the cycles. location and
3739 ! type of the difficulty involved can be
3740 ! determined from the first lst elements of
3741 ! vector iwork. here lst is the number of
3742 ! cycles actually needed (see below).
3743 ! iwork(k) = 1 the maximum number of
3744 ! subdivisions (=(leniw-limlst)
3745 ! /2) has been achieved on the
3746 ! k th cycle.
3747 ! = 2 occurrence of roundoff error
3748 ! is detected and prevents the
3749 ! tolerance imposed on the k th
3750 ! cycle, from being achieved
3751 ! on this cycle.
3752 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand
3753 ! behaviour occurs at some
3754 ! points of the k th cycle.
3755 ! = 4 the integration procedure
3756 ! over the k th cycle does
3757 ! not converge (to within the
3758 ! required accuracy) due to
3759 ! roundoff in the extrapolation
3760 ! procedure invoked on this
3761 ! cycle. it is assumed that the
3762 ! result on this interval is
3763 ! the best which can be
3764 ! obtained.
3765 ! = 5 the integral over the k th
3766 ! cycle is probably divergent
3767 ! or slowly convergent. it must
3768 ! be noted that divergence can
3769 ! occur with any other value of
3770 ! iwork(k).
3771 ! if omega = 0 and integr = 1,
3772 ! the integral is calculated by means of dqagie,
3773 ! and ier = iwork(1) (with meaning as described
3774 ! for iwork(k),k = 1).
3775 !
3776 ! dimensioning parameters
3777 ! limlst - integer ( kind = 4 )
3778 ! limlst gives an upper bound on the number of
3779 ! cycles, limlst.ge.3.
3780 ! if limlst.lt.3, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3781 !
3782 ! lst - integer ( kind = 4 )
3783 ! on return, lst indicates the number of cycles
3784 ! actually needed for the integration.
3785 ! if omega = 0, then lst is set to 1.
3786 !
3787 ! leniw - integer ( kind = 4 )
3788 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork. on entry,
3789 ! (leniw-limlst)/2 equals the maximum number of
3790 ! subintervals allowed in the partition of each
3791 ! cycle, leniw.ge.(limlst+2).
3792 ! if leniw.lt.(limlst+2), the routine will end with
3793 ! ier = 6.
3794 !
3795 ! maxp1 - integer ( kind = 4 )
3796 ! maxp1 gives an upper bound on the number of
3797 ! chebyshev moments which can be stored, i.e. for
3798 ! the intervals of lengths abs(b-a)*2**(-l),
3799 ! l = 0,1, ..., maxp1-2, maxp1.ge.1.
3800 ! if maxp1.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3801 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
3802 ! dimensioning parameter for work
3803 ! lenw must be at least leniw*2+maxp1*25.
3804 ! if lenw.lt.(leniw*2+maxp1*25), the routine will
3805 ! end with ier = 6.
3806 !
3807 ! work arrays
3808 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
3809 ! vector of dimension at least leniw
3810 ! on return, iwork(k) for k = 1, 2, ..., lst
3811 ! contain the error flags on the cycles.
3812 !
3813 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
3814 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
3815 ! on return,
3816 ! work(1), ..., work(lst) contain the integral
3817 ! approximations over the cycles,
3818 ! work(limlst+1), ..., work(limlst+lst) contain
3819 ! the error extimates over the cycles.
3820 ! further elements of work have no specific
3821 ! meaning for the user.
3822 !
3823  implicit none
3824 
3825  integer ( kind = 4 ) leniw
3826  integer ( kind = 4 ) lenw
3827 
3828  real ( kind = 8 ) a
3829  real ( kind = 8 ) abserr
3830  real ( kind = 8 ) epsabs
3831  real ( kind = 8 ), external :: f
3832  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier
3833  integer ( kind = 4 ) integr
3834  integer ( kind = 4 ) iwork(leniw)
3835  integer ( kind = 4 ) last
3836  integer ( kind = 4 ) limit
3837  integer ( kind = 4 ) limlst
3838  integer ( kind = 4 ) ll2
3839  integer ( kind = 4 ) lst
3840  integer ( kind = 4 ) lvl
3841  integer ( kind = 4 ) l1
3842  integer ( kind = 4 ) l2
3843  integer ( kind = 4 ) l3
3844  integer ( kind = 4 ) l4
3845  integer ( kind = 4 ) l5
3846  integer ( kind = 4 ) l6
3847  integer ( kind = 4 ) maxp1
3848  integer ( kind = 4 ) neval
3849  real ( kind = 8 ) omega
3850  real ( kind = 8 ) result
3851  real ( kind = 8 ) work(lenw)
3852 !
3853 ! check validity of limlst, leniw, maxp1 and lenw.
3854 !
3855  ier = 6
3856  neval = 0
3857  last = 0
3858  result = 0.0d+00
3859  abserr = 0.0d+00
3860  if(limlst.lt.3.or.leniw.lt.(limlst+2).or.maxp1.lt.1.or.lenw.lt. &
3861  (leniw*2+maxp1*25)) go to 10
3862 !
3863 ! prepare call for dqawfe
3864 !
3865  limit = (leniw-limlst)/2
3866  l1 = limlst+1
3867  l2 = limlst+l1
3868  l3 = limit+l2
3869  l4 = limit+l3
3870  l5 = limit+l4
3871  l6 = limit+l5
3872  ll2 = limit+l1
3873  call dqawfe(f,a,omega,integr,epsabs,limlst,limit,maxp1,result, &
3874  abserr,neval,ier,work(1),work(l1),iwork(1),lst,work(l2), &
3875  work(l3),work(l4),work(l5),iwork(l1),iwork(ll2),work(l6))
3876 !
3877 ! call error handler if necessary
3878 !
3879  lvl = 0
3880 10 continue
3881 
3882  if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
3883  if(ier.ne.0) call xerror('abnormal return from dqawf',26,ier,lvl)
3884 
3885  return
3886 end
3887 subroutine dqawoe ( f, a, b, omega, integr, epsabs, epsrel, limit, icall, &
3888  maxp1, result, abserr, neval, ier, last, alist, blist, rlist, elist, iord, &
3889  nnlog, momcom, chebmo )
3890 
3891 !*****************************************************************************80
3892 !
3893 !! DQAWOE computes the integrals of oscillatory integrands.
3894 !
3895 ! Modified:
3896 !
3897 ! 11 September 2015
3898 !
3899 ! Author:
3900 !
3901 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
3902 !
3903 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
3904 ! definite integral
3905 ! i = integral of f(x)*w(x) over (a,b)
3906 ! where w(x) = cos(omega*x) or w(x)=sin(omega*x),
3907 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
3908 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
3909 !
3910 ! Parameters:
3911 !
3912 ! on entry
3913 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
3914 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
3915 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
3916 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
3917 !
3918 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
3919 ! lower limit of integration
3920 !
3921 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
3922 ! upper limit of integration
3923 !
3924 ! omega - real ( kind = 8 )
3925 ! parameter in the integrand weight function
3926 !
3927 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
3928 ! indicates which of the weight functions is to be
3929 ! used
3930 ! integr = 1 w(x) = cos(omega*x)
3931 ! integr = 2 w(x) = sin(omega*x)
3932 ! if integr.ne.1 and integr.ne.2, the routine
3933 ! will end with ier = 6.
3934 !
3935 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
3936 ! absolute accuracy requested
3937 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
3938 ! relative accuracy requested
3939 ! if epsabs.le.0
3940 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
3941 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
3942 !
3943 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
3944 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subdivisions
3945 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.1.
3946 !
3947 ! icall - integer ( kind = 4 )
3948 ! if dqawoe is to be used only once, icall must
3949 ! be set to 1. assume that during this call, the
3950 ! chebyshev moments (for clenshaw-curtis integration
3951 ! of degree 24) have been computed for intervals of
3952 ! lenghts (abs(b-a))*2**(-l), l=0,1,2,...momcom-1.
3953 ! if icall.gt.1 this means that dqawoe has been
3954 ! called twice or more on intervals of the same
3955 ! length abs(b-a). the chebyshev moments already
3956 ! computed are then re-used in subsequent calls.
3957 ! if icall.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3958 !
3959 ! maxp1 - integer ( kind = 4 )
3960 ! gives an upper bound on the number of chebyshev
3961 ! moments which can be stored, i.e. for the
3962 ! intervals of lenghts abs(b-a)*2**(-l),
3963 ! l=0,1, ..., maxp1-2, maxp1.ge.1.
3964 ! if maxp1.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
3965 !
3966 ! on return
3967 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
3968 ! approximation to the integral
3969 !
3970 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
3971 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
3972 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
3973 !
3974 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
3975 ! number of integrand evaluations
3976 !
3977 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
3978 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
3979 ! routine. it is assumed that the
3980 ! requested accuracy has been achieved.
3981 ! - ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine.
3982 ! the estimates for integral and error are
3983 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
3984 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
3985 ! error messages
3986 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
3987 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
3988 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
3989 ! limit (and taking according dimension
3990 ! adjustments into account). however, if
3991 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
3992 ! to analyze the integrand, in order to
3993 ! determine the integration difficulties.
3994 ! if the position of a local difficulty can
3995 ! be determined (e.g. singularity,
3996 ! discontinuity within the interval) one
3997 ! will probably gain from splitting up the
3998 ! interval at this point and calling the
3999 ! integrator on the subranges. if possible,
4000 ! an appropriate special-purpose integrator
4001 ! should be used which is designed for
4002 ! handling the type of difficulty involved.
4003 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
4004 ! detected, which prevents the requested
4005 ! tolerance from being achieved.
4006 ! the error may be under-estimated.
4007 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
4008 ! at some points of the integration
4009 ! interval.
4010 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
4011 ! roundoff error is detected in the
4012 ! extrapolation table.
4013 ! it is presumed that the requested
4014 ! tolerance cannot be achieved due to
4015 ! roundoff in the extrapolation table,
4016 ! and that the returned result is the
4017 ! best which can be obtained.
4018 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
4019 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
4020 ! divergence can occur with any other value
4021 ! of ier.gt.0.
4022 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
4023 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
4024 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
4025 ! or (integr.ne.1 and integr.ne.2) or
4026 ! icall.lt.1 or maxp1.lt.1.
4027 ! result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1),
4028 ! elist(1), iord(1) and nnlog(1) are set
4029 ! to zero. alist(1) and blist(1) are set
4030 ! to a and b respectively.
4031 !
4032 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
4033 ! on return, last equals the number of
4034 ! subintervals produces in the subdivision
4035 ! process, which determines the number of
4036 ! significant elements actually in the
4037 ! work arrays.
4038 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
4039 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4040 ! last elements of which are the left
4041 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
4042 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
4043 !
4044 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
4045 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4046 ! last elements of which are the right
4047 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
4048 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
4049 !
4050 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
4051 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4052 ! last elements of which are the integral
4053 ! approximations on the subintervals
4054 !
4055 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
4056 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4057 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
4058 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
4059 !
4060 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
4061 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
4062 ! elements of which are pointers to the error
4063 ! estimates over the subintervals,
4064 ! such that elist(iord(1)), ...,
4065 ! elist(iord(k)) form a decreasing sequence, with
4066 ! k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2), and
4067 ! k = limit+1-last otherwise.
4068 !
4069 ! nnlog - integer ( kind = 4 )
4070 ! vector of dimension at least limit, containing the
4071 ! subdivision levels of the subintervals, i.e.
4072 ! iwork(i) = l means that the subinterval
4073 ! numbered i is of length abs(b-a)*2**(1-l)
4074 !
4075 ! on entry and return
4076 ! momcom - integer ( kind = 4 )
4077 ! indicating that the chebyshev moments
4078 ! have been computed for intervals of lengths
4079 ! (abs(b-a))*2**(-l), l=0,1,2, ..., momcom-1,
4080 ! momcom.lt.maxp1
4081 !
4082 ! chebmo - real ( kind = 8 )
4083 ! array of dimension (maxp1,25) containing the
4084 ! chebyshev moments
4085 !
4086 ! Local Parameters:
4087 !
4088 ! the dimension of rlist2 is determined by the value of
4089 ! limexp in routine dqelg (rlist2 should be of
4090 ! dimension (limexp+2) at least).
4091 !
4092 ! list of major variables
4093 !
4094 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
4095 ! considered up to now
4096 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
4097 ! considered up to now
4098 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
4099 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
4100 ! rlist2 - array of dimension at least limexp+2
4101 ! containing the part of the epsilon table
4102 ! which is still needed for further computations
4103 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
4104 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest
4105 ! error estimate
4106 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
4107 ! erlast - error on the interval currently subdivided
4108 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
4109 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
4110 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
4111 ! abs(result))
4112 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
4113 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
4114 ! last - index for subdivision
4115 ! nres - number of calls to the extrapolation routine
4116 ! numrl2 - number of elements in rlist2. if an appropriate
4117 ! approximation to the compounded integral has
4118 ! been obtained it is put in rlist2(numrl2) after
4119 ! numrl2 has been increased by one
4120 ! small - length of the smallest interval considered
4121 ! up to now, multiplied by 1.5
4122 ! erlarg - sum of the errors over the intervals larger
4123 ! than the smallest interval considered up to now
4124 ! extrap - logical variable denoting that the routine is
4125 ! attempting to perform extrapolation, i.e. before
4126 ! subdividing the smallest interval we try to
4127 ! decrease the value of erlarg
4128 ! noext - logical variable denoting that extrapolation
4129 ! is no longer allowed (true value)
4130 !
4131 ! machine dependent constants
4132 !
4133 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
4134 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
4135 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
4136 !
4137  implicit none
4138 
4139  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abseps,abserr,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1, &
4140  a2,b,blist,b1,b2,chebmo,correc,defab1,defab2,defabs, &
4141  domega,dres,elist,epmach,epsabs,epsrel,erlarg,erlast, &
4142  errbnd,errmax,error1,erro12,error2,errsum,ertest,f,oflow, &
4143  omega,resabs,reseps,result,res3la,rlist,rlist2,small,uflow,width
4144  integer ( kind = 4 ) icall,id,ier,ierro,integr,iord,iroff1,iroff2
4145  integer ( kind = 4 ) iroff3
4146  integer ( kind = 4 ) jupbnd
4147  integer ( kind = 4 ) k,ksgn,ktmin,last,limit,maxerr,maxp1,momcom,nev,neval, &
4148  nnlog,nres,nrmax,nrmom,numrl2
4149  logical extrap,noext,extall
4150 
4151  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),rlist(limit),elist(limit), &
4152  iord(limit),rlist2(52),res3la(3),chebmo(maxp1,25),nnlog(limit)
4153  external f
4154 
4155  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
4156 !
4157 ! test on validity of parameters
4158 !
4159  ier = 0
4160  neval = 0
4161  last = 0
4162  result = 0.0d+00
4163  abserr = 0.0d+00
4164  alist(1) = a
4165  blist(1) = b
4166  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
4167  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
4168  iord(1) = 0
4169  nnlog(1) = 0
4170  if((integr.ne.1.and.integr.ne.2).or.(epsabs.le.0.0d+00.and. &
4171  epsrel.lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28)).or.icall.lt.1.or. &
4172  maxp1.lt.1) ier = 6
4173  if(ier.eq.6) go to 999
4174 !
4175 ! first approximation to the integral
4176 !
4177  domega = abs( omega)
4178  nrmom = 0
4179  if (icall.gt.1) go to 5
4180  momcom = 0
4181  5 call dqc25f(f,a,b,domega,integr,nrmom,maxp1,0,result,abserr, &
4182  neval,defabs,resabs,momcom,chebmo)
4183 !
4184 ! test on accuracy.
4185 !
4186  dres = abs( result)
4187  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel*dres)
4188  rlist(1) = result
4189  elist(1) = abserr
4190  iord(1) = 1
4191  if(abserr.le.0.1d+03*epmach*defabs.and.abserr.gt.errbnd) ier = 2
4192  if(limit.eq.1) ier = 1
4193  if(ier.ne.0.or.abserr.le.errbnd) go to 200
4194 !
4195 ! initializations
4196 !
4197  uflow = tiny( uflow )
4198  oflow = huge( oflow )
4199  errmax = abserr
4200  maxerr = 1
4201  area = result
4202  errsum = abserr
4203  abserr = oflow
4204  nrmax = 1
4205  extrap = .false.
4206  noext = .false.
4207  ierro = 0
4208  iroff1 = 0
4209  iroff2 = 0
4210  iroff3 = 0
4211  ktmin = 0
4212  small = abs( b-a)*0.75d+00
4213  nres = 0
4214  numrl2 = 0
4215  extall = .false.
4216  if(0.5d+00* abs( b-a)*domega.gt.0.2d+01) go to 10
4217  numrl2 = 1
4218  extall = .true.
4219  rlist2(1) = result
4220  10 if(0.25d+00* abs( b-a)*domega.le.0.2d+01) extall = .true.
4221  ksgn = -1
4222  if(dres.ge.(0.1d+01-0.5d+02*epmach)*defabs) ksgn = 1
4223 !
4224 ! main do-loop
4225 !
4226  do 140 last = 2,limit
4227 !
4228 ! bisect the subinterval with the nrmax-th largest error estimate.
4229 !
4230  nrmom = nnlog(maxerr)+1
4231  a1 = alist(maxerr)
4232  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
4233  a2 = b1
4234  b2 = blist(maxerr)
4235  erlast = errmax
4236  call dqc25f(f,a1,b1,domega,integr,nrmom,maxp1,0, &
4237  area1,error1,nev,resabs,defab1,momcom,chebmo)
4238  neval = neval+nev
4239  call dqc25f(f,a2,b2,domega,integr,nrmom,maxp1,1, &
4240  area2,error2,nev,resabs,defab2,momcom,chebmo)
4241  neval = neval+nev
4242 !
4243 ! improve previous approximations to integral
4244 ! and error and test for accuracy.
4245 !
4246  area12 = area1+area2
4247  erro12 = error1+error2
4248  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
4249  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
4250  if(defab1.eq.error1.or.defab2.eq.error2) go to 25
4251  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).gt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
4252  .or.erro12.lt.0.99d+00*errmax) go to 20
4253  if(extrap) iroff2 = iroff2+1
4254  if(.not.extrap) iroff1 = iroff1+1
4255  20 if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) iroff3 = iroff3+1
4256  25 rlist(maxerr) = area1
4257  rlist(last) = area2
4258  nnlog(maxerr) = nrmom
4259  nnlog(last) = nrmom
4260  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
4261 !
4262 ! test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
4263 !
4264  if(iroff1+iroff2.ge.10.or.iroff3.ge.20) ier = 2
4265  if(iroff2.ge.5) ierro = 3
4266 !
4267 ! set error flag in the case that the number of
4268 ! subintervals equals limit.
4269 !
4270  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
4271 !
4272 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
4273 ! at a point of the integration range.
4274 !
4275  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach) &
4276  *( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) ier = 4
4277 !
4278 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
4279 !
4280  if(error2.gt.error1) go to 30
4281  alist(last) = a2
4282  blist(maxerr) = b1
4283  blist(last) = b2
4284  elist(maxerr) = error1
4285  elist(last) = error2
4286  go to 40
4287  30 alist(maxerr) = a2
4288  alist(last) = a1
4289  blist(last) = b1
4290  rlist(maxerr) = area2
4291  rlist(last) = area1
4292  elist(maxerr) = error2
4293  elist(last) = error1
4294 !
4295 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
4296 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
4297 ! with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to bisected next).
4298 !
4299  40 call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
4300  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 170
4301  if(ier.ne.0) go to 150
4302  if(last.eq.2.and.extall) go to 120
4303  if(noext) go to 140
4304  if(.not.extall) go to 50
4305  erlarg = erlarg-erlast
4306  if( abs( b1-a1).gt.small) erlarg = erlarg+erro12
4307  if(extrap) go to 70
4308 !
4309 ! test whether the interval to be bisected next is the
4310 ! smallest interval.
4311 !
4312  50 width = abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr))
4313  if(width.gt.small) go to 140
4314  if(extall) go to 60
4315 !
4316 ! test whether we can start with the extrapolation procedure
4317 ! (we do this if we integrate over the next interval with
4318 ! use of a gauss-kronrod rule - see routine dqc25f).
4319 !
4320  small = small*0.5d+00
4321  if(0.25d+00*width*domega.gt.0.2d+01) go to 140
4322  extall = .true.
4323  go to 130
4324  60 extrap = .true.
4325  nrmax = 2
4326  70 if(ierro.eq.3.or.erlarg.le.ertest) go to 90
4327 !
4328 ! the smallest interval has the largest error.
4329 ! before bisecting decrease the sum of the errors over
4330 ! the larger intervals (erlarg) and perform extrapolation.
4331 !
4332  jupbnd = last
4333  if (last.gt.(limit/2+2)) jupbnd = limit+3-last
4334  id = nrmax
4335  do k = id,jupbnd
4336  maxerr = iord(nrmax)
4337  errmax = elist(maxerr)
4338  if( abs( blist(maxerr)-alist(maxerr)).gt.small) go to 140
4339  nrmax = nrmax+1
4340  end do
4341 !
4342 ! perform extrapolation.
4343 !
4344  90 numrl2 = numrl2+1
4345  rlist2(numrl2) = area
4346  if(numrl2.lt.3) go to 110
4347  call dqelg(numrl2,rlist2,reseps,abseps,res3la,nres)
4348  ktmin = ktmin+1
4349  if(ktmin.gt.5.and.abserr.lt.0.1d-02*errsum) ier = 5
4350  if(abseps.ge.abserr) go to 100
4351  ktmin = 0
4352  abserr = abseps
4353  result = reseps
4354  correc = erlarg
4355  ertest = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( reseps))
4356  if(abserr.le.ertest) go to 150
4357 !
4358 ! prepare bisection of the smallest interval.
4359 !
4360  100 if(numrl2.eq.1) noext = .true.
4361  if(ier.eq.5) go to 150
4362  110 maxerr = iord(1)
4363  errmax = elist(maxerr)
4364  nrmax = 1
4365  extrap = .false.
4366  small = small*0.5d+00
4367  erlarg = errsum
4368  go to 140
4369  120 small = small*0.5d+00
4370  numrl2 = numrl2+1
4371  rlist2(numrl2) = area
4372  130 ertest = errbnd
4373  erlarg = errsum
4374  140 continue
4375 !
4376 ! set the final result.-
4377 !
4378  150 if(abserr.eq.oflow.or.nres.eq.0) go to 170
4379  if(ier+ierro.eq.0) go to 165
4380  if(ierro.eq.3) abserr = abserr+correc
4381  if(ier.eq.0) ier = 3
4382  if(result.ne.0.0d+00.and.area.ne.0.0d+00) go to 160
4383  if(abserr.gt.errsum) go to 170
4384  if(area.eq.0.0d+00) go to 190
4385  go to 165
4386  160 if(abserr/ abs( result).gt.errsum/ abs( area)) go to 170
4387 !
4388 ! test on divergence.
4389 !
4390  165 if(ksgn.eq.(-1).and. max( abs( result), abs( area)).le. &
4391  defabs*0.1d-01) go to 190
4392  if(0.1d-01.gt.(result/area).or.(result/area).gt.0.1d+03 &
4393  .or.errsum.ge. abs( area)) ier = 6
4394  go to 190
4395 !
4396 ! compute global integral sum.
4397 !
4398  170 result = 0.0d+00
4399  do k=1,last
4400  result = result+rlist(k)
4401  end do
4402  abserr = errsum
4403  190 if (ier.gt.2) ier=ier-1
4404  200 if (integr.eq.2.and.omega.lt.0.0d+00) result=-result
4405  999 continue
4406 
4407  return
4408 end
4409 subroutine dqawo ( f, a, b, omega, integr, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, &
4410  neval, ier, leniw, maxp1, lenw, last, iwork, work )
4411 
4412 !*****************************************************************************80
4413 !
4414 !! DQAWO computes the integrals of oscillatory integrands.
4415 !
4416 ! Modified:
4417 !
4418 ! 11 September 2015
4419 !
4420 ! Author:
4421 !
4422 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
4423 !
4424 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
4425 ! definite integral i=integral of f(x)*w(x) over (a,b)
4426 ! where w(x) = cos(omega*x)
4427 ! or w(x) = sin(omega*x),
4428 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
4429 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
4430 !
4431 ! Parameters:
4432 !
4433 ! on entry
4434 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
4435 ! function subprogram defining the function
4436 ! f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
4437 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
4438 !
4439 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
4440 ! lower limit of integration
4441 !
4442 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
4443 ! upper limit of integration
4444 !
4445 ! omega - real ( kind = 8 )
4446 ! parameter in the integrand weight function
4447 !
4448 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
4449 ! indicates which of the weight functions is used
4450 ! integr = 1 w(x) = cos(omega*x)
4451 ! integr = 2 w(x) = sin(omega*x)
4452 ! if integr.ne.1.and.integr.ne.2, the routine will
4453 ! end with ier = 6.
4454 !
4455 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
4456 ! absolute accuracy requested
4457 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
4458 ! relative accuracy requested
4459 ! if epsabs.le.0 and
4460 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
4461 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
4462 !
4463 ! on return
4464 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
4465 ! approximation to the integral
4466 !
4467 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
4468 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
4469 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
4470 !
4471 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
4472 ! number of integrand evaluations
4473 !
4474 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
4475 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
4476 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
4477 ! accuracy has been achieved.
4478 ! - ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine.
4479 ! the estimates for integral and error are
4480 ! less reliable. it is assumed that the
4481 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
4482 ! error messages
4483 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
4484 ! (= leniw/2) has been achieved. one can
4485 ! allow more subdivisions by increasing the
4486 ! value of leniw (and taking the according
4487 ! dimension adjustments into account).
4488 ! however, if this yields no improvement it
4489 ! is advised to analyze the integrand in
4490 ! order to determine the integration
4491 ! difficulties. if the position of a local
4492 ! difficulty can be determined (e.g.
4493 ! singularity, discontinuity within the
4494 ! interval) one will probably gain from
4495 ! splitting up the interval at this point
4496 ! and calling the integrator on the
4497 ! subranges. if possible, an appropriate
4498 ! special-purpose integrator should be used
4499 ! which is designed for handling the type of
4500 ! difficulty involved.
4501 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
4502 ! detected, which prevents the requested
4503 ! tolerance from being achieved.
4504 ! the error may be under-estimated.
4505 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
4506 ! at some interior points of the
4507 ! integration interval.
4508 ! = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
4509 ! roundoff error is detected in the
4510 ! extrapolation table. it is presumed that
4511 ! the requested tolerance cannot be achieved
4512 ! due to roundoff in the extrapolation
4513 ! table, and that the returned result is
4514 ! the best which can be obtained.
4515 ! = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
4516 ! slowly convergent. it must be noted that
4517 ! divergence can occur with any other value
4518 ! of ier.
4519 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
4520 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
4521 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
4522 ! or (integr.ne.1 and integr.ne.2),
4523 ! or leniw.lt.2 or maxp1.lt.1 or
4524 ! lenw.lt.leniw*2+maxp1*25.
4525 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
4526 ! zero. except when leniw, maxp1 or lenw are
4527 ! invalid, work(limit*2+1), work(limit*3+1),
4528 ! iwork(1), iwork(limit+1) are set to zero,
4529 ! work(1) is set to a and work(limit+1) to
4530 ! b.
4531 !
4532 ! dimensioning parameters
4533 ! leniw - integer ( kind = 4 )
4534 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork.
4535 ! leniw/2 equals the maximum number of subintervals
4536 ! allowed in the partition of the given integration
4537 ! interval (a,b), leniw.ge.2.
4538 ! if leniw.lt.2, the routine will end with ier = 6.
4539 !
4540 ! maxp1 - integer ( kind = 4 )
4541 ! gives an upper bound on the number of chebyshev
4542 ! moments which can be stored, i.e. for the
4543 ! intervals of lengths abs(b-a)*2**(-l),
4544 ! l=0,1, ..., maxp1-2, maxp1.ge.1
4545 ! if maxp1.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
4546 !
4547 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
4548 ! dimensioning parameter for work
4549 ! lenw must be at least leniw*2+maxp1*25.
4550 ! if lenw.lt.(leniw*2+maxp1*25), the routine will
4551 ! end with ier = 6.
4552 !
4553 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
4554 ! on return, last equals the number of subintervals
4555 ! produced in the subdivision process, which
4556 ! determines the number of significant elements
4557 ! actually in the work arrays.
4558 !
4559 ! work arrays
4560 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
4561 ! vector of dimension at least leniw
4562 ! on return, the first k elements of which contain
4563 ! pointers to the error estimates over the
4564 ! subintervals, such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)), ..
4565 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
4566 ! sequence, with limit = lenw/2 , and k = last
4567 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
4568 ! otherwise.
4569 ! furthermore, iwork(limit+1), ..., iwork(limit+
4570 ! last) indicate the subdivision levels of the
4571 ! subintervals, such that iwork(limit+i) = l means
4572 ! that the subinterval numbered i is of length
4573 ! abs(b-a)*2**(1-l).
4574 !
4575 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
4576 ! vector of dimension at least lenw
4577 ! on return
4578 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
4579 ! end points of the subintervals in the
4580 ! partition of (a,b),
4581 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
4582 ! the right end points,
4583 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
4584 ! the integral approximations over the
4585 ! subintervals,
4586 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
4587 ! contain the error estimates.
4588 ! work(limit*4+1), ..., work(limit*4+maxp1*25)
4589 ! provide space for storing the chebyshev moments.
4590 ! note that limit = lenw/2.
4591 !
4592  implicit none
4593 
4594  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,b,epsabs,epsrel,f,omega,result,work
4595  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,integr,iwork,last,limit,lenw,leniw,lvl,l
4596  integer ( kind = 4 ) l1
4597  integer ( kind = 4 ) l2
4598  integer ( kind = 4 ) l3
4599  integer ( kind = 4 ) l4
4600  integer ( kind = 4 ) maxp1,momcom,neval
4601  dimension iwork(leniw),work(lenw)
4602 
4603  external f
4604 !
4605 ! check validity of leniw, maxp1 and lenw.
4606 !
4607  ier = 6
4608  neval = 0
4609  last = 0
4610  result = 0.0d+00
4611  abserr = 0.0d+00
4612  if(leniw.lt.2.or.maxp1.lt.1.or.lenw.lt.(leniw*2+maxp1*25)) &
4613  go to 10
4614 !
4615 ! prepare call for dqawoe
4616 !
4617  limit = leniw/2
4618  l1 = limit+1
4619  l2 = limit+l1
4620  l3 = limit+l2
4621  l4 = limit+l3
4622  call dqawoe(f,a,b,omega,integr,epsabs,epsrel,limit,1,maxp1,result, &
4623  abserr,neval,ier,last,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3), &
4624  iwork(1),iwork(l1),momcom,work(l4))
4625 !
4626 ! call error handler if necessary
4627 !
4628  lvl = 0
4629 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 0
4630  if(ier.ne.0) call xerror('abnormal return from dqawo',26,ier,lvl)
4631 
4632  return
4633 end
4634 subroutine dqawse(f,a,b,alfa,beta,integr,epsabs,epsrel,limit, &
4635  result,abserr,neval,ier,alist,blist,rlist,elist,iord,last)
4636 
4637 !*****************************************************************************80
4638 !
4639 !! DQAWSE estimates integrals with algebraico-logarithmic end singularities.
4640 !
4641 ! Modified:
4642 !
4643 ! 11 September 2015
4644 !
4645 ! Author:
4646 !
4647 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
4648 !
4649 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
4650 ! definite integral i = integral of f*w over (a,b),
4651 ! (where w shows a singular behaviour at the end points,
4652 ! see parameter integr).
4653 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
4654 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
4655 !
4656 ! Parameters:
4657 !
4658 ! on entry
4659 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
4660 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
4661 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
4662 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
4663 !
4664 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
4665 ! lower limit of integration
4666 !
4667 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
4668 ! upper limit of integration, b.gt.a
4669 ! if b.le.a, the routine will end with ier = 6.
4670 !
4671 ! alfa - real ( kind = 8 )
4672 ! parameter in the weight function, alfa.gt.(-1)
4673 ! if alfa.le.(-1), the routine will end with
4674 ! ier = 6.
4675 !
4676 ! beta - real ( kind = 8 )
4677 ! parameter in the weight function, beta.gt.(-1)
4678 ! if beta.le.(-1), the routine will end with
4679 ! ier = 6.
4680 !
4681 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
4682 ! indicates which weight function is to be used
4683 ! = 1 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta
4684 ! = 2 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)
4685 ! = 3 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(b-x)
4686 ! = 4 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)*log(b-x)
4687 ! if integr.lt.1 or integr.gt.4, the routine
4688 ! will end with ier = 6.
4689 !
4690 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
4691 ! absolute accuracy requested
4692 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
4693 ! relative accuracy requested
4694 ! if epsabs.le.0
4695 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
4696 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
4697 !
4698 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
4699 ! gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
4700 ! in the partition of (a,b), limit.ge.2
4701 ! if limit.lt.2, the routine will end with ier = 6.
4702 !
4703 ! on return
4704 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
4705 ! approximation to the integral
4706 !
4707 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
4708 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
4709 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
4710 !
4711 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
4712 ! number of integrand evaluations
4713 !
4714 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
4715 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
4716 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
4717 ! accuracy has been achieved.
4718 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
4719 ! the estimates for the integral and error
4720 ! are less reliable. it is assumed that the
4721 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
4722 ! error messages
4723 ! = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
4724 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
4725 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
4726 ! limit. however, if this yields no
4727 ! improvement, it is advised to analyze the
4728 ! integrand in order to determine the
4729 ! integration difficulties which prevent the
4730 ! requested tolerance from being achieved.
4731 ! in case of a jump discontinuity or a local
4732 ! singularity of algebraico-logarithmic type
4733 ! at one or more interior points of the
4734 ! integration range, one should proceed by
4735 ! splitting up the interval at these
4736 ! points and calling the integrator on the
4737 ! subranges.
4738 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
4739 ! detected, which prevents the requested
4740 ! tolerance from being achieved.
4741 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
4742 ! at some points of the integration
4743 ! interval.
4744 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
4745 ! b.le.a or alfa.le.(-1) or beta.le.(-1), or
4746 ! integr.lt.1 or integr.gt.4, or
4747 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
4748 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
4749 ! or limit.lt.2.
4750 ! result, abserr, neval, rlist(1), elist(1),
4751 ! iord(1) and last are set to zero. alist(1)
4752 ! and blist(1) are set to a and b
4753 ! respectively.
4754 !
4755 ! alist - real ( kind = 8 )
4756 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4757 ! last elements of which are the left
4758 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
4759 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
4760 !
4761 ! blist - real ( kind = 8 )
4762 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4763 ! last elements of which are the right
4764 ! end points of the subintervals in the partition
4765 ! of the given integration range (a,b)
4766 !
4767 ! rlist - real ( kind = 8 )
4768 ! vector of dimension at least limit,the first
4769 ! last elements of which are the integral
4770 ! approximations on the subintervals
4771 !
4772 ! elist - real ( kind = 8 )
4773 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first
4774 ! last elements of which are the moduli of the
4775 ! absolute error estimates on the subintervals
4776 !
4777 ! iord - integer ( kind = 4 )
4778 ! vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
4779 ! of which are pointers to the error
4780 ! estimates over the subintervals, so that
4781 ! elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k)) with k = last
4782 ! if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
4783 ! otherwise form a decreasing sequence
4784 !
4785 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
4786 ! number of subintervals actually produced in
4787 ! the subdivision process
4788 !
4789 ! Local parameters:
4790 !
4791 ! alist - list of left end points of all subintervals
4792 ! considered up to now
4793 ! blist - list of right end points of all subintervals
4794 ! considered up to now
4795 ! rlist(i) - approximation to the integral over
4796 ! (alist(i),blist(i))
4797 ! elist(i) - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
4798 ! maxerr - pointer to the interval with largest
4799 ! error estimate
4800 ! errmax - elist(maxerr)
4801 ! area - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
4802 ! errsum - sum of the errors over the subintervals
4803 ! errbnd - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
4804 ! abs(result))
4805 ! *****1 - variable for the left subinterval
4806 ! *****2 - variable for the right subinterval
4807 ! last - index for subdivision
4808 !
4809 ! machine dependent constants
4810 !
4811 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
4812 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
4813 !
4814  implicit none
4815 
4816  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,alfa,alist,area,area1,area12,area2,a1, &
4817  a2,b,beta,blist,b1,b2,centre,elist,epmach, &
4818  epsabs,epsrel,errbnd,errmax,error1,erro12,error2,errsum,f, &
4819  resas1,resas2,result,rg,rh,ri,rj,rlist,uflow
4820  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,integr,iord,iroff1,iroff2,k,last,limit
4821  integer( kind = 4 )maxerr
4822  integer ( kind = 4 ) nev
4823  integer ( kind = 4 ) neval,nrmax
4824 
4825  external f
4826 
4827  dimension alist(limit),blist(limit),rlist(limit),elist(limit), &
4828  iord(limit),ri(25),rj(25),rh(25),rg(25)
4829 
4830  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
4831  uflow = tiny( uflow )
4832 !
4833 ! test on validity of parameters
4834 !
4835  neval = 0
4836  last = 0
4837  rlist(1) = 0.0d+00
4838  elist(1) = 0.0d+00
4839  iord(1) = 0
4840  result = 0.0d+00
4841  abserr = 0.0d+00
4842 
4843  if ( b.le.a .or. &
4844  (epsabs.eq.0.0d+00 .and. epsrel .lt. max( 0.5d+02*epmach,0.5d-28) ) .or. &
4845  alfa .le. (-0.1d+01) .or. &
4846  beta .le. (-0.1d+01) .or. &
4847  integr.lt.1 .or. &
4848  integr.gt.4 .or. &
4849  limit.lt.2 ) then
4850  ier = 6
4851  return
4852  end if
4853 
4854  ier = 0
4855 !
4856 ! compute the modified chebyshev moments.
4857 !
4858  call dqmomo(alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,integr)
4859 !
