4860 ! integrate over the intervals (a,(a+b)/2) and ((a+b)/2,b).
4861 !
4862  centre = 0.5d+00*(b+a)
4863  call dqc25s(f,a,b,a,centre,alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,area1, &
4864  error1,resas1,integr,nev)
4865  neval = nev
4866  call dqc25s(f,a,b,centre,b,alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,area2, &
4867  error2,resas2,integr,nev)
4868  last = 2
4869  neval = neval+nev
4870  result = area1+area2
4871  abserr = error1+error2
4872 !
4873 ! test on accuracy.
4874 !
4875  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( result))
4876 !
4877 ! initialization
4878 !
4879  if ( error2 .le. error1 ) then
4880  alist(1) = a
4881  alist(2) = centre
4882  blist(1) = centre
4883  blist(2) = b
4884  rlist(1) = area1
4885  rlist(2) = area2
4886  elist(1) = error1
4887  elist(2) = error2
4888  else
4889  alist(1) = centre
4890  alist(2) = a
4891  blist(1) = b
4892  blist(2) = centre
4893  rlist(1) = area2
4894  rlist(2) = area1
4895  elist(1) = error2
4896  elist(2) = error1
4897  end if
4898 
4899  iord(1) = 1
4900  iord(2) = 2
4901  if(limit.eq.2) ier = 1
4902 
4903  if(abserr.le.errbnd.or.ier.eq.1) then
4904  return
4905  end if
4906 
4907  errmax = elist(1)
4908  maxerr = 1
4909  nrmax = 1
4910  area = result
4911  errsum = abserr
4912  iroff1 = 0
4913  iroff2 = 0
4914 !
4915 ! main do-loop
4916 !
4917  do 60 last = 3,limit
4918 !
4919 ! bisect the subinterval with largest error estimate.
4920 !
4921  a1 = alist(maxerr)
4922  b1 = 0.5d+00*(alist(maxerr)+blist(maxerr))
4923  a2 = b1
4924  b2 = blist(maxerr)
4925 
4926  call dqc25s(f,a,b,a1,b1,alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,area1, &
4927  error1,resas1,integr,nev)
4928  neval = neval+nev
4929  call dqc25s(f,a,b,a2,b2,alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,area2, &
4930  error2,resas2,integr,nev)
4931  neval = neval+nev
4932 !
4933 ! improve previous approximations integral and error and test for accuracy.
4934 !
4935  area12 = area1+area2
4936  erro12 = error1+error2
4937  errsum = errsum+erro12-errmax
4938  area = area+area12-rlist(maxerr)
4939  if(a.eq.a1.or.b.eq.b2) go to 30
4940  if(resas1.eq.error1.or.resas2.eq.error2) go to 30
4941 !
4942 ! test for roundoff error.
4943 !
4944  if( abs( rlist(maxerr)-area12).lt.0.1d-04* abs( area12) &
4945  .and.erro12.ge.0.99d+00*errmax) iroff1 = iroff1+1
4946  if(last.gt.10.and.erro12.gt.errmax) iroff2 = iroff2+1
4947  30 rlist(maxerr) = area1
4948  rlist(last) = area2
4949 !
4950 ! test on accuracy.
4951 !
4952  errbnd = max( epsabs,epsrel* abs( area))
4953  if(errsum.le.errbnd) go to 35
4954 !
4955 ! set error flag in the case that the number of interval
4956 ! bisections exceeds limit.
4957 !
4958  if(last.eq.limit) ier = 1
4959 !
4960 ! set error flag in the case of roundoff error.
4961 !
4962  if(iroff1.ge.6.or.iroff2.ge.20) ier = 2
4963 !
4964 ! set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
4965 ! at interior points of integration range.
4966 !
4967  if( max( abs( a1), abs( b2)).le.(0.1d+01+0.1d+03*epmach)* &
4968  ( abs( a2)+0.1d+04*uflow)) ier = 3
4969 !
4970 ! append the newly-created intervals to the list.
4971 !
4972  35 if(error2.gt.error1) go to 40
4973  alist(last) = a2
4974  blist(maxerr) = b1
4975  blist(last) = b2
4976  elist(maxerr) = error1
4977  elist(last) = error2
4978  go to 50
4979 
4980  40 alist(maxerr) = a2
4981  alist(last) = a1
4982  blist(last) = b1
4983  rlist(maxerr) = area2
4984  rlist(last) = area1
4985  elist(maxerr) = error2
4986  elist(last) = error1
4987 !
4988 ! call dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
4989 ! in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
4990 ! with largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
4991 !
4992  50 call dqpsrt(limit,last,maxerr,errmax,elist,iord,nrmax)
4993  if (ier.ne.0.or.errsum.le.errbnd) go to 70
4994  60 continue
4995 !
4996 ! compute final result.
4997 !
4998  70 continue
4999 
5000  result = 0.0d+00
5001  do k=1,last
5002  result = result+rlist(k)
5003  end do
5004 
5005  abserr = errsum
5006  999 continue
5007 
5008  return
5009 end
5010 subroutine dqaws ( f, a, b, alfa, beta, integr, epsabs, epsrel, result, &
5011  abserr, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork, work )
5012 
5013 !*****************************************************************************80
5014 !
5015 !! DQAWS estimates integrals with algebraico-logarithmic endpoint singularities.
5016 !
5017 ! Modified:
5018 !
5019 ! 12 September 2015
5020 !
5021 ! Author:
5022 !
5023 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
5024 !
5025 !***purpose the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
5026 ! definite integral i = integral of f*w over (a,b),
5027 ! (where w shows a singular behaviour at the end points
5028 ! see parameter integr).
5029 ! hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
5030 ! abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
5031 !
5032 ! Parameters:
5033 !
5034 ! on entry
5035 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
5036 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
5037 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
5038 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
5039 !
5040 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
5041 ! lower limit of integration
5042 !
5043 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
5044 ! upper limit of integration, b.gt.a
5045 ! if b.le.a, the routine will end with ier = 6.
5046 !
5047 ! alfa - real ( kind = 8 )
5048 ! parameter in the integrand function, alfa.gt.(-1)
5049 ! if alfa.le.(-1), the routine will end with
5050 ! ier = 6.
5051 !
5052 ! beta - real ( kind = 8 )
5053 ! parameter in the integrand function, beta.gt.(-1)
5054 ! if beta.le.(-1), the routine will end with
5055 ! ier = 6.
5056 !
5057 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
5058 ! indicates which weight function is to be used
5059 ! = 1 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta
5060 ! = 2 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)
5061 ! = 3 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(b-x)
5062 ! = 4 (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)*log(b-x)
5063 ! if integr.lt.1 or integr.gt.4, the routine
5064 ! will end with ier = 6.
5065 !
5066 ! epsabs - real ( kind = 8 )
5067 ! absolute accuracy requested
5068 ! epsrel - real ( kind = 8 )
5069 ! relative accuracy requested
5070 ! if epsabs.le.0
5071 ! and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
5072 ! the routine will end with ier = 6.
5073 !
5074 ! on return
5075 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
5076 ! approximation to the integral
5077 !
5078 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
5079 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
5080 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
5081 !
5082 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
5083 ! number of integrand evaluations
5084 !
5085 ! ier - integer ( kind = 4 )
5086 ! ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
5087 ! routine. it is assumed that the requested
5088 ! accuracy has been achieved.
5089 ! ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
5090 ! the estimates for the integral and error
5091 ! are less reliable. it is assumed that the
5092 ! requested accuracy has not been achieved.
5093 ! error messages
5094 ! ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
5095 ! has been achieved. one can allow more
5096 ! subdivisions by increasing the value of
5097 ! limit (and taking the according dimension
5098 ! adjustments into account). however, if
5099 ! this yields no improvement it is advised
5100 ! to analyze the integrand, in order to
5101 ! determine the integration difficulties
5102 ! which prevent the requested tolerance from
5103 ! being achieved. in case of a jump
5104 ! discontinuity or a local singularity
5105 ! of algebraico-logarithmic type at one or
5106 ! more interior points of the integration
5107 ! range, one should proceed by splitting up
5108 ! the interval at these points and calling
5109 ! the integrator on the subranges.
5110 ! = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is
5111 ! detected, which prevents the requested
5112 ! tolerance from being achieved.
5113 ! = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
5114 ! at some points of the integration
5115 ! interval.
5116 ! = 6 the input is invalid, because
5117 ! b.le.a or alfa.le.(-1) or beta.le.(-1) or
5118 ! or integr.lt.1 or integr.gt.4 or
5119 ! (epsabs.le.0 and
5120 ! epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28))
5121 ! or limit.lt.2 or lenw.lt.limit*4.
5122 ! result, abserr, neval, last are set to
5123 ! zero. except when lenw or limit is invalid
5124 ! iwork(1), work(limit*2+1) and
5125 ! work(limit*3+1) are set to zero, work(1)
5126 ! is set to a and work(limit+1) to b.
5127 !
5128 ! dimensioning parameters
5129 ! limit - integer ( kind = 4 )
5130 ! dimensioning parameter for iwork
5131 ! limit determines the maximum number of
5132 ! subintervals in the partition of the given
5133 ! integration interval (a,b), limit.ge.2.
5134 ! if limit.lt.2, the routine will end with ier = 6.
5135 !
5136 ! lenw - integer ( kind = 4 )
5137 ! dimensioning parameter for work
5138 ! lenw must be at least limit*4.
5139 ! if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end
5140 ! with ier = 6.
5141 !
5142 ! last - integer ( kind = 4 )
5143 ! on return, last equals the number of
5144 ! subintervals produced in the subdivision process,
5145 ! which determines the significant number of
5146 ! elements actually in the work arrays.
5147 !
5148 ! work arrays
5149 ! iwork - integer ( kind = 4 )
5150 ! vector of dimension limit, the first k
5151 ! elements of which contain pointers
5152 ! to the error estimates over the subintervals,
5153 ! such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)), ...,
5154 ! work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
5155 ! sequence with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2),
5156 ! and k = limit+1-last otherwise
5157 !
5158 ! work - real ( kind = 8 )
5159 ! vector of dimension lenw
5160 ! on return
5161 ! work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
5162 ! end points of the subintervals in the
5163 ! partition of (a,b),
5164 ! work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
5165 ! the right end points,
5166 ! work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last)
5167 ! contain the integral approximations over
5168 ! the subintervals,
5169 ! work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
5170 ! contain the error estimates.
5171 !
5172  implicit none
5173 
5174  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,alfa,b,beta,epsabs,epsrel,f,result,work
5175  integer ( kind = 4 ) ier,integr,iwork,last,lenw,limit,lvl,l1,l2,l3
5176  integer ( kind = 4 ) neval
5177  dimension iwork(limit),work(lenw)
5178 
5179  external f
5180 !
5181 ! check validity of limit and lenw.
5182 !
5183  ier = 6
5184  neval = 0
5185  last = 0
5186  result = 0.0d+00
5187  abserr = 0.0d+00
5188  if(limit.lt.2.or.lenw.lt.limit*4) go to 10
5189 !
5190 ! prepare call for dqawse.
5191 !
5192  l1 = limit+1
5193  l2 = limit+l1
5194  l3 = limit+l2
5195 
5196  call dqawse(f,a,b,alfa,beta,integr,epsabs,epsrel,limit,result, &
5197  abserr,neval,ier,work(1),work(l1),work(l2),work(l3),iwork,last)
5198 !
5199 ! call error handler if necessary.
5200 !
5201  lvl = 0
5202 10 if(ier.eq.6) lvl = 1
5203  if(ier.ne.0) call xerror('abnormal return from dqaws',26,ier,lvl)
5204 
5205  return
5206 end
5207 subroutine dqc25c(f,a,b,c,result,abserr,krul,neval)
5208 
5209 !*****************************************************************************80
5210 !
5211 !! DQC25C returns integration rules for Cauchy Principal Value integrals.
5212 !
5213 ! Modified:
5214 !
5215 ! 11 September 2015
5216 !
5217 ! Author:
5218 !
5219 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
5220 !
5221 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f*w over (a,b) with
5222 ! error estimate, where w(x) = 1/(x-c)
5223 !
5224 ! Parameters:
5225 !
5226 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
5227 ! function subprogram defining the integrand function
5228 ! f(x). the actual name for f needs to be declared
5229 ! e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
5230 !
5231 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
5232 ! left end point of the integration interval
5233 !
5234 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
5235 ! right end point of the integration interval, b.gt.a
5236 !
5237 ! c - real ( kind = 8 )
5238 ! parameter in the weight function
5239 !
5240 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
5241 ! approximation to the integral
5242 ! result is computed by using a generalized
5243 ! clenshaw-curtis method if c lies within ten percent
5244 ! of the integration interval. in the other case the
5245 ! 15-point kronrod rule obtained by optimal addition
5246 ! of abscissae to the 7-point gauss rule, is applied.
5247 !
5248 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
5249 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
5250 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
5251 !
5252 ! krul - integer ( kind = 4 )
5253 ! key which is decreased by 1 if the 15-point
5254 ! gauss-kronrod scheme has been used
5255 !
5256 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
5257 ! number of integrand evaluations
5258 !
5259 ! Local Parameters:
5260 !
5261 ! fval - value of the function f at the points
5262 ! cos(k*pi/24), k = 0, ..., 24
5263 ! cheb12 - chebyshev series expansion coefficients,
5264 ! for the function f, of degree 12
5265 ! cheb24 - chebyshev series expansion coefficients,
5266 ! for the function f, of degree 24
5267 ! res12 - approximation to the integral corresponding
5268 ! to the use of cheb12
5269 ! res24 - approximation to the integral corresponding
5270 ! to the use of cheb24
5271 ! dqwgtc - external function subprogram defining
5272 ! the weight function
5273 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
5274 ! centr - mid point of the interval
5275 !
5276 ! the vector x contains the values cos(k*pi/24),
5277 ! k = 1, ..., 11, to be used for the chebyshev series
5278 ! expansion of f
5279 !
5280  implicit none
5281 
5282  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,ak22,amom0,amom1,amom2,b,c,cc,centr, &
5283  cheb12,cheb24,dqwgtc,f,fval,hlgth,p2,p3,p4,resabs, &
5284  resasc,result,res12,res24,u,x
5285  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,isym,k,kp,krul,neval
5286  dimension x(11),fval(25),cheb12(13),cheb24(25)
5287 
5288  external f
5289  external dqwgtc
5290 
5291  data x(1) / 0.991444861373810411144557526928563d0 /
5292  data x(2) / 0.965925826289068286749743199728897d0 /
5293  data x(3) / 0.923879532511286756128183189396788d0 /
5294  data x(4) / 0.866025403784438646763723170752936d0 /
5295  data x(5) / 0.793353340291235164579776961501299d0 /
5296  data x(6) / 0.707106781186547524400844362104849d0 /
5297  data x(7) / 0.608761429008720639416097542898164d0 /
5298  data x(8) / 0.500000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
5299  data x(9) / 0.382683432365089771728459984030399d0 /
5300  data x(10) / 0.258819045102520762348898837624048d0 /
5301  data x(11) / 0.130526192220051591548406227895489d0 /
5302 !
5303 ! check the position of c.
5304 !
5305  cc = (0.2d+01*c-b-a)/(b-a)
5306  if( abs( cc).lt.0.11d+01) go to 10
5307 !
5308 ! apply the 15-point gauss-kronrod scheme.
5309 !
5310  krul = krul-1
5311  call dqk15w(f,dqwgtc,c,p2,p3,p4,kp,a,b,result,abserr, &
5312  resabs,resasc)
5313  neval = 15
5314  if (resasc.eq.abserr) krul = krul+1
5315  go to 50
5316 !
5317 ! use the generalized clenshaw-curtis method.
5318 !
5319  10 hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
5320  centr = 0.5d+00*(b+a)
5321  neval = 25
5322  fval(1) = 0.5d+00*f(hlgth+centr)
5323  fval(13) = f(centr)
5324  fval(25) = 0.5d+00*f(centr-hlgth)
5325 
5326  do i=2,12
5327  u = hlgth*x(i-1)
5328  isym = 26-i
5329  fval(i) = f(u+centr)
5330  fval(isym) = f(centr-u)
5331  end do
5332 !
5333 ! compute the chebyshev series expansion.
5334 !
5335  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
5336 !
5337 ! the modified chebyshev moments are computed by forward
5338 ! recursion, using amom0 and amom1 as starting values.
5339 !
5340  amom0 = log( abs( (0.1d+01-cc)/(0.1d+01+cc)))
5341  amom1 = 0.2d+01+cc*amom0
5342  res12 = cheb12(1)*amom0+cheb12(2)*amom1
5343  res24 = cheb24(1)*amom0+cheb24(2)*amom1
5344 
5345  do k=3,13
5346  amom2 = 0.2d+01*cc*amom1-amom0
5347  ak22 = (k-2)*(k-2)
5348  if((k/2)*2.eq.k) amom2 = amom2-0.4d+01/(ak22-0.1d+01)
5349  res12 = res12+cheb12(k)*amom2
5350  res24 = res24+cheb24(k)*amom2
5351  amom0 = amom1
5352  amom1 = amom2
5353  end do
5354 
5355  do k=14,25
5356  amom2 = 0.2d+01*cc*amom1-amom0
5357  ak22 = (k-2)*(k-2)
5358  if((k/2)*2.eq.k) amom2 = amom2-0.4d+01/(ak22-0.1d+01)
5359  res24 = res24+cheb24(k)*amom2
5360  amom0 = amom1
5361  amom1 = amom2
5362  end do
5363 
5364  result = res24
5365  abserr = abs( res24-res12)
5366  50 continue
5367 
5368  return
5369 end
5370 subroutine dqc25f(f,a,b,omega,integr,nrmom,maxp1,ksave,result, &
5371  abserr,neval,resabs,resasc,momcom,chebmo)
5372 
5373 !*****************************************************************************80
5374 !
5375 !! DQC25F returns integration rules for functions with a COS or SIN factor.
5376 !
5377 ! Modified:
5378 !
5379 ! 11 September 2015
5380 !
5381 ! Author:
5382 !
5383 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
5384 !
5385 !***purpose to compute the integral i=integral of f(x) over (a,b)
5386 ! where w(x) = cos(omega*x) or w(x)=sin(omega*x) and to
5387 ! compute j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b). for small value
5388 ! of omega or small intervals (a,b) the 15-point gauss-kronro
5389 ! rule is used. otherwise a generalized clenshaw-curtis
5390 ! method is used.
5391 !
5392 ! Parameters:
5393 !
5394 ! on entry
5395 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
5396 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
5397 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to
5398 ! be declared e x t e r n a l in the calling program.
5399 !
5400 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
5401 ! lower limit of integration
5402 !
5403 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
5404 ! upper limit of integration
5405 !
5406 ! omega - real ( kind = 8 )
5407 ! parameter in the weight function
5408 !
5409 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
5410 ! indicates which weight function is to be used
5411 ! integr = 1 w(x) = cos(omega*x)
5412 ! integr = 2 w(x) = sin(omega*x)
5413 !
5414 ! nrmom - integer ( kind = 4 )
5415 ! the length of interval (a,b) is equal to the length
5416 ! of the original integration interval divided by
5417 ! 2**nrmom (we suppose that the routine is used in an
5418 ! adaptive integration process, otherwise set
5419 ! nrmom = 0). nrmom must be zero at the first call.
5420 !
5421 ! maxp1 - integer ( kind = 4 )
5422 ! gives an upper bound on the number of chebyshev
5423 ! moments which can be stored, i.e. for the
5424 ! intervals of lengths abs(bb-aa)*2**(-l),
5425 ! l = 0,1,2, ..., maxp1-2.
5426 !
5427 ! ksave - integer ( kind = 4 )
5428 ! key which is one when the moments for the
5429 ! current interval have been computed
5430 !
5431 ! on return
5432 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
5433 ! approximation to the integral i
5434 !
5435 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
5436 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute
5437 ! error, which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
5438 !
5439 ! neval - integer ( kind = 4 )
5440 ! number of integrand evaluations
5441 !
5442 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
5443 ! approximation to the integral j
5444 !
5445 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
5446 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
5447 !
5448 ! on entry and return
5449 ! momcom - integer ( kind = 4 )
5450 ! for each interval length we need to compute the
5451 ! chebyshev moments. momcom counts the number of
5452 ! intervals for which these moments have already been
5453 ! computed. if nrmom.lt.momcom or ksave = 1, the
5454 ! chebyshev moments for the interval (a,b) have
5455 ! already been computed and stored, otherwise we
5456 ! compute them and we increase momcom.
5457 !
5458 ! chebmo - real ( kind = 8 )
5459 ! array of dimension at least (maxp1,25) containing
5460 ! the modified chebyshev moments for the first momcom
5461 ! momcom interval lengths
5462 !
5463 ! Local Parameters:
5464 !
5465 ! the vector x contains the values cos(k*pi/24)
5466 ! k = 1, ...,11, to be used for the chebyshev expansion of f
5467 !
5468 ! centr - mid point of the integration interval
5469 ! hlgth - half-length of the integration interval
5470 ! fval - value of the function f at the points
5471 ! (b-a)*0.5*cos(k*pi/12) + (b+a)*0.5, k = 0, ..., 24
5472 ! cheb12 - coefficients of the chebyshev series expansion
5473 ! of degree 12, for the function f, in the
5474 ! interval (a,b)
5475 ! cheb24 - coefficients of the chebyshev series expansion
5476 ! of degree 24, for the function f, in the
5477 ! interval (a,b)
5478 ! resc12 - approximation to the integral of
5479 ! cos(0.5*(b-a)*omega*x)*f(0.5*(b-a)*x+0.5*(b+a))
5480 ! over (-1,+1), using the chebyshev series
5481 ! expansion of degree 12
5482 ! resc24 - approximation to the same integral, using the
5483 ! chebyshev series expansion of degree 24
5484 ! ress12 - the analogue of resc12 for the sine
5485 ! ress24 - the analogue of resc24 for the sine
5486 !
5487 !
5488 ! machine dependent constant
5489 !
5490 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
5491 !
5492  implicit none
5493 
5494  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,ac,an,an2,as,asap,ass,b,centr,chebmo, &
5495  cheb12,cheb24,conc,cons,cospar,d,dqwgtf,d1, &
5496  d2,estc,ests,f,fval,hlgth,oflow,omega,parint,par2,par22, &
5497  p2,p3,p4,resabs,resasc,resc12,resc24,ress12,ress24,result, &
5498  sinpar,v,x
5499  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,iers,integr,isym,j,k,ksave,m,momcom,neval, maxp1,&
5500  noequ,noeq1,nrmom
5501  dimension chebmo(maxp1,25),cheb12(13),cheb24(25),d(25),d1(25), &
5502  d2(25),fval(25),v(28),x(11)
5503 
5504  external f,dqwgtf
5505 
5506  data x(1) / 0.991444861373810411144557526928563d0 /
5507  data x(2) / 0.965925826289068286749743199728897d0 /
5508  data x(3) / 0.923879532511286756128183189396788d0 /
5509  data x(4) / 0.866025403784438646763723170752936d0 /
5510  data x(5) / 0.793353340291235164579776961501299d0 /
5511  data x(6) / 0.707106781186547524400844362104849d0 /
5512  data x(7) / 0.608761429008720639416097542898164d0 /
5513  data x(8) / 0.500000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
5514  data x(9) / 0.382683432365089771728459984030399d0 /
5515  data x(10) / 0.258819045102520762348898837624048d0 /
5516  data x(11) / 0.130526192220051591548406227895489d0 /
5517 
5518  oflow = huge( oflow )
5519  centr = 0.5d+00*(b+a)
5520  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
5521  parint = omega*hlgth
5522 !
5523 ! compute the integral using the 15-point gauss-kronrod
5524 ! formula if the value of the parameter in the integrand is small.
5525 !
5526  if( abs( parint).gt.0.2d+01) go to 10
5527  call dqk15w(f,dqwgtf,omega,p2,p3,p4,integr,a,b,result, &
5528  abserr,resabs,resasc)
5529  neval = 15
5530  go to 170
5531 !
5532 ! compute the integral using the generalized clenshaw-
5533 ! curtis method.
5534 !
5535  10 conc = hlgth*dcos(centr*omega)
5536  cons = hlgth*dsin(centr*omega)
5537  resasc = oflow
5538  neval = 25
5539 !
5540 ! check whether the chebyshev moments for this interval
5541 ! have already been computed.
5542 !
5543  if(nrmom.lt.momcom.or.ksave.eq.1) go to 120
5544 !
5545 ! compute a new set of chebyshev moments.
5546 !
5547  m = momcom+1
5548  par2 = parint*parint
5549  par22 = par2+0.2d+01
5550  sinpar = dsin(parint)
5551  cospar = dcos(parint)
5552 !
5553 ! compute the chebyshev moments with respect to cosine.
5554 !
5555  v(1) = 0.2d+01*sinpar/parint
5556  v(2) = (0.8d+01*cospar+(par2+par2-0.8d+01)*sinpar/parint)/par2
5557  v(3) = (0.32d+02*(par2-0.12d+02)*cospar+(0.2d+01* &
5558  ((par2-0.80d+02)*par2+0.192d+03)*sinpar)/parint)/(par2*par2)
5559  ac = 0.8d+01*cospar
5560  as = 0.24d+02*parint*sinpar
5561  if( abs( parint).gt.0.24d+02) go to 30
5562 !
5563 ! compute the chebyshev moments as the solutions of a
5564 ! boundary value problem with 1 initial value (v(3)) and 1
5565 ! end value (computed using an asymptotic formula).
5566 !
5567  noequ = 25
5568  noeq1 = noequ-1
5569  an = 0.6d+01
5570 
5571  do k = 1,noeq1
5572  an2 = an*an
5573  d(k) = -0.2d+01*(an2-0.4d+01)*(par22-an2-an2)
5574  d2(k) = (an-0.1d+01)*(an-0.2d+01)*par2
5575  d1(k+1) = (an+0.3d+01)*(an+0.4d+01)*par2
5576  v(k+3) = as-(an2-0.4d+01)*ac
5577  an = an+0.2d+01
5578  end do
5579 
5580  an2 = an*an
5581  d(noequ) = -0.2d+01*(an2-0.4d+01)*(par22-an2-an2)
5582  v(noequ+3) = as-(an2-0.4d+01)*ac
5583  v(4) = v(4)-0.56d+02*par2*v(3)
5584  ass = parint*sinpar
5585  asap = (((((0.210d+03*par2-0.1d+01)*cospar-(0.105d+03*par2 &
5586  -0.63d+02)*ass)/an2-(0.1d+01-0.15d+02*par2)*cospar &
5587  +0.15d+02*ass)/an2-cospar+0.3d+01*ass)/an2-cospar)/an2
5588  v(noequ+3) = v(noequ+3)-0.2d+01*asap*par2*(an-0.1d+01)* &
5589  (an-0.2d+01)
5590 !
5591 ! solve the tridiagonal system by means of gaussian
5592 ! elimination with partial pivoting.
5593 !
5594  call dgtsl(noequ,d1,d,d2,v(4),iers)
5595  go to 50
5596 !
5597 ! compute the chebyshev moments by means of forward recursion.
5598 !
5599  30 an = 0.4d+01
5600 
5601  do i = 4,13
5602  an2 = an*an
5603  v(i) = ((an2-0.4d+01)*(0.2d+01*(par22-an2-an2)*v(i-1)-ac) &
5604  +as-par2*(an+0.1d+01)*(an+0.2d+01)*v(i-2))/ &
5605  (par2*(an-0.1d+01)*(an-0.2d+01))
5606  an = an+0.2d+01
5607  end do
5608 
5609  50 continue
5610 
5611  do j = 1,13
5612  chebmo(m,2*j-1) = v(j)
5613  end do
5614 !
5615 ! compute the chebyshev moments with respect to sine.
5616 !
5617  v(1) = 0.2d+01*(sinpar-parint*cospar)/par2
5618  v(2) = (0.18d+02-0.48d+02/par2)*sinpar/par2 &
5619  +(-0.2d+01+0.48d+02/par2)*cospar/parint
5620  ac = -0.24d+02*parint*cospar
5621  as = -0.8d+01*sinpar
5622  if( abs( parint).gt.0.24d+02) go to 80
5623 !
5624 ! compute the chebyshev moments as the solutions of a boundary
5625 ! value problem with 1 initial value (v(2)) and 1 end value
5626 ! (computed using an asymptotic formula).
5627 !
5628  an = 0.5d+01
5629 
5630  do k = 1,noeq1
5631  an2 = an*an
5632  d(k) = -0.2d+01*(an2-0.4d+01)*(par22-an2-an2)
5633  d2(k) = (an-0.1d+01)*(an-0.2d+01)*par2
5634  d1(k+1) = (an+0.3d+01)*(an+0.4d+01)*par2
5635  v(k+2) = ac+(an2-0.4d+01)*as
5636  an = an+0.2d+01
5637  end do
5638 
5639  an2 = an*an
5640  d(noequ) = -0.2d+01*(an2-0.4d+01)*(par22-an2-an2)
5641  v(noequ+2) = ac+(an2-0.4d+01)*as
5642  v(3) = v(3)-0.42d+02*par2*v(2)
5643  ass = parint*cospar
5644  asap = (((((0.105d+03*par2-0.63d+02)*ass+(0.210d+03*par2 &
5645  -0.1d+01)*sinpar)/an2+(0.15d+02*par2-0.1d+01)*sinpar- &
5646  0.15d+02*ass)/an2-0.3d+01*ass-sinpar)/an2-sinpar)/an2
5647  v(noequ+2) = v(noequ+2)-0.2d+01*asap*par2*(an-0.1d+01) &
5648  *(an-0.2d+01)
5649 !
5650 ! solve the tridiagonal system by means of gaussian
5651 ! elimination with partial pivoting.
5652 !
5653  call dgtsl(noequ,d1,d,d2,v(3),iers)
5654  go to 100
5655 !
5656 ! compute the chebyshev moments by means of forward recursion.
5657 !
5658  80 an = 0.3d+01
5659 
5660  do i = 3,12
5661  an2 = an*an
5662  v(i) = ((an2-0.4d+01)*(0.2d+01*(par22-an2-an2)*v(i-1)+as) &
5663  +ac-par2*(an+0.1d+01)*(an+0.2d+01)*v(i-2)) &
5664  /(par2*(an-0.1d+01)*(an-0.2d+01))
5665  an = an+0.2d+01
5666  end do
5667 
5668  100 continue
5669 
5670  do j = 1,12
5671  chebmo(m,2*j) = v(j)
5672  end do
5673 
5674  120 if (nrmom.lt.momcom) m = nrmom+1
5675  if (momcom.lt.(maxp1-1).and.nrmom.ge.momcom) momcom = momcom+1
5676 !
5677 ! compute the coefficients of the chebyshev expansions
5678 ! of degrees 12 and 24 of the function f.
5679 !
5680  fval(1) = 0.5d+00*f(centr+hlgth)
5681  fval(13) = f(centr)
5682  fval(25) = 0.5d+00*f(centr-hlgth)
5683  do i = 2,12
5684  isym = 26-i
5685  fval(i) = f(hlgth*x(i-1)+centr)
5686  fval(isym) = f(centr-hlgth*x(i-1))
5687  end do
5688  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
5689 !
5690 ! compute the integral and error estimates.
5691 !
5692  resc12 = cheb12(13)*chebmo(m,13)
5693  ress12 = 0.0d+00
5694  k = 11
5695  do j = 1,6
5696  resc12 = resc12+cheb12(k)*chebmo(m,k)
5697  ress12 = ress12+cheb12(k+1)*chebmo(m,k+1)
5698  k = k-2
5699  end do
5700  resc24 = cheb24(25)*chebmo(m,25)
5701  ress24 = 0.0d+00
5702  resabs = abs( cheb24(25))
5703  k = 23
5704  do j = 1,12
5705  resc24 = resc24+cheb24(k)*chebmo(m,k)
5706  ress24 = ress24+cheb24(k+1)*chebmo(m,k+1)
5707  resabs = abs( cheb24(k))+ abs( cheb24(k+1))
5708  k = k-2
5709  end do
5710  estc = abs( resc24-resc12)
5711  ests = abs( ress24-ress12)
5712  resabs = resabs* abs( hlgth)
5713  if(integr.eq.2) go to 160
5714  result = conc*resc24-cons*ress24
5715  abserr = abs( conc*estc)+ abs( cons*ests)
5716  go to 170
5717  160 result = conc*ress24+cons*resc24
5718  abserr = abs( conc*ests)+ abs( cons*estc)
5719  170 continue
5720 
5721  return
5722 end
5723 subroutine dqc25s(f,a,b,bl,br,alfa,beta,ri,rj,rg,rh,result, &
5724  abserr,resasc,integr,nev)
5725 
5726 !*****************************************************************************80
5727 !
5728 !! DQC25S returns rules for algebraico-logarithmic end point singularities.
5729 !
5730 ! Modified:
5731 !
5732 ! 11 September 2015
5733 !
5734 ! Author:
5735 !
5736 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
5737 !
5738 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f*w over (bl,br), with error
5739 ! estimate, where the weight function w has a singular
5740 ! behaviour of algebraico-logarithmic type at the points
5741 ! a and/or b. (bl,br) is a part of (a,b).
5742 !
5743 ! Parameters:
5744 !
5745 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
5746 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
5747 ! f(x). the actual name for f needs to be declared
5748 ! e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
5749 !
5750 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
5751 ! left end point of the original interval
5752 !
5753 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
5754 ! right end point of the original interval, b.gt.a
5755 !
5756 ! bl - real ( kind = 8 )
5757 ! lower limit of integration, bl.ge.a
5758 !
5759 ! br - real ( kind = 8 )
5760 ! upper limit of integration, br.le.b
5761 !
5762 ! alfa - real ( kind = 8 )
5763 ! parameter in the weight function
5764 !
5765 ! beta - real ( kind = 8 )
5766 ! parameter in the weight function
5767 !
5768 ! ri,rj,rg,rh - real ( kind = 8 )
5769 ! modified chebyshev moments for the application
5770 ! of the generalized clenshaw-curtis
5771 ! method (computed in routine dqmomo)
5772 !
5773 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
5774 ! approximation to the integral
5775 ! result is computed by using a generalized
5776 ! clenshaw-curtis method if b1 = a or br = b.
5777 ! in all other cases the 15-point kronrod
5778 ! rule is applied, obtained by optimal addition of
5779 ! abscissae to the 7-point gauss rule.
5780 !
5781 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
5782 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
5783 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
5784 !
5785 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
5786 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f*w-i/(b-a))
5787 !
5788 ! integr - integer ( kind = 4 )
5789 ! which determines the weight function
5790 ! = 1 w(x) = (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta
5791 ! = 2 w(x) = (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)
5792 ! = 3 w(x) = (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(b-x)
5793 ! = 4 w(x) = (x-a)**alfa*(b-x)**beta*log(x-a)*
5794 ! log(b-x)
5795 !
5796 ! nev - integer ( kind = 4 )
5797 ! number of integrand evaluations
5798 !
5799 ! Local Parameters:
5800 !
5801 ! the vector x contains the values cos(k*pi/24)
5802 ! k = 1, ..., 11, to be used for the computation of the
5803 ! chebyshev series expansion of f.
5804 !
5805 ! fval - value of the function f at the points
5806 ! (br-bl)*0.5*cos(k*pi/24)+(br+bl)*0.5
5807 ! k = 0, ..., 24
5808 ! cheb12 - coefficients of the chebyshev series expansion
5809 ! of degree 12, for the function f, in the
5810 ! interval (bl,br)
5811 ! cheb24 - coefficients of the chebyshev series expansion
5812 ! of degree 24, for the function f, in the
5813 ! interval (bl,br)
5814 ! res12 - approximation to the integral obtained from cheb12
5815 ! res24 - approximation to the integral obtained from cheb24
5816 ! dqwgts - external function subprogram defining
5817 ! the four possible weight functions
5818 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval (bl,br)
5819 ! centr - mid point of the interval (bl,br)
5820 !
5821  implicit none
5822 
5823  real ( kind = 8 ) a,abserr,alfa,b,beta,bl,br,centr,cheb12,cheb24, &
5824  dc,f,factor,fix,fval,hlgth,resabs,resasc,result,res12, &
5825  res24,rg,rh,ri,rj,u,dqwgts,x
5826  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,integr,isym,nev
5827 
5828  dimension cheb12(13),cheb24(25),fval(25),rg(25),rh(25),ri(25), &
5829  rj(25),x(11)
5830 
5831  external f,dqwgts
5832 
5833  data x(1) / 0.991444861373810411144557526928563d0 /
5834  data x(2) / 0.965925826289068286749743199728897d0 /
5835  data x(3) / 0.923879532511286756128183189396788d0 /
5836  data x(4) / 0.866025403784438646763723170752936d0 /
5837  data x(5) / 0.793353340291235164579776961501299d0 /
5838  data x(6) / 0.707106781186547524400844362104849d0 /
5839  data x(7) / 0.608761429008720639416097542898164d0 /
5840  data x(8) / 0.500000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
5841  data x(9) / 0.382683432365089771728459984030399d0 /
5842  data x(10) / 0.258819045102520762348898837624048d0 /
5843  data x(11) / 0.130526192220051591548406227895489d0 /
5844 
5845  nev = 25
5846  if(bl.eq.a.and.(alfa.ne.0.0d+00.or.integr.eq.2.or.integr.eq.4)) &
5847  go to 10
5848  if(br.eq.b.and.(beta.ne.0.0d+00.or.integr.eq.3.or.integr.eq.4)) &
5849  go to 140
5850 !
5851 ! if a.gt.bl and b.lt.br, apply the 15-point gauss-kronrod scheme.
5852 !
5853 !
5854  call dqk15w(f,dqwgts,a,b,alfa,beta,integr,bl,br, &
5855  result,abserr,resabs,resasc)
5856  nev = 15
5857  go to 270
5858 !
5859 ! this part of the program is executed only if a = bl.
5860 !
5861 ! compute the chebyshev series expansion of the
5862 ! following function
5863 ! f1 = (0.5*(b+b-br-a)-0.5*(br-a)*x)**beta
5864 ! *f(0.5*(br-a)*x+0.5*(br+a))
5865 !
5866  10 hlgth = 0.5d+00*(br-bl)
5867  centr = 0.5d+00*(br+bl)
5868  fix = b-centr
5869  fval(1) = 0.5d+00*f(hlgth+centr)*(fix-hlgth)**beta
5870  fval(13) = f(centr)*(fix**beta)
5871  fval(25) = 0.5d+00*f(centr-hlgth)*(fix+hlgth)**beta
5872  do i=2,12
5873  u = hlgth*x(i-1)
5874  isym = 26-i
5875  fval(i) = f(u+centr)*(fix-u)**beta
5876  fval(isym) = f(centr-u)*(fix+u)**beta
5877  end do
5878 
5879  factor = hlgth**(alfa+0.1d+01)
5880  result = 0.0d+00
5881  abserr = 0.0d+00
5882  res12 = 0.0d+00
5883  res24 = 0.0d+00
5884  if(integr.gt.2) go to 70
5885  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
5886 !
5887 ! integr = 1 (or 2)
5888 !
5889  do i=1,13
5890  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*ri(i)
5891  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*ri(i)
5892  end do
5893 
5894  do i=14,25
5895  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*ri(i)
5896  end do
5897 
5898  if(integr.eq.1) go to 130
5899 !
5900 ! integr = 2
5901 !
5902  dc = log(br-bl)
5903  result = res24*dc
5904  abserr = abs( (res24-res12)*dc)
5905  res12 = 0.0d+00
5906  res24 = 0.0d+00
5907  do i=1,13
5908  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rg(i)
5909  res24 = res12+cheb24(i)*rg(i)
5910  end do
5911  do i=14,25
5912  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rg(i)
5913  end do
5914  go to 130
5915 !
5916 ! compute the chebyshev series expansion of the
5917 ! following function
5918 ! f4 = f1*log(0.5*(b+b-br-a)-0.5*(br-a)*x)
5919 !
5920  70 fval(1) = fval(1)* log(fix-hlgth)
5921  fval(13) = fval(13)* log(fix)
5922  fval(25) = fval(25)* log(fix+hlgth)
5923  do i=2,12
5924  u = hlgth*x(i-1)
5925  isym = 26-i
5926  fval(i) = fval(i)* log(fix-u)
5927  fval(isym) = fval(isym)* log(fix+u)
5928  end do
5929  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
5930 !
5931 ! integr = 3 (or 4)
5932 !
5933  do i=1,13
5934  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*ri(i)
5935  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*ri(i)
5936  end do
5937 
5938  do i=14,25
5939  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*ri(i)
5940  end do
5941  if(integr.eq.3) go to 130
5942 !
5943 ! integr = 4
5944 !
5945  dc = log(br-bl)
5946  result = res24*dc
5947  abserr = abs( (res24-res12)*dc)
5948  res12 = 0.0d+00
5949  res24 = 0.0d+00
5950  do i=1,13
5951  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rg(i)
5952  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rg(i)
5953  end do
5954  do i=14,25
5955  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rg(i)
5956  end do
5957  130 result = (result+res24)*factor
5958  abserr = (abserr+ abs( res24-res12))*factor
5959  go to 270
5960 !
5961 ! this part of the program is executed only if b = br.
5962 !
5963 ! compute the chebyshev series expansion of the following function:
5964 !
5965 ! f2 = (0.5*(b+bl-a-a)+0.5*(b-bl)*x)**alfa*f(0.5*(b-bl)*x+0.5*(b+bl))
5966 !
5967  140 hlgth = 0.5d+00*(br-bl)
5968  centr = 0.5d+00*(br+bl)
5969  fix = centr-a
5970  fval(1) = 0.5d+00*f(hlgth+centr)*(fix+hlgth)**alfa
5971  fval(13) = f(centr)*(fix**alfa)
5972  fval(25) = 0.5d+00*f(centr-hlgth)*(fix-hlgth)**alfa
5973  do i=2,12
5974  u = hlgth*x(i-1)
5975  isym = 26-i
5976  fval(i) = f(u+centr)*(fix+u)**alfa
5977  fval(isym) = f(centr-u)*(fix-u)**alfa
5978  end do
5979  factor = hlgth**(beta+0.1d+01)
5980  result = 0.0d+00
5981  abserr = 0.0d+00
5982  res12 = 0.0d+00
5983  res24 = 0.0d+00
5984  if(integr.eq.2.or.integr.eq.4) go to 200
5985 !
5986 ! integr = 1 (or 3)
5987 !
5988  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
5989 
5990  do i=1,13
5991  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rj(i)
5992  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rj(i)
5993  end do
5994 
5995  do i=14,25
5996  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rj(i)
5997  end do
5998 
5999  if(integr.eq.1) go to 260
6000 !
6001 ! integr = 3
6002 !
6003  dc = log(br-bl)
6004  result = res24*dc
6005  abserr = abs( (res24-res12)*dc)
6006  res12 = 0.0d+00
6007  res24 = 0.0d+00
6008  do i=1,13
6009  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rh(i)
6010  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rh(i)
6011  end do
6012 
6013  do i=14,25
6014  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rh(i)
6015  end do
6016  go to 260
6017 !
6018 ! compute the chebyshev series expansion of the
6019 ! following function
6020 ! f3 = f2*log(0.5*(b-bl)*x+0.5*(b+bl-a-a))
6021 !
6022  200 fval(1) = fval(1)* log(hlgth+fix)
6023  fval(13) = fval(13)* log(fix)
6024  fval(25) = fval(25)* log(fix-hlgth)
6025  do i=2,12
6026  u = hlgth*x(i-1)
6027  isym = 26-i
6028  fval(i) = fval(i)* log(u+fix)
6029  fval(isym) = fval(isym)* log(fix-u)
6030  end do
6031  call dqcheb(x,fval,cheb12,cheb24)
6032 !
6033 ! integr = 2 (or 4)
6034 !
6035  do i=1,13
6036  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rj(i)
6037  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rj(i)
6038  end do
6039 
6040  do i=14,25
6041  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rj(i)
6042  end do
6043 
6044  if(integr.eq.2) go to 260
6045  dc = log(br-bl)
6046  result = res24*dc
6047  abserr = abs( (res24-res12)*dc)
6048  res12 = 0.0d+00
6049  res24 = 0.0d+00
6050 !
6051 ! integr = 4
6052 !
6053  do i=1,13
6054  res12 = res12+cheb12(i)*rh(i)
6055  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rh(i)
6056  end do
6057 
6058  do i=14,25
6059  res24 = res24+cheb24(i)*rh(i)
6060  end do
6061 
6062  260 result = (result+res24)*factor
6063  abserr = (abserr+ abs( res24-res12))*factor
6064  270 return
6065 end
6066 subroutine dqcheb ( x, fval, cheb12, cheb24 )
6067 
6068 !*****************************************************************************80
6069 !
6070 !! DQCHEB computes the Chebyshev series expansion.
6071 !
6072 ! Modified:
6073 !
6074 ! 11 September 2015
6075 !
6076 ! Author:
6077 !
6078 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6079 !
6080 !***purpose this routine computes the chebyshev series expansion
6081 ! of degrees 12 and 24 of a function using a
6082 ! fast fourier transform method
6083 ! f(x) = sum(k=1,..,13) (cheb12(k)*t(k-1,x)),
6084 ! f(x) = sum(k=1,..,25) (cheb24(k)*t(k-1,x)),
6085 ! where t(k,x) is the chebyshev polynomial of degree k.
6086 !
6087 ! Parameters:
6088 !
6089 ! on entry
6090 ! x - real ( kind = 8 )
6091 ! vector of dimension 11 containing the
6092 ! values cos(k*pi/24), k = 1, ..., 11
6093 !
6094 ! fval - real ( kind = 8 )
6095 ! vector of dimension 25 containing the
6096 ! function values at the points
6097 ! (b+a+(b-a)*cos(k*pi/24))/2, k = 0, ...,24,
6098 ! where (a,b) is the approximation interval.
6099 ! fval(1) and fval(25) are divided by two
6100 ! (these values are destroyed at output).
6101 !
6102 ! on return
6103 ! cheb12 - real ( kind = 8 )
6104 ! vector of dimension 13 containing the
6105 ! chebyshev coefficients for degree 12
6106 !
6107 ! cheb24 - real ( kind = 8 )
6108 ! vector of dimension 25 containing the
6109 ! chebyshev coefficients for degree 24
6110 !
6111  implicit none
6112 
6113  real ( kind = 8 ) alam,alam1,alam2,cheb12,cheb24,fval,part1,part2, &
6114  part3,v,x
6115  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,j
6116 
6117  dimension cheb12(13),cheb24(25),fval(25),v(12),x(11)
6118 
6119  do i=1,12
6120  j = 26-i
6121  v(i) = fval(i)-fval(j)
6122  fval(i) = fval(i)+fval(j)
6123  end do
6124 
6125  alam1 = v(1)-v(9)
6126  alam2 = x(6)*(v(3)-v(7)-v(11))
6127  cheb12(4) = alam1+alam2
6128  cheb12(10) = alam1-alam2
6129  alam1 = v(2)-v(8)-v(10)
6130  alam2 = v(4)-v(6)-v(12)
6131  alam = x(3)*alam1+x(9)*alam2
6132  cheb24(4) = cheb12(4)+alam
6133  cheb24(22) = cheb12(4)-alam
6134  alam = x(9)*alam1-x(3)*alam2
6135  cheb24(10) = cheb12(10)+alam
6136  cheb24(16) = cheb12(10)-alam
6137  part1 = x(4)*v(5)
6138  part2 = x(8)*v(9)
6139  part3 = x(6)*v(7)
6140  alam1 = v(1)+part1+part2
6141  alam2 = x(2)*v(3)+part3+x(10)*v(11)
6142  cheb12(2) = alam1+alam2
6143  cheb12(12) = alam1-alam2
6144  alam = x(1)*v(2)+x(3)*v(4)+x(5)*v(6)+x(7)*v(8) &
6145  +x(9)*v(10)+x(11)*v(12)
6146  cheb24(2) = cheb12(2)+alam
6147  cheb24(24) = cheb12(2)-alam
6148  alam = x(11)*v(2)-x(9)*v(4)+x(7)*v(6)-x(5)*v(8) &
6149  +x(3)*v(10)-x(1)*v(12)
6150  cheb24(12) = cheb12(12)+alam
6151  cheb24(14) = cheb12(12)-alam
6152  alam1 = v(1)-part1+part2
6153  alam2 = x(10)*v(3)-part3+x(2)*v(11)
6154  cheb12(6) = alam1+alam2
6155  cheb12(8) = alam1-alam2
6156  alam = x(5)*v(2)-x(9)*v(4)-x(1)*v(6) &
6157  -x(11)*v(8)+x(3)*v(10)+x(7)*v(12)
6158  cheb24(6) = cheb12(6)+alam
6159  cheb24(20) = cheb12(6)-alam
6160  alam = x(7)*v(2)-x(3)*v(4)-x(11)*v(6)+x(1)*v(8) &
6161  -x(9)*v(10)-x(5)*v(12)
6162  cheb24(8) = cheb12(8)+alam
6163  cheb24(18) = cheb12(8)-alam
6164 
6165  do i=1,6
6166  j = 14-i
6167  v(i) = fval(i)-fval(j)
6168  fval(i) = fval(i)+fval(j)
6169  end do
6170 
6171  alam1 = v(1)+x(8)*v(5)
6172  alam2 = x(4)*v(3)
6173  cheb12(3) = alam1+alam2
6174  cheb12(11) = alam1-alam2
6175  cheb12(7) = v(1)-v(5)
6176  alam = x(2)*v(2)+x(6)*v(4)+x(10)*v(6)
6177  cheb24(3) = cheb12(3)+alam
6178  cheb24(23) = cheb12(3)-alam
6179  alam = x(6)*(v(2)-v(4)-v(6))
6180  cheb24(7) = cheb12(7)+alam
6181  cheb24(19) = cheb12(7)-alam
6182  alam = x(10)*v(2)-x(6)*v(4)+x(2)*v(6)
6183  cheb24(11) = cheb12(11)+alam
6184  cheb24(15) = cheb12(11)-alam
6185 
6186  do i=1,3
6187  j = 8-i
6188  v(i) = fval(i)-fval(j)
6189  fval(i) = fval(i)+fval(j)
6190  end do
6191 
6192  cheb12(5) = v(1)+x(8)*v(3)
6193  cheb12(9) = fval(1)-x(8)*fval(3)
6194  alam = x(4)*v(2)
6195  cheb24(5) = cheb12(5)+alam
6196  cheb24(21) = cheb12(5)-alam
6197  alam = x(8)*fval(2)-fval(4)
6198  cheb24(9) = cheb12(9)+alam
6199  cheb24(17) = cheb12(9)-alam
6200  cheb12(1) = fval(1)+fval(3)
6201  alam = fval(2)+fval(4)
6202  cheb24(1) = cheb12(1)+alam
6203  cheb24(25) = cheb12(1)-alam
6204  cheb12(13) = v(1)-v(3)
6205  cheb24(13) = cheb12(13)
6206  alam = 0.1d+01/0.6d+01
6207 
6208  do i=2,12
6209  cheb12(i) = cheb12(i)*alam
6210  end do
6211 
6212  alam = 0.5d+00*alam
6213  cheb12(1) = cheb12(1)*alam
6214  cheb12(13) = cheb12(13)*alam
6215 
6216  do i=2,24
6217  cheb24(i) = cheb24(i)*alam
6218  end do
6219 
6220  cheb24(1) = 0.5d+00*alam*cheb24(1)
6221  cheb24(25) = 0.5d+00*alam*cheb24(25)
6222 
6223  return
6224 end
6225 subroutine dqelg ( n, epstab, result, abserr, res3la, nres )
6226 
6227 !*****************************************************************************80
6228 !
6229 !! DQELG carries out the Epsilon extrapolation algorithm.
6230 !
6231 ! Modified:
6232 !
6233 ! 11 September 2015
6234 !
6235 ! Author:
6236 !
6237 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6238 !
6239 !***purpose the routine determines the limit of a given sequence of
6240 ! approximations, by means of the epsilon algorithm of
6241 ! p.wynn. an estimate of the absolute error is also given.
6242 ! the condensed epsilon table is computed. only those
6243 ! elements needed for the computation of the next diagonal
6244 ! are preserved.
6245 !
6246 ! Parameters:
6247 !
6248 ! n - integer ( kind = 4 )
6249 ! epstab(n) contains the new element in the
6250 ! first column of the epsilon table.
6251 !
6252 ! epstab - real ( kind = 8 )
6253 ! vector of dimension 52 containing the elements
6254 ! of the two lower diagonals of the triangular
6255 ! epsilon table. the elements are numbered
6256 ! starting at the right-hand corner of the
6257 ! triangle.
6258 !
6259 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
6260 ! resulting approximation to the integral
6261 !
6262 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
6263 ! estimate of the absolute error computed from
6264 ! result and the 3 previous results
6265 !
6266 ! res3la - real ( kind = 8 )
6267 ! vector of dimension 3 containing the last 3
6268 ! results
6269 !
6270 ! nres - integer ( kind = 4 )
6271 ! number of calls to the routine
6272 ! (should be zero at first call)
6273 !
6274 ! Local Parameters:
6275 !
6276 ! e0 - the 4 elements on which the computation of a new
6277 ! e1 element in the epsilon table is based
6278 ! e2
6279 ! e3 e0
6280 ! e3 e1 new
6281 ! e2
6282 ! newelm - number of elements to be computed in the new
6283 ! diagonal
6284 ! error - error = abs(e1-e0)+abs(e2-e1)+abs(new-e2)
6285 ! result - the element in the new diagonal with least value
6286 ! of error
6287 !
6288 ! machine dependent constants
6289 !
6290 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
6291 ! oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
6292 ! limexp is the maximum number of elements the epsilon
6293 ! table can contain. if this number is reached, the upper
6294 ! diagonal of the epsilon table is deleted.
6295 !
6296  implicit none
6297 
6298  real ( kind = 8 ) abserr,delta1,delta2,delta3, &
6299  epmach,epsinf,epstab,error,err1,err2,err3,e0,e1,e1abs,e2,e3, &
6300  oflow,res,result,res3la,ss,tol1,tol2,tol3
6301  integer ( kind = 4 ) i,ib,ib2,ie,indx,k1,k2,k3,limexp,n,newelm
6302  integer ( kind = 4 ) nres
6303  integer ( kind = 4 ) num
6304  dimension epstab(52),res3la(3)
6305 
6306  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
6307  oflow = huge( oflow )
6308  nres = nres+1
6309  abserr = oflow
6310  result = epstab(n)
6311  if(n.lt.3) go to 100
6312  limexp = 50
6313  epstab(n+2) = epstab(n)
6314  newelm = (n-1)/2
6315  epstab(n) = oflow
6316  num = n
6317  k1 = n
6318 
6319  do 40 i = 1,newelm
6320 
6321  k2 = k1-1
6322  k3 = k1-2
6323  res = epstab(k1+2)
6324  e0 = epstab(k3)
6325  e1 = epstab(k2)
6326  e2 = res
6327  e1abs = abs( e1)
6328  delta2 = e2-e1
6329  err2 = abs( delta2)
6330  tol2 = max( abs( e2),e1abs)*epmach
6331  delta3 = e1 - e0
6332  err3 = abs( delta3)
6333  tol3 = max( e1abs, abs( e0))*epmach
6334  if(err2.gt.tol2.or.err3.gt.tol3) go to 10
6335 !
6336 ! if e0, e1 and e2 are equal to machine accuracy, convergence is assumed.
6337 !
6338  result = res
6339  abserr = err2+err3
6340  go to 100
6341  10 e3 = epstab(k1)
6342  epstab(k1) = e1
6343  delta1 = e1-e3
6344  err1 = abs( delta1)
6345  tol1 = max( e1abs, abs( e3))*epmach
6346 !
6347 ! if two elements are very close to each other, omit
6348 ! a part of the table by adjusting the value of n
6349 !
6350  if(err1.le.tol1.or.err2.le.tol2.or.err3.le.tol3) go to 20
6351  ss = 0.1d+01/delta1+0.1d+01/delta2-0.1d+01/delta3
6352  epsinf = abs( ss*e1)
6353 !
6354 ! test to detect irregular behaviour in the table, and
6355 ! eventually omit a part of the table adjusting the value
6356 ! of n.
6357 !
6358  if(epsinf.gt.0.1d-03) go to 30
6359  20 n = i+i-1
6360  go to 50
6361 !
6362 ! compute a new element and eventually adjust
6363 ! the value of result.
6364 !
6365  30 res = e1+0.1d+01/ss
6366  epstab(k1) = res
6367  k1 = k1-2
6368  error = err2 + abs( res-e2 ) + err3
6369 
6370  if ( error .le. abserr ) then
6371  abserr = error
6372  result = res
6373  end if
6374 
6375  40 continue
6376 !
6377 ! shift the table.
6378 !
6379  50 if(n.eq.limexp) n = 2*(limexp/2)-1
6380  ib = 1
6381  if((num/2)*2.eq.num) ib = 2
6382  ie = newelm+1
6383  do i=1,ie
6384  ib2 = ib+2
6385  epstab(ib) = epstab(ib2)
6386  ib = ib2
6387  end do
6388  if(num.eq.n) go to 80
6389  indx = num-n+1
6390  do i = 1,n
6391  epstab(i)= epstab(indx)
6392  indx = indx+1
6393  end do
6394  80 if(nres.ge.4) go to 90
6395  res3la(nres) = result
6396  abserr = oflow
6397  go to 100
6398 !
6399 ! compute error estimate
6400 !
6401  90 abserr = abs( result-res3la(3))+ abs( result-res3la(2)) &
6402  + abs( result-res3la(1))
6403  res3la(1) = res3la(2)
6404  res3la(2) = res3la(3)
6405  res3la(3) = result
6406  100 continue
6407 
6408  abserr = max( abserr, 0.5d+01*epmach* abs( result))
6409 
6410  return
6411 end
6412 subroutine dqk15(f,a,b,result,abserr,resabs,resasc)
6413 
6414 !*****************************************************************************80
6415 !
6416 !! DQK15 carries out a 15 point Gauss-Kronrod quadrature rule.
6417 !
6418 ! the abscissae and weights are given for the interval (-1,1).
6419 ! because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and their
6420 ! corresponding weights are given.
6421 !
6422 ! xgk - abscissae of the 15-point kronrod rule
6423 ! xgk(2), xgk(4), ... abscissae of the 7-point
6424 ! gauss rule
6425 ! xgk(1), xgk(3), ... abscissae which are optimally
6426 ! added to the 7-point gauss rule
6427 !
6428 ! wgk - weights of the 15-point kronrod rule
6429 !
6430 ! wg - weights of the 7-point gauss rule
6431 !
6432 !
6433 ! gauss quadrature weights and kronron quadrature abscissae and weights
6434 ! as evaluated with 80 decimal digit arithmetic by l. w. fullerton,
6435 ! bell labs, nov. 1981.
6436 !
6437 ! Modified:
6438 !
6439 ! 11 September 2015
6440 !
6441 ! Author:
6442 !
6443 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6444 !
6445 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f over (a,b), with error
6446 ! estimate
6447 ! j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b)
6448 ! Parameters:
6449 !
6450 ! on entry
6451 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
6452 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
6453 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
6454 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the calling program.
6455 !
6456 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
6457 ! lower limit of integration
6458 !
6459 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
6460 ! upper limit of integration
6461 !
6462 ! on return
6463 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
6464 ! approximation to the integral i
6465 ! result is computed by applying the 15-point
6466 ! kronrod rule (resk) obtained by optimal addition
6467 ! of abscissae to the7-point gauss rule(resg).
6468 !
6469 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
6470 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
6471 ! which should not exceed abs(i-result)
6472 !
6473 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
6474 ! approximation to the integral j
6475 !
6476 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
6477 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
6478 ! over (a,b)
6479 !
6480 ! Local Parameters:
6481 !
6482 ! centr - mid point of the interval
6483 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
6484 ! absc - abscissa
6485 ! fval* - function value
6486 ! resg - result of the 7-point gauss formula
6487 ! resk - result of the 15-point kronrod formula
6488 ! reskh - approximation to the mean value of f over (a,b),
6489 ! i.e. to i/(b-a)
6490 !
6491 ! machine dependent constants
6492 !
6493 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
6494 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
6495 !
6496  implicit none
6497 
6498  real ( kind = 8 ) a,absc,abserr,b,centr,dhlgth, &
6499  epmach,f,fc,fsum,fval1,fval2,fv1,fv2,hlgth,resabs,resasc, &
6500  resg,resk,reskh,result,uflow,wg,wgk,xgk
6501  integer ( kind = 4 ) j,jtw,jtwm1
6502  external f
6503  dimension fv1(7),fv2(7),wg(4),wgk(8),xgk(8)
6504 
6505  data wg( 1) / 0.129484966168869693270611432679082d0 /
6506  data wg( 2) / 0.279705391489276667901467771423780d0 /
6507  data wg( 3) / 0.381830050505118944950369775488975d0 /
6508  data wg( 4) / 0.417959183673469387755102040816327d0 /
6509 
6510  data xgk( 1) / 0.991455371120812639206854697526329d0 /
6511  data xgk( 2) / 0.949107912342758524526189684047851d0 /
6512  data xgk( 3) / 0.864864423359769072789712788640926d0 /
6513  data xgk( 4) / 0.741531185599394439863864773280788d0 /
6514  data xgk( 5) / 0.586087235467691130294144838258730d0 /
6515  data xgk( 6) / 0.405845151377397166906606412076961d0 /
6516  data xgk( 7) / 0.207784955007898467600689403773245d0 /
6517  data xgk( 8) / 0.000000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
6518 
6519  data wgk( 1) / 0.022935322010529224963732008058970d0 /
6520  data wgk( 2) / 0.063092092629978553290700663189204d0 /
6521  data wgk( 3) / 0.104790010322250183839876322541518d0 /
6522  data wgk( 4) / 0.140653259715525918745189590510238d0 /
6523  data wgk( 5) / 0.169004726639267902826583426598550d0 /
6524  data wgk( 6) / 0.190350578064785409913256402421014d0 /
6525  data wgk( 7) / 0.204432940075298892414161999234649d0 /
6526  data wgk( 8) / 0.209482141084727828012999174891714d0 /
6527 
6528  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
6529  uflow = tiny( uflow )
6530  centr = 0.5d+00*(a+b)
6531  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
6532  dhlgth = abs( hlgth)
6533 !
6534 ! compute the 15-point kronrod approximation to
6535 ! the integral, and estimate the absolute error.
6536 !
6537  fc = f(centr)
6538  resg = fc*wg(4)
6539  resk = fc*wgk(8)
6540  resabs = abs( resk)
6541 
6542  do j=1,3
6543  jtw = j*2
6544  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtw)
6545  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
6546  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
6547  fv1(jtw) = fval1
6548  fv2(jtw) = fval2
6549  fsum = fval1+fval2
6550  resg = resg+wg(j)*fsum
6551  resk = resk+wgk(jtw)*fsum
6552  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtw)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
6553  end do
6554 
6555  do j = 1,4
6556  jtwm1 = j*2-1
6557  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtwm1)
6558  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
6559  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
6560  fv1(jtwm1) = fval1
6561  fv2(jtwm1) = fval2
6562  fsum = fval1+fval2
6563  resk = resk+wgk(jtwm1)*fsum
6564  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtwm1)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
6565  end do
6566 
6567  reskh = resk*0.5d+00
6568  resasc = wgk(8)* abs( fc-reskh)
6569  do j=1,7
6570  resasc = resasc+wgk(j)*( abs( fv1(j)-reskh)+ abs( fv2(j)-reskh))
6571  end do
6572 
6573  result = resk*hlgth
6574  resabs = resabs*dhlgth
6575  resasc = resasc*dhlgth
6576  abserr = abs( (resk-resg)*hlgth)
6577  if(resasc.ne.0.0d+00.and.abserr.ne.0.0d+00) &
6578  abserr = resasc* min(0.1d+01,(0.2d+03*abserr/resasc)**1.5d+00)
6579  if(resabs.gt.uflow/(0.5d+02*epmach)) abserr = max &
6580  ((epmach*0.5d+02)*resabs,abserr)
6581 
6582  return
6583 end
6584 subroutine dqk15i(f,boun,inf,a,b,result,abserr,resabs,resasc)
6585 
6586 !*****************************************************************************80
6587 !
6588 !! DQK15I applies a 15 point Gauss-Kronrod quadrature on an infinite interval.
6589 !
6590 !
6591 ! the abscissae and weights are supplied for the interval
6592 ! (-1,1). because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and
6593 ! their corresponding weights are given.
6594 !
6595 ! xgk - abscissae of the 15-point kronrod rule
6596 ! xgk(2), xgk(4), ... abscissae of the 7-point
6597 ! gauss rule
6598 ! xgk(1), xgk(3), ... abscissae which are optimally
6599 ! added to the 7-point gauss rule
6600 !
6601 ! wgk - weights of the 15-point kronrod rule
6602 !
6603 ! wg - weights of the 7-point gauss rule, corresponding
6604 ! to the abscissae xgk(2), xgk(4), ...
6605 ! wg(1), wg(3), ... are set to zero.
6606 !
6607 ! Modified:
6608 !
6609 ! 11 September 2015
6610 !
6611 ! Author:
6612 !
6613 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6614 !
6615 !***purpose the original (infinite integration range is mapped
6616 ! onto the interval (0,1) and (a,b) is a part of (0,1).
6617 ! it is the purpose to compute
6618 ! i = integral of transformed integrand over (a,b),
6619 ! j = integral of abs(transformed integrand) over (a,b).
6620 !
6621 ! Parameters:
6622 !
6623 ! on entry
6624 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
6625 ! fuction subprogram defining the integrand
6626 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
6627 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the calling program.
6628 !
6629 ! boun - real ( kind = 8 )
6630 ! finite bound of original integration
6631 ! range (set to zero if inf = +2)
6632 !
6633 ! inf - integer ( kind = 4 )
6634 ! if inf = -1, the original interval is
6635 ! (-infinity,bound),
6636 ! if inf = +1, the original interval is
6637 ! (bound,+infinity),
6638 ! if inf = +2, the original interval is
6639 ! (-infinity,+infinity) and
6640 ! the integral is computed as the sum of two
6641 ! integrals, one over (-infinity,0) and one over
6642 ! (0,+infinity).
6643 !
6644 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
6645 ! lower limit for integration over subrange
6646 ! of (0,1)
6647 !
6648 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
6649 ! upper limit for integration over subrange
6650 ! of (0,1)
6651 !
6652 ! on return
6653 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
6654 ! approximation to the integral i
6655 ! result is computed by applying the 15-point
6656 ! kronrod rule(resk) obtained by optimal addition
6657 ! of abscissae to the 7-point gauss rule(resg).
6658 !
6659 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
6660 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
6661 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
6662 !
6663 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
6664 ! approximation to the integral j
6665 !
6666 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
6667 ! approximation to the integral of
6668 ! abs((transformed integrand)-i/(b-a)) over (a,b)
6669 !
6670 ! Local Parameters:
6671 !
6672 ! centr - mid point of the interval
6673 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
6674 ! absc* - abscissa
6675 ! tabsc* - transformed abscissa
6676 ! fval* - function value
6677 ! resg - result of the 7-point gauss formula
6678 ! resk - result of the 15-point kronrod formula
6679 ! reskh - approximation to the mean value of the transformed
6680 ! integrand over (a,b), i.e. to i/(b-a)
6681 !
6682 ! machine dependent constants
6683 !
6684 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
6685 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
6686 !
6687  implicit none
6688 
6689  real ( kind = 8 ) a,absc,absc1,absc2,abserr,b,boun,centr,dinf, &
6690  epmach,f,fc,fsum,fval1,fval2,fv1,fv2,hlgth, &
6691  resabs,resasc,resg,resk,reskh,result,tabsc1,tabsc2,uflow,wg,wgk, &
6692  xgk
6693  integer ( kind = 4 ) inf,j
6694  external f
6695  dimension fv1(7),fv2(7),xgk(8),wgk(8),wg(8)
6696 
6697  data wg(1) / 0.0d0 /
6698  data wg(2) / 0.129484966168869693270611432679082d0 /
6699  data wg(3) / 0.0d0 /
6700  data wg(4) / 0.279705391489276667901467771423780d0 /
6701  data wg(5) / 0.0d0 /
6702  data wg(6) / 0.381830050505118944950369775488975d0 /
6703  data wg(7) / 0.0d0 /
6704  data wg(8) / 0.417959183673469387755102040816327d0 /
6705 
6706  data xgk(1) / 0.991455371120812639206854697526329d0 /
6707  data xgk(2) / 0.949107912342758524526189684047851d0 /
6708  data xgk(3) / 0.864864423359769072789712788640926d0 /
6709  data xgk(4) / 0.741531185599394439863864773280788d0 /
6710  data xgk(5) / 0.586087235467691130294144838258730d0 /
6711  data xgk(6) / 0.405845151377397166906606412076961d0 /
6712  data xgk(7) / 0.207784955007898467600689403773245d0 /
6713  data xgk(8) / 0.000000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
6714 
6715  data wgk(1) / 0.022935322010529224963732008058970d0 /
6716  data wgk(2) / 0.063092092629978553290700663189204d0 /
6717  data wgk(3) / 0.104790010322250183839876322541518d0 /
6718  data wgk(4) / 0.140653259715525918745189590510238d0 /
6719  data wgk(5) / 0.169004726639267902826583426598550d0 /
6720  data wgk(6) / 0.190350578064785409913256402421014d0 /
6721  data wgk(7) / 0.204432940075298892414161999234649d0 /
6722  data wgk(8) / 0.209482141084727828012999174891714d0 /
6723 
6724  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
6725  uflow = tiny( uflow )
6726  dinf = min( 1, inf )
6727  centr = 0.5d+00*(a+b)
6728  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
6729  tabsc1 = boun+dinf*(0.1d+01-centr)/centr
6730  fval1 = f(tabsc1)
6731  if(inf.eq.2) fval1 = fval1+f(-tabsc1)
6732  fc = (fval1/centr)/centr
6733 !
6734 ! compute the 15-point kronrod approximation to
6735 ! the integral, and estimate the error.
6736 !
6737  resg = wg(8)*fc
6738  resk = wgk(8)*fc
6739  resabs = abs( resk)
6740 
6741  do j=1,7
6742  absc = hlgth*xgk(j)
6743  absc1 = centr-absc
6744  absc2 = centr+absc
6745  tabsc1 = boun+dinf*(0.1d+01-absc1)/absc1
6746  tabsc2 = boun+dinf*(0.1d+01-absc2)/absc2
6747  fval1 = f(tabsc1)
6748  fval2 = f(tabsc2)
6749  if(inf.eq.2) fval1 = fval1+f(-tabsc1)
6750  if(inf.eq.2) fval2 = fval2+f(-tabsc2)
6751  fval1 = (fval1/absc1)/absc1
6752  fval2 = (fval2/absc2)/absc2
6753  fv1(j) = fval1
6754  fv2(j) = fval2
6755  fsum = fval1+fval2
6756  resg = resg+wg(j)*fsum
6757  resk = resk+wgk(j)*fsum
6758  resabs = resabs+wgk(j)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
6759  end do
6760 
6761  reskh = resk*0.5d+00
6762  resasc = wgk(8)* abs( fc-reskh)
6763 
6764  do j=1,7
6765  resasc = resasc+wgk(j)*( abs( fv1(j)-reskh)+ abs( fv2(j)-reskh))
6766  end do
6767 
6768  result = resk*hlgth
6769  resasc = resasc*hlgth
6770  resabs = resabs*hlgth
6771  abserr = abs( (resk-resg)*hlgth)
6772  if(resasc.ne.0.0d+00.and.abserr.ne.0.d0) abserr = resasc* &
6773  min(0.1d+01,(0.2d+03*abserr/resasc)**1.5d+00)
6774  if(resabs.gt.uflow/(0.5d+02*epmach)) abserr = max &
6775  ((epmach*0.5d+02)*resabs,abserr)
6776 
6777  return
6778 end
6779 subroutine dqk15w(f,w,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp,a,b,result,abserr, resabs,resasc)
6780 
6781 !*****************************************************************************80
6782 !
6783 !! DQK15W applies a 15 point Gauss-Kronrod rule for a weighted integrand.
6784 !
6785 ! Modified:
6786 !
6787 ! 11 September 2015
6788 !
6789 ! Author:
6790 !
6791 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6792 !
6793 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f*w over (a,b), with error
6794 ! estimate
6795 ! j = integral of abs(f*w) over (a,b)
6796 !
6797 ! Parameters:
6798 !
6799 ! on entry
6800 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
6801 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
6802 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
6803 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
6804 !
6805 ! w - real ( kind = 8 )
6806 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
6807 ! weight function w(x). the actual name for w
6808 ! needs to be declared e x t e r n a l in the
6809 ! calling program.
6810 !
6811 ! p1, p2, p3, p4 - real ( kind = 8 )
6812 ! parameters in the weight function
6813 !
6814 ! kp - integer ( kind = 4 )
6815 ! key for indicating the type of weight function
6816 !
6817 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
6818 ! lower limit of integration
6819 !
6820 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
6821 ! upper limit of integration
6822 !
6823 ! on return
6824 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
6825 ! approximation to the integral i
6826 ! result is computed by applying the 15-point
6827 ! kronrod rule (resk) obtained by optimal addition
6828 ! of abscissae to the 7-point gauss rule (resg).
6829 !
6830 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
6831 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
6832 ! which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
6833 !
6834 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
6835 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f)
6836 !
6837 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
6838 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
6839 !
6840 ! Local Parameters:
6841 !
6842 ! the abscissae and weights are given for the interval (-1,1).
6843 ! because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and their
6844 ! corresponding weights are given.
6845 !
6846 ! xgk - abscissae of the 15-point gauss-kronrod rule
6847 ! xgk(2), xgk(4), ... abscissae of the 7-point
6848 ! gauss rule
6849 ! xgk(1), xgk(3), ... abscissae which are optimally
6850 ! added to the 7-point gauss rule
6851 !
6852 ! wgk - weights of the 15-point gauss-kronrod rule
6853 !
6854 ! wg - weights of the 7-point gauss rule
6855 !
6856 ! centr - mid point of the interval
6857 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
6858 ! absc* - abscissa
6859 ! fval* - function value
6860 ! resg - result of the 7-point gauss formula
6861 ! resk - result of the 15-point kronrod formula
6862 ! reskh - approximation to the mean value of f*w over (a,b),
6863 ! i.e. to i/(b-a)
6864 !
6865 ! machine dependent constants
6866 !
6867 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
6868 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
6869 !
6870  implicit none
6871 
6872  real ( kind = 8 ) a,absc,absc1,absc2,abserr,b,centr,dhlgth, &
6873  epmach,f,fc,fsum,fval1,fval2,fv1,fv2,hlgth, &
6874  p1,p2,p3,p4,resabs,resasc,resg,resk,reskh,result,uflow,w,wg,wgk, &
6875  xgk
6876  integer ( kind = 4 ) j,jtw,jtwm1,kp
6877  external f,w
6878 
6879  dimension fv1(7),fv2(7),xgk(8),wgk(8),wg(4)
6880 
6881  data xgk(1),xgk(2),xgk(3),xgk(4),xgk(5),xgk(6),xgk(7),xgk(8)/ &
6882  0.9914553711208126d+00, 0.9491079123427585d+00, &
6883  0.8648644233597691d+00, 0.7415311855993944d+00, &
6884  0.5860872354676911d+00, 0.4058451513773972d+00, &
6885  0.2077849550078985d+00, 0.0000000000000000d+00/
6886 
6887  data wgk(1),wgk(2),wgk(3),wgk(4),wgk(5),wgk(6),wgk(7),wgk(8)/ &
6888  0.2293532201052922d-01, 0.6309209262997855d-01, &
6889  0.1047900103222502d+00, 0.1406532597155259d+00, &
6890  0.1690047266392679d+00, 0.1903505780647854d+00, &
6891  0.2044329400752989d+00, 0.2094821410847278d+00/
6892 
6893  data wg(1),wg(2),wg(3),wg(4)/ &
6894  0.1294849661688697d+00, 0.2797053914892767d+00, &
6895  0.3818300505051889d+00, 0.4179591836734694d+00/
6896 
6897  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
6898  uflow = tiny( uflow )
6899  centr = 0.5d+00*(a+b)
6900  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
6901  dhlgth = abs( hlgth)
6902 !
6903 ! compute the 15-point kronrod approximation to the
6904 ! integral, and estimate the error.
6905 !
6906  fc = f(centr)*w(centr,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp)
6907  resg = wg(4)*fc
6908  resk = wgk(8)*fc
6909  resabs = abs( resk)
6910 
6911  do j=1,3
6912  jtw = j*2
6913  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtw)
6914  absc1 = centr-absc
6915  absc2 = centr+absc
6916  fval1 = f(absc1)*w(absc1,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp)
6917  fval2 = f(absc2)*w(absc2,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp)
6918  fv1(jtw) = fval1
6919  fv2(jtw) = fval2
6920  fsum = fval1+fval2
6921  resg = resg+wg(j)*fsum
6922  resk = resk+wgk(jtw)*fsum
6923  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtw)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
6924  end do
6925 
6926  do j=1,4
6927  jtwm1 = j*2-1
6928  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtwm1)
6929  absc1 = centr-absc
6930  absc2 = centr+absc
6931  fval1 = f(absc1)*w(absc1,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp)
6932  fval2 = f(absc2)*w(absc2,p1,p2,p3,p4,kp)
6933  fv1(jtwm1) = fval1
6934  fv2(jtwm1) = fval2
6935  fsum = fval1+fval2
6936  resk = resk+wgk(jtwm1)*fsum
6937  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtwm1)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
6938  end do
6939 
6940  reskh = resk*0.5d+00
6941  resasc = wgk(8)* abs( fc-reskh)
6942 
6943  do j=1,7
6944  resasc = resasc+wgk(j)*( abs( fv1(j)-reskh)+ abs( fv2(j)-reskh))
6945  end do
6946 
6947  result = resk*hlgth
6948  resabs = resabs*dhlgth
6949  resasc = resasc*dhlgth
6950  abserr = abs( (resk-resg)*hlgth)
6951  if(resasc.ne.0.0d+00.and.abserr.ne.0.0d+00) &
6952  abserr = resasc* min(0.1d+01,(0.2d+03*abserr/resasc)**1.5d+00)
6953  if(resabs.gt.uflow/(0.5d+02*epmach)) abserr = max( (epmach* &
6954  0.5d+02)*resabs,abserr)
6955 
6956  return
6957 end
6958 subroutine dqk21(f,a,b,result,abserr,resabs,resasc)
6959 
6960 !*****************************************************************************80
6961 !
6962 !! DQK21 carries out a 21 point Gauss-Kronrod quadrature rule.
6963 !
6964 ! Modified:
6965 !
6966 ! 11 September 2015
6967 !
6968 ! Author:
6969 !
6970 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
6971 !
6972 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f over (a,b), with error
6973 ! estimate
6974 ! j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b)
6975 !
6976 ! Parameters:
6977 !
6978 ! on entry
6979 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
6980 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
6981 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
6982 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
6983 !
6984 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
6985 ! lower limit of integration
6986 !
6987 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
6988 ! upper limit of integration
6989 !
6990 ! on return
6991 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
6992 ! approximation to the integral i
6993 ! result is computed by applying the 21-point
6994 ! kronrod rule (resk) obtained by optimal addition
6995 ! of abscissae to the 10-point gauss rule (resg).
6996 !
6997 ! abserr - real ( kind = 8 )
6998 ! estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
6999 ! which should not exceed abs(i-result)
7000 !
7001 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
7002 ! approximation to the integral j
7003 !
7004 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
7005 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
7006 ! over (a,b)
7007 !
7008 ! Local Parameters:
7009 !
7010 !
7011 ! the abscissae and weights are given for the interval (-1,1).
7012 ! because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and their
7013 ! corresponding weights are given.
7014 !
7015 ! xgk - abscissae of the 21-point kronrod rule
7016 ! xgk(2), xgk(4), ... abscissae of the 10-point
7017 ! gauss rule
7018 ! xgk(1), xgk(3), ... abscissae which are optimally
7019 ! added to the 10-point gauss rule
7020 !
7021 ! wgk - weights of the 21-point kronrod rule
7022 !
7023 ! wg - weights of the 10-point gauss rule
7024 !
7025 !
7026 ! gauss quadrature weights and kronron quadrature abscissae and weights
7027 ! as evaluated with 80 decimal digit arithmetic by l. w. fullerton,
7028 ! bell labs, nov. 1981.
7029 !
7030 ! centr - mid point of the interval
7031 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
7032 ! absc - abscissa
7033 ! fval* - function value
7034 ! resg - result of the 10-point gauss formula
7035 ! resk - result of the 21-point kronrod formula
7036 ! reskh - approximation to the mean value of f over (a,b),
7037 ! i.e. to i/(b-a)
7038 !
7039 !
7040 ! machine dependent constants
7041 !
7042 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
7043 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
7044 !
7045  implicit none
7046 
7047  real ( kind = 8 ) a,absc,abserr,b,centr,dhlgth, &
7048  epmach,f,fc,fsum,fval1,fval2,fv1,fv2,hlgth,resabs,resasc, &
7049  resg,resk,reskh,result,uflow,wg,wgk,xgk
7050  integer ( kind = 4 ) j,jtw,jtwm1
7051  external f
7052  dimension fv1(10),fv2(10),wg(5),wgk(11),xgk(11)
7053 
7054  data wg( 1) / 0.066671344308688137593568809893332d0 /
7055  data wg( 2) / 0.149451349150580593145776339657697d0 /
7056  data wg( 3) / 0.219086362515982043995534934228163d0 /
7057  data wg( 4) / 0.269266719309996355091226921569469d0 /
7058  data wg( 5) / 0.295524224714752870173892994651338d0 /
7059 
7060  data xgk( 1) / 0.995657163025808080735527280689003d0 /
7061  data xgk( 2) / 0.973906528517171720077964012084452d0 /
7062  data xgk( 3) / 0.930157491355708226001207180059508d0 /
7063  data xgk( 4) / 0.865063366688984510732096688423493d0 /
7064  data xgk( 5) / 0.780817726586416897063717578345042d0 /
7065  data xgk( 6) / 0.679409568299024406234327365114874d0 /
7066  data xgk( 7) / 0.562757134668604683339000099272694d0 /
7067  data xgk( 8) / 0.433395394129247190799265943165784d0 /
7068  data xgk( 9) / 0.294392862701460198131126603103866d0 /
7069  data xgk( 10) / 0.148874338981631210884826001129720d0 /
7070  data xgk( 11) / 0.000000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
7071 
7072  data wgk( 1) / 0.011694638867371874278064396062192d0 /
7073  data wgk( 2) / 0.032558162307964727478818972459390d0 /
7074  data wgk( 3) / 0.054755896574351996031381300244580d0 /
7075  data wgk( 4) / 0.075039674810919952767043140916190d0 /
7076  data wgk( 5) / 0.093125454583697605535065465083366d0 /
7077  data wgk( 6) / 0.109387158802297641899210590325805d0 /
7078  data wgk( 7) / 0.123491976262065851077958109831074d0 /
7079  data wgk( 8) / 0.134709217311473325928054001771707d0 /
7080  data wgk( 9) / 0.142775938577060080797094273138717d0 /
7081  data wgk( 10) / 0.147739104901338491374841515972068d0 /
7082  data wgk( 11) / 0.149445554002916905664936468389821d0 /
7083 
7084  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
7085  uflow = tiny( uflow )
7086  centr = 0.5d+00*(a+b)
7087  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
7088  dhlgth = abs( hlgth)
7089 !
7090 ! compute the 21-point kronrod approximation to
7091 ! the integral, and estimate the absolute error.
7092 !
7093  resg = 0.0d+00
7094  fc = f(centr)
7095  resk = wgk(11)*fc
7096  resabs = abs( resk)
7097  do j=1,5
7098  jtw = 2*j
7099  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtw)
7100  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
7101  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
7102  fv1(jtw) = fval1
7103  fv2(jtw) = fval2
7104  fsum = fval1+fval2
7105  resg = resg+wg(j)*fsum
7106  resk = resk+wgk(jtw)*fsum
7107  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtw)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
7108  end do
7109 
7110  do j = 1,5
7111  jtwm1 = 2*j-1
7112  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtwm1)
7113  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
7114  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
7115  fv1(jtwm1) = fval1
7116  fv2(jtwm1) = fval2
7117  fsum = fval1+fval2
7118  resk = resk+wgk(jtwm1)*fsum
7119  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtwm1)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
7120  end do
7121 
7122  reskh = resk*0.5d+00
7123  resasc = wgk(11)* abs( fc-reskh)
7124 
7125  do j=1,10
7126  resasc = resasc+wgk(j)*( abs( fv1(j)-reskh)+ abs( fv2(j)-reskh))
7127  end do
7128 
7129  result = resk*hlgth
7130  resabs = resabs*dhlgth
7131  resasc = resasc*dhlgth
7132  abserr = abs( (resk-resg)*hlgth)
7133  if(resasc.ne.0.0d+00.and.abserr.ne.0.0d+00) &
7134  abserr = resasc*min(0.1d+01,(0.2d+03*abserr/resasc)**1.5d+00)
7135  if(resabs.gt.uflow/(0.5d+02*epmach)) abserr = max &
7136  ((epmach*0.5d+02)*resabs,abserr)
7137 
7138  return
7139 end
7140 subroutine dqk31(f,a,b,result,abserr,resabs,resasc)
7141 
7142 !*****************************************************************************80
7143 !
7144 !! DQK31 carries out a 31 point Gauss-Kronrod quadrature rule.
7145 !
7146 ! Modified:
7147 !
7148 ! 11 September 2015
7149 !
7150 ! Author:
7151 !
7152 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
7153 !
7154 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f over (a,b) with error
7155 ! estimate
7156 ! j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b)
7157 !
7158 ! Parameters:
7159 !
7160 ! on entry
7161 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
7162 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
7163 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
7164 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the calling program.
7165 !
7166 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
7167 ! lower limit of integration
7168 !
7169 ! b - real ( kind = 8 )
7170 ! upper limit of integration
7171 !
7172 ! on return
7173 ! result - real ( kind = 8 )
7174 ! approximation to the integral i
7175 ! result is computed by applying the 31-point
7176 ! gauss-kronrod rule (resk), obtained by optimal
7177 ! addition of abscissae to the 15-point gauss
7178 ! rule (resg).
7179 !
7180 ! abserr - double precison
7181 ! estimate of the modulus of the modulus,
7182 ! which should not exceed abs(i-result)
7183 !
7184 ! resabs - real ( kind = 8 )
7185 ! approximation to the integral j
7186 !
7187 ! resasc - real ( kind = 8 )
7188 ! approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
7189 ! over (a,b)
7190 !
7191 ! Local Parameters:
7192 !
7193 !
7194 ! the abscissae and weights are given for the interval (-1,1).
7195 ! because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and their
7196 ! corresponding weights are given.
7197 !
7198 ! xgk - abscissae of the 31-point kronrod rule
7199 ! xgk(2), xgk(4), ... abscissae of the 15-point
7200 ! gauss rule
7201 ! xgk(1), xgk(3), ... abscissae which are optimally
7202 ! added to the 15-point gauss rule
7203 !
7204 ! wgk - weights of the 31-point kronrod rule
7205 !
7206 ! wg - weights of the 15-point gauss rule
7207 !
7208 !
7209 ! gauss quadrature weights and kronron quadrature abscissae and weights
7210 ! as evaluated with 80 decimal digit arithmetic by l. w. fullerton,
7211 ! bell labs, nov. 1981.
7212 !
7213 ! centr - mid point of the interval
7214 ! hlgth - half-length of the interval
7215 ! absc - abscissa
7216 ! fval* - function value
7217 ! resg - result of the 15-point gauss formula
7218 ! resk - result of the 31-point kronrod formula
7219 ! reskh - approximation to the mean value of f over (a,b),
7220 ! i.e. to i/(b-a)
7221 !
7222 ! machine dependent constants
7223 !
7224 ! epmach is the largest relative spacing.
7225 ! uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
7226 !
7227  implicit none
7228 
7229  real ( kind = 8 ) a,absc,abserr,b,centr,dhlgth, &
7230  epmach,f,fc,fsum,fval1,fval2,fv1,fv2,hlgth,resabs,resasc, &
7231  resg,resk,reskh,result,uflow,wg,wgk,xgk
7232  integer ( kind = 4 ) j,jtw,jtwm1
7233  external f
7234 
7235  dimension fv1(15),fv2(15),xgk(16),wgk(16),wg(8)
7236 
7237  data wg( 1) / 0.030753241996117268354628393577204d0 /
7238  data wg( 2) / 0.070366047488108124709267416450667d0 /
7239  data wg( 3) / 0.107159220467171935011869546685869d0 /
7240  data wg( 4) / 0.139570677926154314447804794511028d0 /
7241  data wg( 5) / 0.166269205816993933553200860481209d0 /
7242  data wg( 6) / 0.186161000015562211026800561866423d0 /
7243  data wg( 7) / 0.198431485327111576456118326443839d0 /
7244  data wg( 8) / 0.202578241925561272880620199967519d0 /
7245 
7246  data xgk( 1) / 0.998002298693397060285172840152271d0 /
7247  data xgk( 2) / 0.987992518020485428489565718586613d0 /
7248  data xgk( 3) / 0.967739075679139134257347978784337d0 /
7249  data xgk( 4) / 0.937273392400705904307758947710209d0 /
7250  data xgk( 5) / 0.897264532344081900882509656454496d0 /
7251  data xgk( 6) / 0.848206583410427216200648320774217d0 /
7252  data xgk( 7) / 0.790418501442465932967649294817947d0 /
7253  data xgk( 8) / 0.724417731360170047416186054613938d0 /
7254  data xgk( 9) / 0.650996741297416970533735895313275d0 /
7255  data xgk( 10) / 0.570972172608538847537226737253911d0 /
7256  data xgk( 11) / 0.485081863640239680693655740232351d0 /
7257  data xgk( 12) / 0.394151347077563369897207370981045d0 /
7258  data xgk( 13) / 0.299180007153168812166780024266389d0 /
7259  data xgk( 14) / 0.201194093997434522300628303394596d0 /
7260  data xgk( 15) / 0.101142066918717499027074231447392d0 /
7261  data xgk( 16) / 0.000000000000000000000000000000000d0 /
7262 
7263  data wgk( 1) / 0.005377479872923348987792051430128d0 /
7264  data wgk( 2) / 0.015007947329316122538374763075807d0 /
7265  data wgk( 3) / 0.025460847326715320186874001019653d0 /
7266  data wgk( 4) / 0.035346360791375846222037948478360d0 /
7267  data wgk( 5) / 0.044589751324764876608227299373280d0 /
7268  data wgk( 6) / 0.053481524690928087265343147239430d0 /
7269  data wgk( 7) / 0.062009567800670640285139230960803d0 /
7270  data wgk( 8) / 0.069854121318728258709520077099147d0 /
7271  data wgk( 9) / 0.076849680757720378894432777482659d0 /
7272  data wgk( 10) / 0.083080502823133021038289247286104d0 /
7273  data wgk( 11) / 0.088564443056211770647275443693774d0 /
7274  data wgk( 12) / 0.093126598170825321225486872747346d0 /
7275  data wgk( 13) / 0.096642726983623678505179907627589d0 /
7276  data wgk( 14) / 0.099173598721791959332393173484603d0 /
7277  data wgk( 15) / 0.100769845523875595044946662617570d0 /
7278  data wgk( 16) / 0.101330007014791549017374792767493d0 /
7279 
7280  epmach = epsilon( epmach )
7281  uflow = tiny( uflow )
7282  centr = 0.5d+00*(a+b)
7283  hlgth = 0.5d+00*(b-a)
7284  dhlgth = abs( hlgth)
7285 !
7286 ! compute the 31-point kronrod approximation to
7287 ! the integral, and estimate the absolute error.
7288 !
7289  fc = f(centr)
7290  resg = wg(8)*fc
7291  resk = wgk(16)*fc
7292  resabs = abs( resk)
7293 
7294  do j=1,7
7295  jtw = j*2
7296  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtw)
7297  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
7298  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
7299  fv1(jtw) = fval1
7300  fv2(jtw) = fval2
7301  fsum = fval1+fval2
7302  resg = resg+wg(j)*fsum
7303  resk = resk+wgk(jtw)*fsum
7304  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtw)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
7305  end do
7306 
7307  do j = 1,8
7308  jtwm1 = j*2-1
7309  absc = hlgth*xgk(jtwm1)
7310  fval1 = f(centr-absc)
7311  fval2 = f(centr+absc)
7312  fv1(jtwm1) = fval1
7313  fv2(jtwm1) = fval2
7314  fsum = fval1+fval2
7315  resk = resk+wgk(jtwm1)*fsum
7316  resabs = resabs+wgk(jtwm1)*( abs( fval1)+ abs( fval2))
7317  end do
7318 
7319  reskh = resk*0.5d+00
7320  resasc = wgk(16)* abs( fc-reskh)
7321 
7322  do j=1,15
7323  resasc = resasc+wgk(j)*( abs( fv1(j)-reskh)+ abs( fv2(j)-reskh))
7324  end do
7325 
7326  result = resk*hlgth
7327  resabs = resabs*dhlgth
7328  resasc = resasc*dhlgth
7329  abserr = abs( (resk-resg)*hlgth)
7330  if(resasc.ne.0.0d+00.and.abserr.ne.0.0d+00) &
7331  abserr = resasc* min(0.1d+01,(0.2d+03*abserr/resasc)**1.5d+00)
7332  if(resabs.gt.uflow/(0.5d+02*epmach)) abserr = max &
7333  ((epmach*0.5d+02)*resabs,abserr)
7334 
7335  return
7336 end
7337 subroutine dqk41 ( f, a, b, result, abserr, resabs, resasc )
7338 
7339 !*****************************************************************************80
7340 !
7341 !! DQK41 carries out a 41 point Gauss-Kronrod quadrature rule.
7342 !
7343 ! Modified:
7344 !
7345 ! 11 September 2015
7346 !
7347 ! Author:
7348 !
7349 ! Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker
7350 !
7351 !***purpose to compute i = integral of f over (a,b), with error
7352 ! estimate
7353 ! j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b)
7354 !
7355 ! Parameters:
7356 !
7357 ! on entry
7358 ! f - real ( kind = 8 )
7359 ! function subprogram defining the integrand
7360 ! function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
7361 ! declared e x t e r n a l in the calling program.
7362 !
7363 ! a - real ( kind = 8 )
